loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two bags of flour, two tins of oil, yeast, sugar and baking powder

loans.name: Ching's Group

texts.en:
Nine people make up this village bank loan. Mr. Ching, who was born in 1961, is a village bank president. He was selected to be the village bank president by the other members of the group. 

Mr. Ching's wife, Mrs. Yeoun, was born in 1962. She stays at home and cooks the family's meals. This couple has eight children; four are seamstresses in the garment factories and the others attend the local school.

Mr. Ching is a motorbike taxi driver who is able to earn a small income to help support his family. He wants to buy a motorcycle for his children to ride to work, but he doesn’t have enough money to buy it. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings to purchase a new motorcycle for his children's transportation.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle for his children's transportation

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mariée à un professeur, Mme Afi est revendeuse de poissons  frais. Elle est mère de 03 enfants. Elle vend à toutes personnes depuis 2001. Elle revend au marché de Kégué  après avoir acheté  au Bénin. Mme Afi sollicite ce premier prêt pour acheter des poissons frais pour revendre à ses nombreux clients afin d’avoir de bénéfices pour  s’occuper de ses enfants et  aider son mari dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Afi is married to a professor, and resells fresh fish. She's the mother of three children. She sells to anyone since 2001, at the market in Kégué. She gets her supplies in Benin.

Mrs. Afi is seeking this first loan to buy fresh fish to resell to her numerous customers, in order to generate profits to take care of her children and help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea S. is 49 years old and is a domestic farmer who lives in the province of Kompong Cham, which is the best territory for farming. She owns a plot of farmland that she inherited from her grandmother. Chea uses this land to grow rice and peanuts to sell. Her husband supports her in her farming business. The couple has five single children, three of whom are employed in Thailand while the others still study in a local school. 

Because her farm is outside of a watering system, Chea is requesting a loan to dig an irrigation well. She plans to use the remainder of her loan to purchase some planks to enlarge her house.

loans.use: to dig an irrigation well and increase the size of her house

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 39 years old.  She lives in Sinkor and has three children, two girls and one boy, all between 6 and 16 years old. She is a single mother who was not able to attend school. She's maK. an effort to send all her children to school. 

Since 2003 she has been preparing and selling cooked food. She started selling food by herself in the street close to a school. Because many children would buy from her, the school principal asked her to prepare food at the school's cafeteria. She applied for the job and has held it since 2004. She's proud to be in business because she can send her children to school and have some savings. 

Rebecca has requested a loan to purchase oil, rice, juice, drinks, a box of biscuits and other food items. Her plan for the business is to offer soft drinks in the near future. She also wants to learn to do other things like maK. soap and designing and maK. clothes.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, juice, drinks, a box of biscuits and other food items

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members. Mrs. Pov, a married woman who was born in 1971, is a group leader. She was selected to be the group leader by the other members of the group.

Mrs. Pov is a farmer who owns a 1.50 hectare plot of land which she uses to grow rice for a living. Her husband, who was born in 1975, is a fisherman who is able to earn a small income to help support his family. He also helps his wife with farming. With her husband fishing, Mrs. Pov would like to ask for a loan to buy a fishing boat for her husband. 

This couple has three children; two are attending the local school and the youngest one is a year old.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat

loans.name: Norkobil

texts.en:
K. Norkobil is 48 years old. He is an optimistic and hard-working husband. He works his land with love and dedication every day, so that it produces excellent crops. Norkobil has been in agribusiness for more than 11 years. He draws strength and vitality from making his products the best in the city. His loving sons are also engaged in this business. Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and time-consuming job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest. He is planning to fix his house and save enough money for the well-being of his family. For this purpose he is requesting a loan of 5500 Somoni.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To buy fuel and lubricants, mineral fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 33 years old and married.  She lives in Sinkor. Her husband is a driver and they have two children aged 13 and 7; both are attending school. 

For four years Sarah has been selling fufu, a staple food in many African countries, and palm oil. She wasn't able to attend school and says this is a business she can understand. She started her business with money from a savings club, or susu. She likes being in business because she is able to save and do things by herself. 

Sarah has requested a loan to purchase fufu and palm oil. In the future, she wants to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fufu and palm oil

loans.name: Korn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. K., born in 1967, was selected to be the village bank president by the other members of this eight-member village bank loan. She and her husband, Mr. Seng. who was born in 1968, are farmers who own 3-hectare plot of land upon which they grow rice and corn for their family living. Mrs. K. would like to request a loan to buy gasoline and fertilizers to support her crops. She and her husband also earn additional income by fishing.

This couple has five children, two of whom are seamstresses in the garment factories, while the others are students who also help in their parents' businesses.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and fertilizers to support her crops.

loans.name: Hodari Group

texts.fr: Bachinyunjuze S. est entrepreneur, conseillère du groupe d’affaire «Hodari »,  âgée de 49 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants dont 5 enfants étudient et 3 ont volontairement quitté l’école. Son mari est un chômeur, sans emploi. La cliente Bachinyunjuze S. est vendeuse des bassins plastics au long de boulevard commercial de Birere, parfois à l’entrée de son  avenue.  Environs  5 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle démarra son business avec  le premier crédit reçu de l’IMF Hekima vers 2006. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec les bassins plastics (1 bandale bassin de marque Nyota, 1 bandale bassin Melan, 1 bandale bassin de  bébé, 1 bandale gobelets, djag, plats, cuvettes, etc.) En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants et les vêtir confortablement.  La cliente Bachinyunjuze S.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire «  Hodari » est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en:
Bachinyunjuze S. is an entrepreneur and advisor to the business group Hodari, which is composed mainly of women. She is 49 years old, married, and the mother of eight children, five of whom attend school while the other three have chosen to quit. Her husband is unemployed. 

Bachinyunjuze S. sells plastic containers along the commercial boulevard of Birere, and sometimes also at the entrance to her street. She has approximately five years of experience in this activity. She started her business with her first loan from the Hekima MFI in 2006. 

She will use this new loan to stock up on plastics containers (one pack of Nyota containers, one pack of Melan containers, one pack of baby basins, one pack of cups, as well as plates, bowls, etc.).

She also plans to expand her business, provide her children with an education, and clothe them comfortably. 

Bachinyunjuze S. wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for helping the less fortunate who cannot turn to traditional banks.

loans.use: to buy one pack of Nyota containers, one pack of Melan containers,one pack of baby basins, one pack of cups, and some plates, bowls, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Kurbon

texts.en: F. Kurbon is married and has four children. He is a hardworking and honest man engaged in a pharmacy business. He works very hard because he is the only breadwinner in his family; his wife is a housewife. He must earn money for feeding his family and for the education of his children. He serves his clients with love and wishes them to be healthy. Kurbon would like to get a loan of 1,300 USD for purchasing medicine to increase his assortment of goods, which will allow him to get a good profit. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy medicine to increase assortment of goods

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur is married with a 6-year-old daughter, Karina. He lives in Kamenka. Arthur grows early spring vegetables to support himself and his family. He owns 2 greenhouses. Arthur launched this farming enterprise 10 years ago and has invested 50,000 Grivnyas in this business. His annual expenses for seeds and plastic film amount to 23,000 Grivnyas. 

Arthur is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase and plant 3,500 tomato seedlings which are 3.5 Grivnyas per piece. His own greenhouses don’t have a heating system yet which is why Arthur didn’t take risks growing seedlings in his own greenhouses. Next year he is hoping to install heating units in the greenhouses. Arthur is very enterprising. He doesn’t want to stop at what he has achieved. He is planning to continue growing his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tomato seedlings

loans.name: Sreang's Group

texts.en: The ten people we see here are members of a loan group led by Mrs. Sreang, who was born in 1971, is married and has two children, one of whom is old enough to attend a local school. Her husband, Mr. Ky, was born in 1980, works in construction and earns a small income which he uses to help support his family. Mrs. Sreang is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows rice. She will use her portion of this loan to buy piglets to breed and feed for them to eat.

loans.use: to buy baby pigs and food for them to eat.

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi lives in Vodyanoye and earns his living growing tomatoes in greenhouses. He owns 4 big greenhouses and 2 separate ones for seedlings. Yuryi has been in the farming business for 6 years. He has already invested about 100,000 grivnyas in his venture. His annual expenses on seeds and film amount to 45,000 grivnyas.

Yuryi is requesting a 10,000 grivnya loan to invest in farming supplies he will use this season. He is planning to spend 3,000 grivnyas on fertilizers and chemicals, 2,000 grivnyas on polyethylene film, 4,000 grivnyas on coal to keep the greenhouses warm and 1,000 grivnyas on wood. This type of business is very prospective for this region, which is why Yuryi is planning to continue growing it by expanding his greenhouses and constructing new ones in the future.

loans.use: to purchase plastic film, fertilizers, wood and coal for greenhouses

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en: The eight people we see here are part of a loan group led by Mrs. Chea, who was born in 1965. Her husband, Mr. Seang, was born in 1959 and makes a living by driving a motorcycle. They have three children, two of whom are laborers while the third attends a local school. Mrs. Chea helps support her family by selling soup in a local market. Her business is doing well, and she plans use her portion of this loan to buy more of the ingredients she needs to make soup to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to expand a small business selling home-made soup.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan S., 36, is a resident of Kompong Cham Province. She is a local farmer who grows rice crop on her existing farmland. She is married to Chan Vibol, 29, who is a driver, and they have three single children. One of their children earns a living by repairing radios and television sets. To improve her family's comfort, Phan S. has decided to apply for a Kiva loan.  She will add the loan to her personal savings to build a new wooden house that is bigger than the family's current house.

loans.use: to build a new wooden house that is bigger than the family's current house.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with a grown daughter, Adelina. He is a farming entrepreneur from Kamenka who grows tomatoes. He owns 4 spacious greenhouses. He plants 7,000 high-growing tomatoes annually. He has been working in this sphere for 15 years. Alexander has invested about 100,000 grivnyas in his venture. Annually he spends about 43,000 grivnyas on seeds and polyethylene film. 

Alexander is requesting a loan of 15,000 grivnyas to purchase fertilizers, polyethylene film and to install a drip irrigation unit in his greenhouses. He is planning to spend 7,000 grivnyas on fertilizers, 5,000 grivnyas on plastic protection film and 2,000 grivnyas on a drip irrigation unit. In the future Alexander is hoping to extend his greenhouse for seedlings which would allow him to grow better quality plants. Some of his long-term plans include construction of two more greenhouses and installation of a heating system in them.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, plastic film and a drip irrigation unit

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Mère de 05 enfants, Mme Awa est revendeuse de céréales (mil, mais, sorgho…). Son mari est chauffeur. Il ya 11ans qu’elle a démarré l’activité. Elle achète des céréales au marché de Kégué et revend au même lieu. Ce prêt lui servira à acheter des céréales pour revendre afin d’assurer  l’avenir de  ses enfants et aider en partie son mari.
texts.en: The mother of 5 children, Mrs. Awa is a retailer of cereals (millet, corn, sorghum...). Her husband is a driver. She has been involved in this business for 11 years. She buys cereals at the Kégué market and re-sells at the same place. This loan will allow her to buy cereals for resale so that she can provide for her children's future and be of some help to her husband.

loans.use: to buy cereals (corn, beans and millet)

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married and lives in Novomoskovsk. Yelena sells electric appliances in the central marketplace of her home town. She offers a variety of irons, tea kettles, TV sets and other appliances. Yelena started the business over 3 years ago with the help of her husband. A favorable location of her vending facility in a busy part of the market, as well as affordable prices, were the factors that caused the growth of her venture. Yelena receives 10,000 grivnyas of income every month. 

Yelena is seeking a loan of 20,000 grivnyas to purchase small appliances for the summer tourist season, i.e. water-coolers, electric heaters, flasks, hot food containers, etc. She is planning to re-invest any generated income in further development of her enterprise. Yelena and her husband have recently purchased a small private house. They are now in the process of remodeling it.

loans.use: to purchase assorted small appliances for retail sale

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay C. is a 45-year-old farmer who lives in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She is married to Hout Chea, age 47. This couple, pictured above, works together in the farming business.  They have four children: three of the children are single and one is married.

Lay C. raises piglets and she had hoped to sell them to buyers four months after she began raising them. Unfortunately, the pigs are not big enough, due to the lack of food. To help solve this problem, Lay C. has requested a loan that she will use to buy sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs.

loans.use: to buy sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs.

loans.name: Pen's Group

texts.en: In this photo we see the 15 members of this loan group, which is led by Mrs. Lay. She is married, was born in 1982 and has three children, one of whom is old enough to attend the local school. Her husband, Mr. Brac, was born in 1980 and makes a living by driving a motorbike. Mrs. Lay is not currently employed and has applied for this loan to go into the livestock business by buying a female pig and raising its young.

loans.use: to buy a female pig for breeding.

loans.name: Afiwa Justine

texts.fr: Mère de 02 enfants, Mme Justine Afiwa est mariée à un comptable et est âgée de 40ans. Elle aime rendre belle toutes personnes c’est pour cela elle se donne à cette activité (vente de pagnes, produits de beauté…) depuis 2004. Elle achète ses produits au Grand Marché de Lomé et revend dans une boutique.  Elle est à son premier prêt et veut cet argent pour acheter des pagnes, des produits de beauté pour revendre à ses clients afin d’avoir du profit pour préparer son avenir assurer une bonne condition de vie à ses enfants et participer en partie à la charge de la famille.
texts.en: The mother of two children, Mrs   Justine Afiwa is married to an accountant and is 40 years old. She  likes to make people look beautiful which is why she has been in this business (the sale of traditional dress and beauty products)since  2004.She buys her stock at the Lome Grand Market and sells them in a shop. This is her first loan and she wants the money to buy pagnes and beauty products to sell to her customers in order to make a profit to prepare her future, give her children good living conditions, and participate in the family expenses.

loans.use: Purchase traditional clothing and beauty products

loans.name: Soem

texts.en: Soem K. is a 39-year-old farmer and mother. She was blessed with a child who attends the public high school. She is married but she divorced from her husband for many years ago. Soem K. inherited the farmland where she and her husband grow different kinds of crop on it. In the past, Soem K. always hired the neighbor’s cow to plow the farmland. Right now, she hopes to buy her own cow but she doesn’t have enough money to buy. So Soem K. is seeking for a loan from Kiva to buy a two cows, she can use it to supporting her in farming business.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Yanyan Assana

texts.fr: Agée de 55ans, Mme Assana est mère de 03 enfants et est veuve.  Elle vend les produits chimiques depuis 12ans à Hédzranawoé  après achat à SPROCA (une société de vente de produits chimiques).   Elle veut  assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants vue quelle est veuve, avoir son  propre terrain et plus tard sa propre maison et ajouter une autre activité à la première.
texts.en: Mrs Assana is 55 years old, she is the mother of 03 children and a widow. She has been selling chemicals for 12 years at Hédzranawoé  having purchased them at SPROCA ( a company that sells chemical products).She wants to  provide a better future for her children because she is a widow, obtain her own land and later on her own house and add a another business activity to the first commerce.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr: Chauffeur de profession, Mr  Kokouvi est  né en 1962, marié à une revendeuse et est père de 04 enfants.  Son activité de chauffeur ne prospère pas comme il le souhaite et il a décidé d’avoir une boutique en 2008 pour  revendre des produits de cafeteriat (lait, sucre, nescafé, lipton, riz, huile végétale…). Il s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend dans sa boutique. Ce second prêt lui servira à acheter des produits  afin de renforcer son activité et avoir une boutique plus grande pour pouvoir satisfaire ses nombreuses clients et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: A driver by profession, Mr Kokouvi was born in 1962, is married to a retailer, and is the father of 04 children. His activity as a driver is not as successful as he would like and he decided to open a shop in 2008 for the sale of cafeteria products (milk, sugar, instant coffee, tea, rice, vegetable oil...).He buys his produce at the big market in Lome and sells them at his shop. This second loan will be used to purchase stock in order to reinforce his business activity and increase the size of his shop  to satisfy his numerous customers and better provide for his family.

loans.use: Purchase cafeteria products ( milk, sugar,nescafé)

loans.name: Djamilatou

texts.fr: Madame Djamilatou est célibataire et à 35ans. Elle réside à Nukafu (un quartier de Lomé). Elle achète depuis 2007 des bijoux, des produits cosmétiques et des médicaments  à Lomé et revend au marché de Hédzranawoé.  Ce prêt lui servira à acheter des bijoux, des produits cosmétiques et médicaments afin de revendre pour accroître du profit et assurer son avenir.
texts.en:
Mrs. Djamilatou is 35 years old and single. She lives in Nukafu (a district of Lomé). 

In 2007, she started buying jewelry, cosmetics and medication in Lomé, which she sells at the Hédzranawoé market. 

She will use this loan to buy jewelry, cosmetics and medication for resale in order to increase her profits and provide for her future.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, cosmetics, and medication for resale

loans.name: Tukhtakhon

texts.en:
Tukhtakhon works in a very successful women's clothing business. She operates a sales location where she offers a selection of kid’s clothes that is always in demand. Tukhtakhon's business has a long history. She was able to start this venture 17 years ago and since that time her business has done quite well. Tukhtakhon is quite an entrepreneur and we are happy that she has chosen to apply her talents in a business that helps women be even prettier. 

Tukhtakhon has requested a loan of 10,000 TJS to give her more working capital to use in her business. It will be exciting to see how Tukhtakhon's enterprise will continue to grow in the future as she's off to even greater success. The loan will help Tukhtakhon develop her business and support her family. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is married with one son. He sells various types of children's clothing. Said has been in this business for 19 years. During this time, he was able to gain a large base of repeat clients. Said has a nice selection of items he offers for sale. He has many loyal customers who trust him and always come back for quality and durable clothes and shoes when they shop at the market. Said is a hardworking person. He wants to develop his business further. Said would like to receive 8,000 TJS to increase his assortment of clothing for sale. He hopes to receive additional income and improve his family's living conditions.

And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy new clothing

loans.name: Nazar

texts.en:
Nazar O. is married and has two daughters. He is 68 years old. He is engaged in a pharmacy business. His wife is a housewife. Previously, Nazar worked for a salary. But when he received a loan from Imon International, Nazar resumed his pharmacy business and opened his own drugstore. His daughters happily help him in this business. He has been running the pharmacy for 30 years and has a lot of experience. Nazar would like to get a loan of 10,000 TJS to open a new drugstore and expand his pharmacy business.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to open a new pharmacy

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
V. Hamza sells spare parts for cars. He has been in this business for 16 years and is an experienced entrepreneur. His kiosk is located in a good location where many people pass by. Hamza is very disciplined and hardworking. He also knows how to listen to people and build good relationships. He started his business because he wanted to be financially independent from the government and other employers. He has an analytical mind and is always thinking of ways to develop his business. Hamza has applied for a loan to generate more income and invest in new ideas. He understands that in business one always needs to adjust and change to be successful.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 40-year-old married woman who lives in the Sinkor Area. Her husband is a businessman and they have four children between the ages of 5 and 20, three of whom attend school.

Sarah has been operating her charcoal business for the past five years. She enjoys doing this business because she makes a lot of profit. Sarah is requesting a loan to purchase 150 bags of charcoal for her business. She hopes to have her own coal warehouse in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 150 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Bendu is 28 years old and lives in the Sinkor area. She has only sixth grade education and is married, with two children aged 2 and 6, one of whom is currently in school.

Bendu has been selling food items such as pepper, onions, spices, etc, for the past 4 years. She likes her business because it makes her independent and she can do things on her own. Bendu is requesting a loan to purchase more onions, rice, pepper, salt, etc. She hopes to buy land and build her own house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, rice, pepper, salt, etc.

loans.name: Miatta

texts.en: Miatta is a 54-year-old married woman with three children. She sells local foodstuff and operates a guesthouse business. She started business in 2004, using initial capital from her personal savings. Miatta needs a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to buy drinks and local foodstuff. She is hardworking and honest. Miatta thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy foodstuff for her business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 47 years old and lives in the Sinkor area. She’s married with 3 children between the ages of 21 and 30. Her husband is a local contractor who works as a welder. Two of her children are presently working, while the other one is still in school.

Lucy operates a small food stall and sells pepper, oil, bitter ball, gari and charcoal. She’s requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, bitter ball, gari and other food items for her business. She wants to improve her house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, bitter ball, gari and other food items for her business

loans.name: Raufjon

texts.en:
Raufjon K. is 40 years old. He has 6 years of experience in the beef business. His wife is a housekeeper and Raufjon is the sole breadwinner in his family. Due to this way of life, this father works hard every day to support his family with the best quality of life he can afford. His butcher shop supplies large amounts of meat to the population that resides in their region. Raufjon buys cattle in the market and sells their fresh meat daily to his customers. Due to high demand, this man seeks a loan of 10,000 TJS to invest in more cattle so he can have enough product to meet his customers' demands.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Amour De L’Eternel Gbetagbo Group

texts.fr: AMOUR DE L’ETERNEL GBETAGBO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent ensemble dans le même quartier. La présidente du groupe, Nina Mathilde (dont le doigt est levé sur la photo), est née le 12 Mars 1972 à Abomey ville historique du Bénin. Nina Mathilde est mariée à un enseignant du  nom de Zépherin. Le couple a deux enfants à charge, tous scolarisés mais qui ne sont pas leurs propres enfants. Il y a près de sept ans que Nina Mathilde vit au quartier Gbétagbo dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi avec sa famille. Nina Mathilde est allée à l’école jusqu’au secondaire. Pour se prendre en charge et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Nina Mathilde  mène comme activité depuis dix huit ans la vente de friperies. De façon secondaire, Nina Mathilde vend des merceries, ce qui lui permet de diversifier ses sources de revenus. Nina Mathilde achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Nina Mathilde sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui lui permettra de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
AMOUR DE L’ETERNEL GBETAGBO is a group of three people whose members live in the same neighborhood. Nina Mathilde, president of the group (seen in the photo with her hand raised), was born March 12, 1972 in Abomey, a historic city of Benin. 

Nina Mathilde is married to a teacher named Zépherin. The couple has two dependent children who are not their own. Both children attend school. Nina Mathilde and her family have been living in the district of Bgétagbo, in Abomey Calavi, for nearly seven years. 

Nina Mathilde went to high school. In order to support herself and provide for her children, she sells used clothing, an activity started 18 years ago. She also sells sewing supplies as a means of diversifying her sources of income. She buys her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. 

This is her second time requesting a loan from ALIDé to help strengthen her business and better meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing for resale

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 32-year-old lady living in Sinkor. She’s married and has three children between the ages of 4 and 12 years old. They all attend school.

Rebecca has had a used-clothing business for the past 6 years. She experiences low sales at times, but makes more money during Christmas. Rebecca is requesting a loan to purchase more cartons of used clothing. She hopes to be a successful business woman in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cartons of used clothing

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 45 years old,  a widow and has seven children between the ages of 12 and 23. All her children live at home with her.
For three years she has been selling bread, oil sugar and other food items. She started the business with money from her late husband. Sarah likes to be in business because she is responsible for it and to make it work. 
Sarah has requested a loan to purchase more bread, oil, sugar, rice and other products. She wants to save money so that in the future she can have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more bread, oil, sugar, rice and other products

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en: This is 42 year-old Rugiatu B..  She is married and has 2 children aged 6 and 8 years. In 2006, Rugiatu established her drinks and spring water business. She began her business because she needed to assist her husband to support their children. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 300,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Rugiatu requires a loan in order to buy assorted soft drinks and spring water by bundles for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 100,000. In the future, Rugiatu plans to grow her business to the point of it becoming a wholesale business and to buy a piece of land for building their family house.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy stock of drinks and pure water for her  business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more drinks for his business and top-up cards for mobile phones

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 31 years old is married and her husband has a business. They have one 16 year old child who is going to school but lives with her mother.  
For 7 years Josephine has been in business. She has a table in the market where she sells oil, rice, bath soap and other dry products. She started the business with money from her husband and she likes being able to save money for herself. 
Josephine has requested a loan to purchase rice, oil, soap and other goods to sell. In the future, she wants to save enough money to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, soap and other goods to sell

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en: This is Rugiatu she is 44 years old.  She is married, and has 2 children. In 1996, Rugiatu established her food stuff and empty five gallons rubber containers business. She began her business because she wants to enhance her independence.   Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 300,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Rugiatu now requires a new loan in order to purchase more empty five gallon rubber containers and food items. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 100,000. In the future, Rugiatu plans to own a house and give her children a quality education.She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more food stuff  and empty five gallon rubber containers for her business

loans.name: Marat

texts.en:
Marat S., born in 1962, lives with his wife and two daughters in Kapan. For a long time now, Marat has been engaged in gardening. He grows apple trees, pear trees, cherry trees, and fig trees in his garden. He also cultivates potatoes, carrots, and greenery. He sells his fruits and vegetables in Kapan market and distributes them via Kapan’s food shops as well. Thanks to his gardening income, Marat is able to support his family, pay for his elder daughter’s education, and develop his garden. 

Marat has a plot of unused land, where he intends to lay out a new garden with nuts, apple trees, and pear trees. This is why Marat is seeking to take out a 1.000.000 AMD loan, which will be used for soil cultivation, water supply system construction, and the purchase of young plants.

loans.use: to cultivate his soil, construct a water supply system, and purchase young plants

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en: M. Rustam is a very responsible and optimistic person. He has three children and a wife whom he has to support. He has 5 hectares of land and more than 800 trees which give fruit. In addition, he has 25 sheep and five cows. He has been in business for 10 years. Rustam wishes to develop his business. He would like a loan of $2300 US to purchase cattle and sheep to expand his business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: to buy cattle and sheep.

loans.name: Safina Group

texts.fr: Mugurwa N. est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe d’affaire «Safina»,  âgée de 58 ans, mariée, mère de 9 enfants dont  tous étudient mais 2 ont déjà leurs propres foyers. Son mari est un petit commerçant. La cliente Mugurwa N. est vendeuse des farines de manioc dans les entrepôts au centre commercial de fortune Birere. Environs  6 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle démarra son business avec  le premier crédit reçu de l’IMF Hekima vers 2006. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 20 sacs de manioc et le reste sera affecté pour les projets familiaux. En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, acheter une parcelle et y construire. La cliente Mugurwa N. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres  femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire «  Safina » est composé de 27 clients dont 2 femmes portent a mains leurs bébés.
texts.en: Mugurwa N. is an entrepreneur, president of the Safina group, 58 years old, married, and a mother of nine, all of whom attend school, but two of which already have their own homes. Her husband is a small storekeeper. Mugurwa N. sells manioc flour in stores at the makeshift trade center Birere. She has been doing this for about six years. She started her business with her first loan from Hekima around 2006. This new loan will allow her to stock up on 20 bags of manioc, and the rest will be used for her family. In addition, she plans to grow her business, buy a piece of land, and build there. Mugurwa N. thanks Hekima for its support of poor women excluded from classical banks. It should be noted that the business group Safina is made up of 27 clients, of which two women are holding their babies.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of manioc and to help the family

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa A., age 38, established his transportation business in 2001. It is his only source of livelihood. Working seven days a week and often 18 hours a day, he earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business. He is married and has no children.

He needs a loan in the amount of Le 3,600,000 in order to buy another motorcycle. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Musa plans to complete the construction of his house and to continue to take good care of his family. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a second motorcycle

loans.name: Mohamed Unisa

texts.en:
Mohamed Unisa, age 39, established his mobile phone and accessories business in 2006.  Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 500,000 every month from this business. He and his wife have one child. He also has one additional dependent who lives with the family. 

He would like to request a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000  in order to buy more mobile phones and accessories to offer for sale. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000.  In the future, Mohamed Unisa plans to build a house, buy a car, and transform his kiosk into a much larger shop. He hopes to be able to educate his child to university level.   

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phones and accessories to offer for sale

loans.name: Amara

texts.en: This is 38-year-old Amara. He is married and has three children. He has two additional dependents who live with him because they lost their parents. In 2001, Amara established his tobacco business. He began his business because he believed the income he would generate from this business would enhance his independence. Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, he earns about 700,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Amara now requires a new loan in order to buy more stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. In the future, Amara plans to buy a house and establish a big tobacco shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more tobacco for his business

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
With Florida’s warm weather, the air conditioning business is critical as everyone tries to escape the heat. Nelson immigrated from Cuba eight years ago, and since that time he has struggled to grow his air conditioning business. A family-run business, his daughter handles the accounting and his son-in-law is the main technician. However, as a small family business, they also support five other employees and more during peak seasons. He has also incorporated the green revolution by only offering the most energy-efficient air conditioners. But Nelson remains true to his early roots in the United States, and still works part-time at the grocery store that hired him when he first immigrated. 

With this loan from ACCION USA, Nelson will be purchasing a new duct cleaner. He rents this equipment at present and by purchasing it will be able to save almost $24,000 a year! The purchase of this new equipment is a small step forward for Nelson’s ultimate dream – which is to operate a business with the most energy-efficient machinery available. More importantly, his dedication to his business and his family has inspired him to focus on major expansion in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more advertising.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
The name says it all… “Que Rico!”

Flor has always been a wiz in the kitchen. When her husband lost his job she decided it was time to take her Puerto Rican culinary skills to the streets with her own food cart. She splits her time between the food cart and her office job, with her husband filling in on days she is in the office. They are both convinced of their ability to turn this food cart into a thriving business after their success on Miami’s Carnival de Calle 8. 

With her loan from ACCION USA, Flor will be buying flyers to help promote her food cart. She will also be buying more inventory so that the cart can operate for longer periods during the day. 

This is just the beginning of “Que Rico”! Flor ultimately wants to be able to purchase a food truck. And, like she says, once people try her food they think better access to her Puerto Rican food is a great idea!

loans.use: to create flyers for the business and purchase inventory.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata, age 36, established her baby items business in 2007. She began her business in partnership with her friend. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 680,000 every month from this business. She and her husband have four children. She also has two additional dependents: her younger brothers who live with her.

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy more baby items to offer for sale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Fatmata plans to transform her business into a big shop.   

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more baby items to offer for sale

loans.name: Umaru

texts.en:
Umaru, age 40, established his transportation business in 1989. He began his business through a friend and it is his only source of livelihood. Working seven days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. He and his wife have three children. He also has two additional dependents, who live with him because they lost their parents. 

He would like to request a loan in the amount of Le 3,600,000 in order to buy another Victor motorcycle. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 500,000. In the future, Umaru plans to build a house and to buy more bikes to grow his business.   

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle for his business

loans.name: Seray

texts.en:
Seray, age 25, established her plastic slippers and cosmetics business in 2003. She began her business because she had learned how to engage in this type of work from her mother. The rising cost of goods from her suppliers and transport fare is a challenge to her endeavor. Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month. She and her husband have four children, ages three, six, nine, and 13. 

She would like to request a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to to buy more plastic shoes and cosmetics. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Seray plans to establish a bigger shop and to give her children a quality education. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more plastic slippers to offer for sale

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djantoyerela, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 52 ans,  6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Yolla, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, les produits de cueillette  et des céréales.                                                                                                                                
Les femmes du groupe Djantoyerela sont à leur treizième prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso.                                                                       
KADIATOU SANGARÉ compte acheter des condiments avec les revendeurs de Fana. Elle effectue ses ventes au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Djantoyerela group are all married women who average 52 years of age and six children each. They live in extended traditional families in the village of Yolla, sub-prefecture of Fana, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship and friendship. They sell condiments, gathered fruits, and cereals.

This is the Djantoyerela group’s 13th loan cycle with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. Kadiatou SANGARÉ plans to buy condiments from resellers in Fana. She conducts her sales in the village, for cash or credit, to a customer base consisting of both men and women.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA, which she will use to make loan repayments and pay contributions to social ceremonies, the remainder to be reinvested in her business activity.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les huit femmes du groupe Djekafo, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 44 ans,  5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, quartier FANA-COURA, sous préfecture de Fana,  Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce des habits, des boissons de fabrication locales et des produits cosmétiques.                                                                                                                               
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. 
NAFI SANGARÉ compte acheter des habits pour enfants et adultes auprès des grossistes de Fana et souvent à Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes dans la ville et au marché, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The eight women of the group Djekafo are all married, and they average 44 years of age and five children. They all live in traditional extended families in Fana City, FANA-COURA district, sub-prefecture of Fana, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. And they do commerce in clothing, beverages made locally, and cosmetics. The group members are on their seventh solidarity loan. 

Ms. NAFI SANGARÉ intends to use her loan to buy clothing for children and adults from wholesalers from Fana and often from Bamako. Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sale to a customer base composed of women and men in the city and at the market. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used to make the loan payments and to help pay for societal ceremonies. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity and variety of fish to smoke and offer for sale

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 52 ans,  6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de YOLLA, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habits et de condiments alimentaires.                                                                                                                           
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire.                                                                       
MINATA C. compte acheter des habits pour enfants et adultes avec les revendeurs de Fana. Elle effectue ses ventes au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Danaya group are all married, average 52 years of age, and have six children.  They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Yolla, in the Fana prefecture, in the region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They know each other through family ties, as neighbors and as friends.  They are in the business of selling clothing and food condiments. 
The women of the Danaya group are on their fifth joint loan.
MINATA C. plans to buy children’s and adult clothing from the dealers in Fana.  She makes her sales in the village, for cash and on credit, to a clientele of men and women.
She foresees making an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFA which will be used to make payments on her loan and to make contributions to social ceremonies, with the remainder being reinvested in her business activities.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El Comité ha culminado el séptimo ciclo del programa “Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras”, cuenta con 19 integrantes, todas del barrio 8 de diciembre de la ciudad de Villa Elisa; el comité demuestra muy buena organización, realizan actividades regularmente en pos del fortalecimiento del grupo, además buscan constantemente aumentar sus ingresos personales y grupales.
Están interesadas en seguir formando parte de nuestro programa, por lo cual mantienen su moral de pago, demuestran también la solidaridad con aquellas que cuando tienen algún inconveniente de salud no pueden pagar su cuota, festejan los cumpleaños y otros eventos especiales.
Ellas ya conocen el método de trabajo de Kiva y por eso desean solicitar otro préstamo para poder seguir creciendo como profesionales.
La sra. Marta C. es cocinera desde hace mucho tiempo, ella empezó desde muy joven a cocinar en las casas de distintas personas como un empleada doméstica, luego se dio cuenta que podía ganar más ingresos si se perfeccionaba, fue así que compró libros de cocina y recetas para ser autodidacta, ya que no podía pagar un curso para saber el arte culinario.
Hoy día ella se destaca por sus ricas comidas preparadas con mucho cuidado y esmero.
Marta como sus demás colegas del comité desea poder superarse más y desea acceder al crédito para comprar más comestibles como carnes, fideos, verduras y condimentos, entre otras cosas, para poder cocinar en mayor cantidad y con productos de más calidad.
texts.en:
This committee has completed its seventh loan cycle within the "Committee of Women Entrepreneurs" program.  The group has 19 members who are all from the 8 de Diciembre neighborhood, in the city of Villa Elisa.  The committee has shown itself to be very well organized.  The members regularly carry out activities aimed at strengthening their group.  They are also constantly seeking to increase their personal incomes and group income.

The members of this group are keen to continue being part of our program and maintain their will to make their repayments.  They demonstrate great mutual support and help out whenever anybody might have a health problem that means they can't meet their repayment.  They celebrate birthdays together and other special events.  They are already aware of the way Kiva works and would like to request another loan so that they can continue growing as professionals.

Marta C. has been a cook for a long time.  She started cooking in other people's homes as a maid when she was very young.  She then realized that she could make more income if she perfected her skill.  She bought cookbooks and recipes and taught herself the art of cooking since she couldn't afford to pay for a course.  Marta is now well known for her rich food which is made with great care and attention.

Marta, in common with her fellow committee members, would like to be able to improve herself still further and would like to receive a loan so that she can buy more food products, including meat, noodles, vegetables and condiments, so that she can cook in larger quantities and make better-quality food.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, noodles, meat, cereals, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy other varieties of food items that her customers need.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Divino Niño Jesus es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, se conformó en fecha 20 de abril del 2010, mediante la iniciativa de la Sra. Mariza G., quien después de una conversación con la asesora se animó a juntar a sus vecinas para participar del programa, actualmente este grupo de comité se encuentra trabajando en el 3er. ciclo muy a gusto, con mucho esfuerzo y esmero, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Además del trabajo independiente que realiza cada una también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos especialmente el de trabajar para apoyar a sus familias económicamente.
La sra. Mariza se dedica a la venta de comidas, en un puesto qaue posee ella vende comidas preparadas para todas aquellas personas que deseen parar y saborear algo en su negocio, en especial para aquellas personas trabajadoras que no pueden ir a sus casas a la hora del almuerzo, ella siempre trata de darles los mejores alimentos para que se sientan como en familia.
Es muy conocida por su amabilidad y eso la ayuda a tener buena cantidad de clientes para poder generar ingresos estables para su familia.
Ella desea poder mejorar la calidad de sus comidas por eso solicita el crédito, para poder comprar verduras, frutas, aceites, carnes, condimentos, etc. que la ayuden a tener mayor productividad.
texts.en:
“El Comité de Mujeres Divino Niño Jesus” is in the city of Ybycuí and was formed on April 20, 2010, through the initiative of Mariza G..  After speaking to the advisor she got motivated to speak to her neighbors to participate in the program.  Now this group, through effort and care, is comfortably in its third cycle of the program.

Besides the individual work that each of the members do, they also work together to raise funds for the group.  They help each other reach their goals, especially working to support their families financially.

Mariza sells food from a food stall to whoever wants to stop and enjoy something, especially the workers who can’t go home at lunchtime.  She always tries to give them the best food so that they feel like family.

She is very well known for her kindness and that helps her have good quality customers to be able to generate income for her family.

She wants to improve the quality of her foods so she is requesting this loan to buy vegetables, fruits, cooking oil, meats, condiments, etc.  This will help her increase her production.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more provisions so she can meet the needs of her increasing customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to be able to supply in larger quantities to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add to her capital so that she will be able to fill her shop with more items to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn dough and other ingredients needed to cook her products and to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Her loan will serve as an increased income to buy more salted fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan she hopes to receive will be invested into the sale of food items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy extra bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food items to prepare and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy extra provisions to offer for sale and to expand her business

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana Y. is divorced and has three children. Nana is a fish monger at Abbina, near Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. She has been in this trade for 8 years. Nana wishes to increase the supply of fish to her customers; she can only do this buy increasing her capital base. A loan will serve as  increased capital to expand her fish smoking business.The income realized from her sales as a result of the capital will be reinvested back into her business. Nana is standing close to the traditionally built oven, with some of the fresh fish ready to be smoked.

loans.use: to expand her fish smoking business.

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz lives in Pakpattan, which is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture and dairy industry. She has been living with her family in the area of Bari Rakh in a two-room brick house for the past 25 years. Her husband's name is M. N., and he sells animals and milk to community clients. He is a very caring person and takes good care of his cattle. Mumtaz also provides full support to her husband in his business. She helps him milk the cows by getting up early in the morning and also gives them timely food and water. 

Besides this activity, Mumtaz carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. She is the mother of three sons. All of them are young and stay at home. 

Mumtaz has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her family business. With the loan, her husband will buy another buffalo that will enable him to get larger quantities of milk and also sell it at profit. He has been operating this business for the past 15 years, and Mumtaz is hopeful that an investment will help him grow his business and make better profits. 

In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Mumtaz.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for a dairy and animal sales business.

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la señora Reinalda O. O.. Ella está domiciliada en la ciudad de Independencia.
Las integrantes encantadas aceptaron conformar el Comité de Mujeres Rurales nombrando al Comité "Virgen de Fátima".
Las integrantes del comité se dedican en su mayoría al comercio ya sea de mercaderías, venta de chipa (masa típica del Paraguay a base de queso y almidón) o de artesanías. Otras se dedican a la venta de quiniela, y algunas son empleadas domésticas y limpiadoras.
Este grupo es un grupo solidario y muy trabajador, ya que  las señoras constantemente se reúnen y  hacen actividades para ayudarse entre todas en el pago de las cuotas.
Ellas ya han pasado ciclos anteriores por eso manejan este sistema de trabajo, y como se sienten muy unidas para seguir trabajando juntas solicitan otro crédito a Kiva, confiando plenamente en que los inversionistas las ayudarán.
La sra. Ofelia se dedica a la venta de artesanías, es una actividad que heredó de sus padres, ya ellos realizaban ventas de cántaros, jarrones, vasijas y todo tipo de mini-esculturas, y por eso desde joven conocía los trucos de este negocio, las clases de clientes y los posibles lugares de mayor demanda.
Fue así que lo hizo su medio de ganar el sustento para su familia y para ella misma, pero desea poder superar aún la pobreza en la que se encuentran algunos de sus familiares, por eso solicita el crédito para adquirir más artesanías para la reventa y poder ayudarlos de alguna manera en el aspecto económico.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Reinalda O. O., who lives in the city of Independencia.

These happy ladies were glad to form the committee of rural ladies, called "Virgen de Fátima” committee.

Most of these ladies have their own businesses, whether that be general merchandise, chipa (typical cheese and starch based dough in Paraguay), or crafts.  Others sell lottery, and some work as maids or cleaning women.

This is a united and hard working group and the ladies are constantly getting together and doing things to help each other with loan repayments.  They’ve completed previous cycles, so they manage this system.  Since they feel so united, they have requested another Kiva loan in order to continue working together, proving that lenders are a great help.

Ofelia sells art, something she learned from her parents who used to sell pitchers, vases, other vessels, and small sculptures.  This is why she’s known the basics of this business, the types of customers, and the areas where demand is greatest since she was young.

She has turned this into her means of supporting herself and her family, but she would like to beat the poverty that some of her family finds itself in.  She is asking for this loan to buy more art for resale which will help her financially.

loans.use: to buy art items for resale

loans.name: Sobia's Group

texts.en: Sobia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband who is a milk seller and wants to buy another buffalo to expand his dairy business further. The loan will help him increase the production of milk and sell to more customers. Sobia is a talented lady involved in making pranday (an ornament used to tie back hair). She sells her product to different cosmetics shops in the market and generates income for the family. She is an active young lady who performs her household activities very well. She is the mother of two daughters. Both of them are very young and have not started school yet. Sobia is hopeful that an investment will be a profitable one for her husband, and he will be able to take his business to a more profitable position. Sobia is a resident of Pakpattan which is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture. She has been living with her family in the area of Bari Rakh in a two-room brick house for the past 15 years.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for a dairy business.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Isata S.. She is married, and has six children aged four, six, nine, 12, 15, and 18 years. In 2009, Isata established her restaurant business. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 300,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

She needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to help her buy some drinks and foodstuffs for her restaurant. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 100,000 SLL. In the future, Isata plans to educate her children and help her husband buy a piece of land. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy assorted drinks and food for her restaurant

loans.name: Koffi Albert

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 38ans, Mr  Koffi est père de 03 enfants et est marié à une revendeuse. Il réside à Bé-Kpota.  Il est dans l’activité il ya 7ans et a une entreprise (IDEAL PHOTO ET VIDEO) C’est un jeune homme qui est reconnu par ses talents  dans la prise de photos et dans le reportage. Il est à son cinquième prêt et n’a pas eu de difficultés à payer les quatre derniers. Il demande ce montant pour  acheter de la caméra pour le reportage afin de satisfaire ses nombreux clients, assurer son avenir et celui de sa famille. Il a aussi une ambition : être un reporter international.
texts.en: A young man of 38 years, Mr. Koffi is the father of 3 children and is married to a saleswoman.  He lives in Bé-Kpota. He has run a photo business called Ideal Photo and Video for seven years.   He is a young man known for his photographic and journalistic talents.  He is on his fifth loan and has not had any difficulties repaying the last four.  He is requesting this loan to buy a video camera for filming services to meet the demand of his clients.  This will assure his future and that of his family.  He has a dream of becoming an international reporter.

loans.use: to buy a video camera for news reporting

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Fanta T.. She is married, and has five children aged four, six, nine, 12 and 15. In 1996, Fanta established her toiletries business. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 300,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL to buy different kinds of toiletries for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 100,000 SLL. In the future, Fanta plans to educate her children to the university level. She is hard-working and honest. Fanta is very determined. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy different types of toiletries for her business

loans.name: Riaz's Group

texts.en:
Riaz is married to M. Y. and resides in Pakpattan, Pakistan which is famous for its agriculture industry. Her house is located in Bari rakh, which is a small residential area of the city. She moved here 20 years ago. Her husband operates a seed-selling business. He provides seeds to his customers and earns income for the family. His clientele base is farmers. They approach him to purchase seeds for growing different crops.  
Riaz has given birth to three daughters and two sons. Her daughters are getting their education by attending a nearby school. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will use the loan to purchase seeds to sell. He has been doing this business for the past 12 years and Riaz is confident that after the investment, her husband’s business will grow further and make him even more income.

loans.use: To buy seeds to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy crates of drinks and top-up cards for mobile phones

loans.name: Ablavi Hodalo

texts.fr: Mariée à un revendeur, elle est mère d’un(01) enfant et est âgée de 32ans. Depuis 2005 elle a commencé par vendre les friperies, les produits cosmétiques et les chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et revend dans sa boutique.  Vue les conditions de niveau de vie, Mme Ablavi veut aider son mari, accroitre son activité, avoir sa propre boutique pour revendre s’assurer de l’avenir de ses enfants c’est  pour cela elle sollicite ce premier prêt pour acheter des bals de friperie, 01 carton de produits cosmétiques et 02 cartons de chaussures.
texts.en: Married to a salesman, Ablavi Hodalo is 32 years old and the mother of one child.  In 2005 she began selling second-hand clothing, cosmetic products, and shoes.  She gets her supplies in Lomé and resells them in her boutique.   Given her living conditions,  Madame  Ablavi wants to help her husband, increase her business activity, own her own sales shop, and ensure the future of her children.  This is why she is requesting her first loan to buy bundles of used clothing, a case of cosmetics, and two cases of shoes.

loans.use: to buy used clothing, cosmetics and shoes

loans.name: Ayaba Evenam

texts.fr: Mme Ayaba a 50ans. Marié à un staffeur, elle est mère  de 04 enfants. Depuis 1998 elle a commencé son activité en vendant de l’eau minérale mise en sachet (appelé chez nous pure water). Elle achète à Lomé et revend dans sa maison. Elle sollicite ce premier pour acheter des sachets d’eau minérale mise en sachet pour revendre afin d’avoir de bénéfice pour aider son mari voir ses enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions et assurer son avenir.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ayaba is 50 years old. She is married to a plasterer, and the mother of four (4) children. 

In 1998, she started selling packets of mineral water (locally called pure water). She buys her stock in Lomé and conducts her sales from her home. 

She is seeking this first loan to buy packets of mineral water for resale in order to earn profits that will help her husband ensure good living conditions for their children and provide for their future.

loans.use: to buy packets of mineral water for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drinks and pure water for his business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
