This is 38-year-old Daniel C.. He is married and has four children aged six, nine, 12 and 15. 

In 2001, Daniel established his spare parts business. He began his business because he wanted to generate income, establish a savings scheme, and provide a livelihood for his family. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 350,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL to help him buy more spares for different makes of motor vehicles. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 100,000 SLL. In the future, Daniel plans to open another shop and build a house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for for different kinds of motor vehicles

loans.name: Kowa

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Kowa. He is married and has three children who are 18, 15, and 10. He has two additional dependents who live with him because they are his nephews. 

In 2001, Kowa established his furniture-making business, making chairs, beds, tables, wardrobes, and dressing mirrors. He began his business because he wanted to be self-reliant. Kowa believes carpentry is a profitable business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 1,000,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL to buy timber, leather materials, nails, polish and a saw. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. In the future, Kowa plans to modernize his workshop and to acquire a showroom along a major street in Kenema. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy timber, leather materials, nails, polish and a saw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy eggs, shortening, oil, sugar, beans, milk, cheese, butter, rice, margarine, bread, cookies, soft drinks, juice, salt, condiments, churros, flour, soup, pasta, candles, matches, batteries, coffee, toilet paper, sanitary pads, soap, and toothpaste.

loans.name: Everson Ahimelec

texts.es:
El señor Everson Ahimelec V. R. es un joven que se dedica a la venta de medicamentos populares en su negocio que tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion en la aldea San Antonio de Flores de La municipalidad de Pespire.
los medicamentos que vende son de uso de caracter curativo.
Everson es un joven que aparte de tener su negocio tambien es un empleado asalariado de la secretaria de recursos Naturales y Ambiente en el que tiene 4 años de laborar como tecnico de mantenimiento de 
turbinas de planta generadora y potabilizadora de agua.
El señor everson es una persona con muchos deseos de superacion, es honesto y muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de medicamentos al por mayor.
su meta es invertirle lo maximo a su negocio hasta que sea una farmacia grande y asi dedicarse a su negocio propio. tiene la ayuda de su esposa cuando el esta trabajando.
texts.en:
Everson Ahimelec V. R. is a young man who sells popular medicines at his business located in his house in the village of San Antonio de Flores, within the Municipality of Pespire. The medicines he sells are for healing purposes.

Everson is a young man who, in addition to having his business, is also a salaried employee at the Secretary for Natural Resources and Environment where he has worked for four years as a maintenance technician for power plant turbines and water purification.

Everson has a strong desire to excel and he is very honest and responsible with his obligations.

He will use the loan to buy medicines at wholesale. His goal is to invest the most in his business until it becomes a large pharmacy so he can work at his own business. His wife helps him with his work.

loans.use: to buy pills.

loans.name: Luz Y Vida Group

texts.es:
El grupo Luz y Vida esta integrado por tres mujeres que viven en la colonia 17 de septiembre de San Lorenzo Valle, se conocen desde hace vario tiempo, todas poseen casa propia y viven humildemente, son mujeres  trabajadoras y practicamente son señoras solas con la familia que les ha tocado mantener y educar a sus hijos y salir adelante con su esfuerzo y dedicacion. a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:
la señora Suyapa C. tiene cinco hijos que dependen solo de ella y se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas desde hace 4 años, sus ventas son en el mercado viejo de San Lorenzo, tiene dos horarios de elaboracion que son hasta las 11 de la mañana y a las 3 de la tarde, la primera produccion es para el almuerzo y la segunda para la cena, tiene la ayuda de una hija para la venta de las mismas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la fabricacion de las tortillas.

la sra. Magdalena C. quien tiene 62 años de edad, es madre soltera pero no tiene hijos que dependan de ella ya que todos sus hijos estan grandes y han formado sus propias familias.
Magdalena se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la fabricacion de las tortillas, sus ventas son en el mercado de San Lorenzo.
 
Doña Sandra Suyapa P. tiene 32 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos, Sandra se dedica a la venta de ropa interior, sus ventas las realiza en varios lugares de la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
Sandra viaja a la ciudad de Tegucigalpa a comprar su mercaderia, ahi las prendas de ropa interior son mas baratas y de mejor calidad.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa interior.
texts.en:
The Luz y Vida (Light and Life) group is made up of three women who live in the 17 de septiembre residential development in San Lorenzo Valle.  They have known each other for some time.  They all own their own homes and live humbly.  They are hard-working women and practically live alone with their families.  They support and educate their children and get them ahead in life through their efforts and commitment.  We will now provide details of the different business activities that they carry out:

Suyapa C. has five children who depend solely on her.  Her business is making and selling tortillas.  She has been in this business for four years and makes her sales in the old market in San Lorenzo.  She makes her tortillas over two shifts: the first up until 11.00am and the second up until 3.00pm.  Her first lot of tortillas are for lunch and the second lot are for dinner.  She has the help of one of her daughters in selling the tortillas.  She will use her loan to buy supplies that she needs to make her tortillas.

Magdalena C. is 62 years old and a single mother.  However, she doesn't have any children who depend on her as all her children are grown up and have their own families.  Magdalena makes and sells tortillas.  She will use her loan to buy supplies for making her tortillas.  She sells her products in San Lorenzo market.

Sandra Suyapa P. is 32 years old, married, and has two children.  She sells underwear.  Sandra makes her sales in several places in the city of San Lorenzo.  She travels to the city of Tegucigalpa to buy her merchandise as the underwear is cheaper there and also better quality.  She will use her loan to buy underwear.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, water, lime and underwear

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vilma Doris

texts.es:
La señora Vilma Doris R. tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos que dependen de ella, viven en casa de un hermano y se dedica a la elaboracion de pan casero y rosquillas, con dicha actividad a podido sacar adelante a sus hijos, darles educacion, vestuario y alimentacion, ademas en la epoca de invierno compra lecha para elaborar cuajada y queso, Vilma es una mujer trabajadora y con deseos
de salir adelante.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de una estufa industrial para elaborar pupusas.
texts.en:
Vilma Doris R. is 32 years old, a single mother, and has three dependent children. They live at her brother’s house and she works making homemade bread and rosquillas (a ring-shaped pastry). Through her work in this business, she has been able to get her children ahead, providing them with an education, clothing and food. Additionally, she buys milk during the winter to make cheese curd and cheese. Vilma is a hardworking woman with a desire to get ahead.

She will use the loan to buy an industrial stove to make pupusas (a traditional Honduran dish).

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove.

loans.name: Ubesnceslao

texts.es:
El señor Ubenseslao O. tiene 54 años de edad, esta casado y tiene tres hijos que viven con el en su casa y le ayudan a pescar y sacar canechos. 
Este negocio es un patrimonio de familia ya desde hace mucho tiempo su familia se a dedicado a dicha actividad.
Ubenseslao sale al mar todos los dias muy temprano dependiendo las mareas, lleva su almuerzo para estar mas tiempo en el mar y asi poder sacar mas peces.
A veces pesca mas de 150 canechos machos ya que las hembras es prohibido sacarlas del mar.
Don Ubenses como se le conoce en el area es una perssona humilde de escasos recursos que sostiene a su familia de sus ingresos que recibe de la venta de los canechos y del pescado.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de pescado seco para revender y obtener de esa manera obtener un poco mas de ingresos.
texts.en:
Mr. Ubenseslao O. is 54 years old, married, and has three children who live with him in his house and help him fish and trap crabs. This business has been in the family for a long time. Ubenseslao goes out to sea every day very early according to the tides. He takes his lunch with him so he can stay out at sea for a long time and catch more fish. Sometimes he can catch more than 150 male crabs, and the female crabs are not allowed to be removed from the sea.

Don Ubenses, as he is known in the area, is a humble person without a lot of wealth. He supports his family from the earnings he receives selling crabs and fish. He will use the loan to buy dried fish to resell and be able to earn a bit more money.

loans.use: buy fish

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es:
El señor Evaristo N. vive en union libre y tiene tres hijos que dependen de el, viven en el barrio Mongollano de la ciudad de San Lorenzo. 
Evaristo tiene un negocio de venta de repuestos y accesorios para bicicletas, tambien propietario de un negocio de venta de golosinas que es atendido por su esposa.
En dicho negocio tiene un taller en donde tambien repara las bicicletas a las personas que necesitan de dicho servicio, tiene un empleado que repara y Evaristo se encarga de atender la venta de los repuestos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de repuestos para surtir su negocio.
Su mayor sueño es que su taller sea el mejor de la zona y llegar a vender bicicletas de buena calidad.
texts.en: Mr. Evaristo N. lives with his partner and their three dependent sons.  They live in the Mongollano neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo.  Evaristo has a business selling bicycle parts and accessories.  He also owns a business selling sweets that is run by his wife.  In his business he has a repair shop for bicycles.  He has an employee who repairs bicycles and he works selling the parts.  He will use the loan to buy parts to stock his business.   His greatest dream is that his shop be the best in the area and that he will start selling high-quality bicycles.

loans.use: buy bicycle parts, tires, pumps, rims, brakes, brake cables, seats, handle bars, patches, glue, pedals, clamps

loans.name: Yessica Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Yessica Carolina O. tiene 34 años de edad, esta soltera y tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, viven en la colonia fraternidad de la ciudad de San Lorenzo desde hace 3 años, Yessica se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada clasificada, vende zapatos de niños y de adulto, todos los dias sale a vender a a las colonias, barrios, aldeas y caserios aledaños a San Lorenzo, en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la costura repara y hace prendas de vestir para Damas, dicha actividad la realiza en su casa de habitacion. doña Yessica es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y tiene varios proyectos, uno de ellos y el de mayor importancia es hacer una casa para sus hijos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa usada calsificada y sandalias.
texts.en: Mrs. Yessica Carolina O. is 34 years old, single, and has two children she is raising.  They have lived in the Fraternidad neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo for three years.  Yessica works selling new and used clothing.  She also sells shoes for children and adults.  Every day she goes out to sell in the areas around San Lorenzo.  In her free time she works mending clothing and making women's clothing at her home.  Yessica is an entrepreneurial woman with a desire to get ahead.  She has many goals, one of which (and the most important) is to build a house for her children.  She will use the loan to buy used clothing and sandals.

loans.use: buy women's clothing, men's clothing, and shoes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Herlin Rolando

texts.es:
El señor Herlin Rolando T. tiene 36 años de edad, es soltero y tiene dos hijos que dependen de el, vive con su madre en la colonia Fraternidad de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, el señor T. tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de electrodomesticos como ser microondas, televisores, equipos de sonido, refrigeradoras.
se translada a varios lugares en su vehiculo para repartir la mercaderia al crédito y al contado.
un dia lo deja para el cobro y lo hace en su motocicleta.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de articulos electronicos que ya tiene encargados.
El sueño de don Herlin es tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Herlin Rolando T. is 36 years old, single, and has two dependent children.  He lives with his mother in the Fraternidad development, in the city of San Lorenzo.  Mr T. has a small business selling household appliances such as microwaves, television sets, sound systems and refrigerators.  He travels to different places in his vehicle to sell his merchandise for cash and on credit.  He leaves one day free to collect payments and he does this on his motorcycle.

Herlin will use this loan to buy electrical equipment that he has orders for.  His dream is to own his own home.

loans.use: to buy a microwave, sound system and television set

loans.name: Maria Susana

texts.es:
Maria es madre de familia de 34 años de edad. Vive junto a su esposo y 4 hijos en casa propia ubicada en un caserío pequeño rural que pertenece al distrito de La Victoria, en el norte de Perú. Cuenta con servicios básicos de agua y luz. La actividad principal en esta comunidad es la agricultura, la crianza y venta de animales de engorde  y actividades artesanales.

Maria se dedica al engorde y venta de animales de corral como patos, gallinas y cuyes .Tiene más de 20 años en dicha actividad porque la aprendió de sus padres. Cuando sus animales logran un buen tamaño y peso, los vende a sus vecinos y al público general en los mercados grandes de su ciudad como Moshoqueque y Reque. 

El destino del crédito será para la compra de útiles  escolares de sus menores hijos, que le servirán para realizar sus actividades escolares. También comprará mas patos y gallinas para engorde y venta que le ayudarán a incrementar sus ingresos.

Solicita su segundo crédito en Edpyme Alternativa. Canceló su primer crédito con puntualidad y la ayudó a aportar sus ingresos al presupuesto familiar y la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a 34 year-old mother.  She lives together with her husband and four children in her own home which is located in a small rural village in La Victoria district, in the north of Peru.  She has access to basic services such as water and electricity.  The main business activities of people in this community are farming, raising and selling animals, and making handicrafts.

Maria's business is fattening and selling farmyard animals such as ducks, hens and guinea pigs.  She has been in this business for more than 20 years as she learned it from her parents.  When her animals have reached a good size and weight, she sells them to her neighbors and to the general public in the big markets in cities such as Moshoqueque and Reque.

Maria will use her loan to buy school supplies for her children which they will use for their school work.  She will also buy more ducks and hens to fatten and sell which will help her to increase her income.

This is Maria's second loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  She repaid her first loan punctually and it helped her to contribute income towards the family budget and her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more poultry to raise and sell, and to buy school supplies for her children

loans.name: Exequiel

texts.es:
Exequiel padre de familia de 28 años de edad. Es casado y tiene  2 hijos menores. Vive con su familia en Wiracocha, un caserío ubicado a 15 minutos de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Exequiel se dedica a la agricultura. Ha sembrado limón el cual atiende diariamente y cosecha semanalmente. Con sus ingresos de esta actividad, el puede solventar sus gastos familiares. Solicita un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo, lo que lo ayudará lograr una mejor calidad y precio para su producto. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1000 soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y poder adquirir una utilidad acéptale para que mejore la calidad de vida d su familia.
texts.en:
Exequiel is married, and is a 28 year-old father of 2 minor children.  He lives with his family in Wiracocha, a rural settlement located 15 minutes from Tambogrande.  This is an agricultural area that is located in Piura province, more than 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.  

Exequiel is a farmer who cultivates lemons.  He attends to his crops each day, and harvests his lemons on a weekly basis.  With the income from this activity he is able to cover the household expenditures.  He requests a loan to buy fertilizers for his crops.  This will help him to grow better quality products, for which he can get a higher price.  To do this, he is requesting a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He wants to continue to invest in his business so that he can have enough profits to improve the quality of live for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his lemon crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rebuild parts of his house to reinforce it and better protect his family

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es: Abelardo tiene 27  años. Vive con su esposa e hijo en su propia casa en el caserío  San Bernardino, ubicado a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Túcume, en el norte de Perú. Gana la vida brindando el servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehiculo que consta de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. También, su esposa y él se dedican a la costura. Ofrecen el servicio a sus vecinos y conocidos en la zona. Abelardo solicita un préstamo para la compra de otra máquina de coser lo que los ayudará cumplir más pedidos en menos tiempo. Abelardo y su esposa trabajan juntos para sacar adelante a su familia. Les agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por el apoyo brindado en esta meta.
texts.en: Abelardo is 27 years old. He lives with his wife and son in his own house in San Bernardino, a hamlet located 10 minutes away from the town of Túcume, in the north of Peru. He earns a living offering transporting passengers with his moto taxi, a motorcycle with an attached cabin to offer transportation services. Together with his wife, he also engages in sewing, and they offer this service to their neighbors and their acquaintances. Abeladro is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine that will help them prepare more orders in less time. Abelardo and his wife work together in order to provide for their family, and they are thankful to Kiva lenders for the support they offer them in reaching this goal.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Maria Erlinda

texts.es:
la señora Maria Erlinda S. R. tiene 65 años de edad es viuda, su esposo fallecio hace algunos años, vive en su casa en la que tiene mas de 45 años de tenerla.
Maria se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion en donde vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta basica familiar, ademas tiene otro negocio el que es venta de leche pura de vaca.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio.
Sus ventas son buenas ya que su negocio se encuentra en una zona muy transitada.

Doña Maria Erlinda es originaria de San Lorenzo, es una de las primeras pobladoras de esta Zona y le ha hido muy bien. tiene muchos clientes ya que vende todo sus productos a buenos precios.
Su sueño es dejar a la familia economicamente bien.
texts.en:
Maria Erlinda S. R. is 65 years old and a widow.  Her husband died a few years ago.  She lives in her home which she has owned for 45 years.

Maria sells basic food products.  She has a grocery store in her home where she sells everything that can be found in an average family shopping basket.  She also has another business selling pure cow's milk.

Maria will use this loan to buy merchandise to stock her business.  Her sales are good as her business is located in a very busy area.

Maria Erlinda is from San Lorenzo.  She was one of the first residents of this area has done very well.  She has many customers since she sells all her products at good prices.  Her dream is to leave her family in a financially comfortable position.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, butter, oil, soft drinks, juices, soap, bread, coffee, cookies, candles, batteries, matches, toilet paper, sanitary towels, soups, pasta, spaghetti, salt, condiments and water in jars and bags

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es: Faustino tiene 45 años D. edad. Vive en casa propia con su esposa en L. parte rural del caserío San Bernardino ubicado cerca el distrito D. Túcume en el norte D. Perú. Se dedica a L. agricultura, específicamente el cultivo D. payar. Después D. cosechar su producto, lo comercializa en el Mercado Moshoqueque, un mercado granD. con mucho movimiento comercial. Solicita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes para su cultivo D. payar. Esta inversión lo ayudará cosechar un mejor producto que podrá vender a un mejor precio. Con sus ingresos, Faustino pueD. seguir solventado sus gastos familiares y cuidando a su esposa.
texts.en: Faustino is 45 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife in the rural area of San Bernardino, a hamlet located in the Túcume district, in the north of Peru. He engages in agriculture, specifically in growing beans. After harvesting his product, he sells it in the Moshoqueque market, a big market with a lot of business. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy fertilizers for his bean crops. This loan will help him in harvesting a better product which he will be able to sell at a better price. Thanks to his earnings, Faustino can continue paying for his family expenses and caring for his wife.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his bean crops

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: From Kompong Cham province, Mrs. Heng L. is 48 and is a mother of seven kids, four of whom are single and the rest three are married. One of her children works as a construction worker. Mrs. Heng L. is a local farmer who has been planting a variety of crops on her own farmland for nine years. Her husband also assists her in the farming business. The couple could earn an income averaging $3 a day from their crop-planting business. Mrs. Heng L. is looking for a loan to buy a cow because her old cow doesn't support her field work.

loans.use: to buy a cow for replacing her old cow.

loans.name: Chom

texts.en:
Chom T. is a 37-year-old married woman who has been living in the Kompong Tom province. To earn a living, she has planted rice and vegetable crops on her own farmland for many years. From this, she can make around $2.10 a profit per day. She has a life partner in her husband who is a local fisherman at a lake near their community.

They have given birth to three children:  Two are single and one is married. All three children are still living in the family home and are employed in different jobs. Chom T. will use her loan to hire a machine to plow her farmland and to buy seeds for planting.

loans.use: to hire a machine to plow her farmland and to buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok S. is a 34-year-old married man who currently resides in the Kompong Tom province. He is a security guard who works in HLK. He started his job more than a year ago. Sok S. is blessed with one young child who is enrolled in school. 

His wife cultivates rice and fattens pigs for extra income. The coming rainfall is good for planting the rice crop. However, Sok S.’s wife doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. Sok S. is seeking a loan for his wife to use to purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and seeds for planting. The couple plans to use the rest of the funds to buy piglets to raise.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticide, seeds for planting and to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
Seang T. has been in the farming business for years in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She plants rice crops on her own land, from which she earns a living. 

She is blessed with five children. Two of them are employed in the construction field and the other three are going to school. Her husband frequently works in the farm fields alongside her. Seang T. is requesting a loan to purchase some vegetable seeds for planting and to buy a few piglets to raise.

loans.use: to purchase some vegetable seeds to plant and to buy a few piglets to raise.

loans.name: Cheap

texts.en: Cheap S. is a 49-year-old widow woman who lives in the Kompong Cham province. She is a mother of five children: two are married, and the remaining three are single. Most of her children are working in different occupations, and they often contribute their earnings to her to use for the entire family’s needs. Her husband died of senility years ago. Cheap S. is a local farmer who has been planting a mixture of crops for over five years. She would like to ask for a loan in order to buy peanut seeds and potato seeds for planting. Cheap S. and her son appear in the photo.

loans.use: to buy peanut seeds and potato seeds for planting

loans.name: Moun

texts.en:
Moun C., age 40, sells a few wares in front of her home. She sells items like soft drinks, sweets for children, shampoo, perfume, and some cooking supplies. To meet the family’s living expenses, her husband works in the garment industry for a salary. The couple has three school-aged children. 

Recently, part of Moun C.’s kitchen broke, and she doesn’t have funds to repair it. To deal with this problem, Moun C. is requesting a loan from Kiva to repair her kitchen.

loans.use: to repair her broken kitchen.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: Marcos tiene 34 años de edad. Es casado y tiene un hijo. Vive junto a su  familia en casa propia en el centro del caserío de San Luis, que pertenece al distrito de La Victoria. Este lugar es  rural y sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales, labores agrícolas. Marcos se dedica a trabajar como peón en la agricultura. Tiene más de 5 años de experiencia en este oficio. Actualmente, su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado y desea hacerla unos arreglos. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Con esta inversión, podrá reforzar su casa y mejor proteger a su familiar. Les agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por el apoyo brindado en mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Marcos is 34 years old. He is married and has one child. He lives with his family in his own house in the center of the San Luis hamlet, located in the La Victoria district. This is a rural area, whose inhabitants engage in agriculture, animals breeding and agricultural works. Marcos is a farm hand with a 5-year experience in this field. As his house is currently in a dilapidated state and he wants to have some repair works done, he has taught it convenient to as Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 PEN. Thanks to this loan he will be able to reinforce his house and to better protect his family. He is thankful to Kiva lenders for their support in helping him improving his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To have some repair works done to his house in order to reinforce it to better protect his family.

loans.name: Alver Rafael

texts.es: Alver tiene 21 años. Vive con su esposa y su niña de un año en el caserío Monterrey ubicado en el distrito de Paijan, en el norte de Perú. Vive en casa de un familiar, no cuenta con casa propia. Gana la vida trabajando como mototaxista en su vehículo propio. Esta solicitando este nuevo crédito para dar mantenimiento a su vehículo, la herramienta de su trabajo. Con esta inversión, podrá brinda un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Éste es el segundo crédito que Alver ha solicitado de Edpyme. Canceló el primero de manera puntual. Alver tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y conocidos que lo consideran como una persona trabajadora y responsable.
texts.en:
Alver is 21 years old. He lives with his wife and his one-year-old daughter in the Monterrey hamlet, located in the Paijan district, in the north of Peru. He lives in a family member’s house, as he does not have a house of his own. He earns a living working as a moto taxi* driver with his own vehicle. The new loan he is requesting will be used for the upkeep of his vehicle, which is his working tool. Thanks to this loan, he will be able to offer a better service to his customers. This is the second loan Alver has asked to Edpyme. The first has been regularly paid off. Alver has received good references by his neighbors and acquaintances, who consider him a responsible and hardworking man.

<cite>*A “moto taxi” is a motorcycle with a tricycle-like attachment.</cite>

loans.use: To pay for the upkeep of his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair his moto taxi in order to keep it the best conditions.

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
Chun C. is a 32-year-old man who lives with another family member in Ang Snoul district. For more than 3 years, he has been feeding chicken kept in a cage behind his house. He and his wife sell chicken and chicken eggs to earn a living. The couple could earn a profit of about $2 per day from this business.  

Chun C. and his wife help each other to earn money to feed their two children. Both children are attending school.

The existing chicken cage is getting old and has many broken parts.  The couple wants to mend and also enlarge the cage, but they don’t have enough cash to make it possible. To deal with this problem, Chum C. is asking for a loan to repair the broken cage.

loans.use: to repair his broken chicken cage.

loans.name: Karina Del Milagro

texts.es:
Karina tiene 24 años de edad y es soltera sin hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres la cual está ubicada en Puerto Eten, un distrito pequeño urbana rural que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Sus actividades principales en esta zona son la pesca, comercio, crianza de animales de engorde y artesanía.

Karina se dedica a la confección de gorros para confeccionistas mayoristas. Tiene su pequeño taller en su vivienda. Recientemente ha adquirido una máquina de coser, la cual le ayuda a realizar con más eficiencia su trabajo. Cuenta con la ayuda de su hermana menor. Tiene más de 06 años en esta actividad y sus principales clientes son vendedores mayoristas de gorros y prendas de vestir de la zona. 

El destino del crédito será para la compra de materiales y otros implementos para la confección de sus gorros ya que le generará un mayor ingreso y ayudará mejorar su calidad de vida. El mercado para su producto es muy bueno y rentable. Karina desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para crecerlo y un día tener su propia tienda donde puede vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Karina is 24 years old, single, and has no children. She lives in her parents' house, which is located in Puerto Eten, a small rural/urban district that belongs to the province of Chiclayo. Her main activities in this area are fishing, trade, raising and selling animals. and artesanal rafts.   

Karina makes hats for wholesale clothing makers. She has her own small workshop in her home. recently, she has acquired a sewing machine, which helps her do her job more effciently. She has the help of her younger sister. She has been doing this activity for 6 years and her main customers are wholesale merchants of hats and clothing in the area. 

The loan will be used to buy materials and more tools to make her hats since this will generate more income and help her improve her quality of life. The market for her job is very good and profitable. Karina wants to keep investing in her business to grow it and one day have her own store where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy materials and more tools to make hats.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 23  años de edad. Es casada y tiene un hijo. Vive junto a su familia en casa propia en el Caserío  Santa Isabel, ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope, en el norte de Perú. Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en la parte exterior  de su domicilio. Alimenta sus animales con polvillo, purina, maíz, y otros alimentos balanceado. Negocia quincenalmente sus animales en los mercados de Chiclayo y Lambayeque. Solicita un crédito para la compra de más animales y sus respectivos alimentos. Con los ingresos de su trabajo, Teresa ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia. Ha manejado otros préstamos y pagó sus cuotas de manera puntual. Les agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su ayuda en crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa is 23 years old, married, and has one child.  She lives together with her family in her own home in the small village of Santa Isabel, 15 minutes from the city of Mórrope, in the north of Peru.

Teresa's business is raising and selling animals.  She raises her animals in pens which are located outside her home.  She feeds her animals 'polvillo' (a powder derived from rice), purina, corn and other balanced feed.  She sells her animals every two weeks in the markets of Chiclayo and Lambayeque.

Teresa is requesting this loan to buy more animals and feed for them.  She uses the income from her work to help her husband financially support their family.  Teresa has received previous loans and she made her repayments punctually.  She is grateful to Kiva lenders for their help in growing her business.

loans.use: to buy more animals and balanced animal feed

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio es padre de familia de 32 años de edad. Es casado y tiene 02 hijos. Viven en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Se dedica a la agricultura. Actualmenta mantiene una cosecha de limón. Tiene dos años de experiencia en este rubro. Despues de cosechar sus productos, los vende en los mercados locales de Olmos. Solicita un préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y abonos para su cultivo. Esta inversión lo ayudará lograr una mejor calidad y precio para su producto. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 800 soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore la calidad de vida d su familia.
texts.en:
Julio, 32, is married and has 2 children.  They live in the Olmos district, a busy agricultural area located in Lambayeque province, more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.  He is a farmer and for the past two years has been growing limes.  After the harvest he sells them in the local markets in Olmos.
Julio is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and manure for his orchards.  This investment will help him improve the quality and get a better price and that’s why he is requesting a loan of 800 sols from Edpyme Alternativa.  He would like to continue investing in his business so that it will improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and manure for his lime orchards

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: Tomas tiene 32 años de edad. Es casada y tiene 3 hijos de edad escolar. Vive en casa de su hermano  en el distrito urbano de José Leonardo Ortiz, uno de los más grandes distritos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Gana la vida vendiendo emoliente, una bebida caliente, típica de Perú a la cual se atribuyen diferentes propiedades medicinales, ya sea para el tratamiento del aparato digestivo, reproductor, respiratorio, circulatorio, etc. Cuenta con una experiencia de un año en este negocio. Vende sus productos a sus clientes en el Mercado Moshoqueque, un mercado grande con mucho movimiento comercial. Solicita un préstamo para arreglar el carrito que usa para transportar sus productos. Con esta inversión, podrá seguir ofreciendo sus productos a sus clientes sin interrupción. Tomas es muy trabajador y bastante entregado a su familia. Desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para aumentar sus ingresos y poder brindar una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Tomas, age 32, is married and has three school age children.  He lives in his brother’s house in the urban district of José Leonardo Ortiz.  This is one of the biggest districts in the city of Chiclayo.

He earns his living selling “emoliente”, a warm drink that is typical of Peru.  It has different medicinal properties such as treating the digestive, reproductive, respiratory, or circulatory systems, etc.  He has one year of experience in this business.  He sells his products to his customers in the Mercado Moshoqueque.  This is a large market with a great deal of commercial activity.

He is requesting a loan to fix the cart he uses to transport his products.  With this investment he will be able to continue offering his products to his customers without any interruption.  

Tomas is a very hard-worker, and he is very devoted to his family.  He wishes to continue investing in his business to increase his income and to be able to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to fix the cart he uses to transport the "emoliente" that he sells.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana tiene 28 años de edad y es madre soltera. Tiene dos hijos de menor de la edad de 7 años. Reside en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Gana la vida vendiendo ropa y sandalias. Cuenta con experiencia de 3 años en este negocio. Vende sus productos en el Mercado Moshoqueque, un mercado grande, conocido y con mucho movimiento comercial. Es muy conocida en el mercado y tiene clientela ya establecida. Desea aumentar su mercadería con la compra de mas ropa y sandalias. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Con esta inversión, podrá aumentar sus ingresos y seguir solventado sus gastos familiares.
texts.en: Ana is 28 years old and is a single mother.  She has two children younger than 7 years old.  She lives with her parents in the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.  She makes a living selling clothing and sandals.  She has three years of experience in this business.  She sells her products at the Moshoqueque market, a large, well known market with a lot of commercial traffic.  She is very well known in the market and has an established group of customers.  She wants to increase her merchandise inventory by buying more clothing and sandals,  For this reason she is requesting the loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  With this investment she will be able to increase her income and continue to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: to increase her inventory by purchasing more clothing and sandals.

loans.name: Thorng

texts.en: Thorng T. is 41 years old and a married woman. She is a recycling seller. She often buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other provinces or countries. The used goods she deals in are mostly leftover electrical wires and plastic. Her husband is a horse cart deliverer. They are humble parents who has been blessed with a lovely young child. Thorng T. has inherited a piece of farmland from her grandparents. In addition, she hopes to grow various crops on her own land. Due to lack of money, Thorng T. decided to seek a loan to purchase farming materials such as seeds, a pumping machine, and other supplies to begin a farming business. Thorng T. and her husband appear in the picture.

loans.use: to buy seeds, a pumping machine, and other supplies to begin a farming business.

loans.name: Cecilia Gregoria

texts.es: Cecilia tiene 23 años de edad y es soltera. Vive en casa de sus padres en un caserío pequeño y rural del distrito de Monsefú, una zona conocida por sus festividades turísticas y religiosas. Su vivienda cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo. La zona se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Cecilia se dedica al servicio de artesanía, específicamente la elaboración de sombreros. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 06 años. Vende sus productos en el mercado loca. Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de más insumos, como paja, para la elaboración de sus productos. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1300 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Con los ingresos de sus ventas, Cecilia puede solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 23 years old and single.  She lives in her parents' home in a small, rural village in Monsefú district.  This area is known for its tourist and religious festivities.  Her home has access to electricity and well water.  It is located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Cecilia makes handicrafts, specifically hats.  She has been in this business for six years.  She sells her products in the local market.  Cecilia would like to invest her loan in buying more supplies, such as straw, for making her products.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 1,300 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  Cecilia will use the income from her sales to cover her personal expenses and to support her parents with their household expenses.

loans.use: to buy more supplies, such as straw, to make hats

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel tiene 46  años de edad. Es casada y tiene dos hijos. Reside en casa de hermana junto a su familia en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, el distrito más grande de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Gana la vida brindando el servicio de transporte en su taxi. Cuenta con experiencia de 10 años en este rubro. Desea realizar algunos arreglos a su unidad para efectuar eficientemente su labor diaria. También tramitará documentos de su unidad como su seguro y licencia que fueron tomados durante un robo que sufrió. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Con esta inversión, podrá seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes y generando ingresos que usa para el sostenimiento económico de su familia.
texts.en: Manuel is 46 years old. He is married and has two children.  He and his family live with his sister in the José Leonardo Ortiz district, the largest district of the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque.  He makes a living providing transportation services in his taxi.  He has been doing this for 10 years.  He wants to make some repairs to his car in order to make his daily work more efficient.  He will also get documents fro his car such as the license and insurance, which were taken during a recent robbery.  For these reasons he is asking for a loan of 2000 new soles.  With this investment he will be able to continue giving good service to his customers and generate income which he uses for the support of his family.

loans.use: to repair his taxi so that he can offer better service to his customers.

loans.name: Zoljargal

texts.en:
Zoljargal is 26 years old and lives with her husband and daughter, aged three, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Together they live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer ger housing districts of the city. In 2007, Zoljargal graduated from the Mongolian State University of Education with a concentration in teaching Japanese. 

Zoljargal supports her family by operating the grocery store behind her family's yard with regular help from her husband. 

They began her business in 2006, and today they have 1,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) in working capital. With this loan of 1,200,000 MNT, Zoljargal's family wants to expand their food store to sell a constant variety of foods. 

In the future, Zoljargal wants to expand the store's size. Also, she wants to build a small house for her family in their current yard.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of food products to sell in the grocery store

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Sor S. is a local farmer who has been planting a variety of crops for years. She also relies on income from her husband, who is highly skilled at building stone and wooden houses. He has a few physical laborers to help provide his service. He receives a lot of orders from his clients to construct their houses. Sor S. has three married children and lives with her husband under one roof.

Sor S.’s husband has been paying money for taxis in order to provide his construction service because he doesn't own a vehicle. To solve this problem, Sor S. is applying for a loan to purchase a used motorcycle for her husband to ride to work.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for her husband to ride to work.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: PauL. es madre D. casa D. 43 años D. edad. Vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y 2 hijos en el caserio Los Riojas ubicado a 25 minutos  D. L. ciudad D. Túcume. Su comunidad es rural y pequeña con un aproximado D. 100 familias. Se gana L. vida desD. hace 10  años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en L. parte posterior D. su domicilio. Suele criar ganado porcino(lechones), ovino y pavos y patos. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan L. zona en donD. vive. Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización. Aprendió esta actividad D. sus padres, es decir conoce a L. perfección el rubro. Cuenta con ingresos adicionales D. su producción y venta D. chicha, una bebida típica D. Perú hecha D. harina D. maíz. PauL. solicita un crédito para invertir en L. compra D. aves menores para engorD. y alimento balanceado para las aves. También desea realizar algunos arreglos en el interior D. su domicilio. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo D. 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Con esta inversión, PauL. podrá aumentar sus ingresos y ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico D. su familia.
texts.en: PauL. is a 47-year-old housewife. She lives in her own house with her husband and two children. It is located in the Los Riojas neighborhood, which is about 25 minutes from Túcume City. She lives in a small, rural community of about 100 families. Since she was ten years old she has been earning a living raising and selling young animals, which are situated in a pen behind her house. She raises pigs (piglets), sheep and ducks. When the animals have grown to a sufficient size, she sells them to a buyer that always visits the area where she lives. This business relies on competence and also on the fact that there is a good market for her product. With additional income she will make and sell chicha, a typical drink of Perú maD. from corn flour. PauL. is asking for this loan in order to buy young birds in order to fatten them up and also to buy balanced food for the birds. She also would like to fix some things insiD. her house. For these needs she is asking for a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa. With this influx of funds, PauL. will be able to grow her earnings and help her husband with the economic support of their family.

loans.use: to buy more young birds in order to fatten them up and to buy balanced food for the birds.

loans.name: Martin Emedelio

texts.es: Martin tiene 36 años de edad y es soltero. Vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola bastante comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Gana la vida comprando limón de agricultores en la zona y vendiendo el producto en los mercados locales. Tiene 6 años de experiencia en este rubro. Desea aumentar su mercadería con la compra de más cajas de limones para vender. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles. Martin posee muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de su comunidad rural que lo conoce como un hombre trabajador y responsable.
texts.en: Martin is 36 years old and single. He lives in his parents house in the district of Olmos, a very comercial agricultural area that belongs to the province of Lambayeque, located more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. He earns his living buying lemons from farmers and selling the product in the local markets. He has six years of experience in this area. He wants to increase his merchandise by buying more boxes of lemons to sell. To do this, he has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles. Martin has very good personal and work references in his rural community, which knows him to be a hardworking and responsible man.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of lemons to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make more tables and chairs for her restaurant and to invest in buying her own real estate.

loans.name: Til

texts.en:
Til S. has been in farming business for a long time.  She had learned from her grandparent when she was still unmarried. She is now married and has four kids, three of whom are unmarried and the other is married and lives independently. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual activity with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Til S. is going to use her loan to buy a cow, fertilizers and seeds for planting in the dry season. 

Note: Til S. and her husband are shown in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a cow, fertilizers and seeds for planting in the dry season.

loans.name: Ysidro Manuel

texts.es: Ysidro tiene 34 años de edad. Es casado y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en el distrito de Razuri en la provincia de Ascope en el norte de Perú. Se dedica a trabajar como operario de pesca para una fábrica. También trabaja independientemente como pescador en bote desde hace más de 10 años. Actualmente su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado. Desea hacer unos arreglos para reforzarla y mejor proteger a su familia. Por ello, solicita un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Edpyme le ofrece una tasa de interés más bajo que otros bancos y prestamistas. Con este crédito, podrá seguir trabajando tranquilo sin perjudicar su liquidez diario. Ysidro es muy trabajador y responsable. Es bastante entregado a su familia y siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo.
texts.en: Ysidro is 34 years old. He is married and has three children. He lives in the Razuri District, in the Ascope Province, in the north of Perú. He works as a fish handler in a factory. For the past ten years he has also worked as an independent fisherman for boats. Actually, his house is deteriorating. He would like to make some improvements in order to stabilize it and thereby protect his family. For this end, he is asking for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa. Edpyme offers a lower interest rate than other banks and loan offices. With this loan he will be able to work with more peace of mind, as he won’t have to worry about money on a daily basis. Ysidro is a hard worker and is responsible. He works hard for his family and is always striving for their welfare and development.

loans.use: to fix his house in order to stablilize it and thereby protect his family.

loans.name: Manuela Maria

texts.es: Manuela tiene 40 años y es madre soltera. Vive en casa propia con su hijo menor. Vive en el caserío Punto Nueve, ubicado a 05 minutos de la ciudad de  Lambayeque en el norte de Perú. Manuela se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Manuela alimenta sus animales con polvillo, purina, maíz, etc. Negocia quincenalmente sus animales en los mercados de Chiclayo.  También se dedica a la venta de chicha, una bebida típica de Perú hecha de harina de maíz, la cual distribuye en su domicilio. Solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de alimento para sus animales. También desea comprar una jora lo que facilitará su elaboración de su chicha. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Con los ingresos de sus negocios, Manuela puede brindar una mejora calidad de vida para su hijo.
texts.en: Manuela is 40 years old and is a single mother. She lives in her own home with her young son. She lives in the village of Punto Nueve which is located five minutes from the city of Lambayeque in the north of Peru. Manuela raises and sells animals which she breeds in pens in the back of her home. Manuela feeds her animals rice bran, purina, corn, etc. Every two weeks she negotiates the sale of her animals in the markets of Chiclayo. She also sells chicha, a typical drink from Peru made with corn flour which she sells from her home. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of feed for her animals. She also wants to buy jora (a type of corn used to make chicha) which will allow her to make her chicha much more easily. This is why she is requesting a loan of 800 nuevos soles (PEN) from field partner Edpyme Alternativa. With the income from her businesses, Manuela can giver her son a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase more balanced feed for her poultry.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca tiene 43 años de edad. Es casada y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa propia en el Caserío Santa Isabel, ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope. Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en la parte exterior  de su domicilio. Francisca alimenta sus animales con polvillo, purina, maíz, etc. Ella vende quincenalmente sus animales en los mercados de Chiclayo y Lambayeque. Su esposo se dedica a trabajar como albañil y agricultor. Con los ingresos de su negocio, Francisca puede ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia. Francisca solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de animales y sus respectivos alimentos. Por ello, ha acudido a Edpyme Alternativa y los prestamistas de Kiva para su préstamo. Es cliente recurrente de Edpyme y canceló sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en: Francisca is 43 years old. She is married and has one child. She lives in her own house in the Santa Isabel settlement, located 15 minutes from the city of Mórrope. Her work is raising and selling animals, which she raises in pens located outside her home. Francisca feeds her animals rice bran, Purina feed, corn, etc. She sells her animals every two weeks at the markets in Chiclayo and Lambayeque. Her husband works as a mason and also a farmer. With the income from her business, Francisca is able to help her husband support the family economically. Francisca is requesting a loan to invest in buying animals and appropriate feed for them. For this reason, she is turning to Edpyme Alternativa and the Kiva lenders for her loan. She is a repeat client of Edpyme, and she made her previous payments in a punctual manner.

loans.use: to buy more animals to fatten up and to buy balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes for the school season such as blouses, shirts and shoes.

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia is 36 years old and lives in Kasur, which is a small city located in Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its leather industry. She moved here to a small house after her marriage to N. K.. Her husband operates a crockery-selling business. His shop is located in a nearby market where he runs his business. His shop is filled with different kinds of crockery such as glass, steel, and plastic, which helps him to target every kind of buyer. 

Nazia is a caring lady who stays at home and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. She makes the utmost effort to give comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s business. Through the loan, he will purchase more crockery to put in his shop to sell. Nazia hopes that her husband will be able to increase his income by selling the crockery to many more customers. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah. She is confident about her husband’s business growth. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nazia.

loans.use: To buy crockery to sell

loans.name: Irshaad's Group

texts.en:
Irshaad lives in a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, called Kasur. It is known for its tanneries industry. She is a 36-year-old lady, married to S. M.. Her husband is involved in a dairy business. He has some buffalos at home and they give a good amount of milk every day which he sells to community people. 

Irshaad is a housewife, staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. She is a very helpful lady and provides full support to her husband in operating his business. She gets up early in the morning and milks the buffalos, so her husband can sell the milk to his customers. 

Irshaad wants to improve her family business by buying another buffalo – that’s why she has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her family. 

In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Irshaad.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for a dairy business.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married with 2 sons. She lives in Uzhgorod, Western Ukraine. She sells sportswear and footwear in a local marketplace called ‘Krasnodontsiv’. Nataliya has a good vending facility and her own clientele. She has been running the business for 12 years. Presently, her net profit is over 4,300 Grivnyas a month.  

Nataliya boasts an impeccable reputation among her fellow market vendors. They all speak highly of her hard work, financial consciousness and persistence in business endeavors. Nataliya is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase spring/summer sportswear inventory and footwear. As temperatures go up in Ukraine and with summer just around the corner, Nataliya is hoping to re-stock her merchandise to be able to better serve her customers and meet their seasonal demand.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing and footwear for retail

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is married man who lives in the small resort town of Berdyansk. It’s a town on the Azov Sea in Ukraine. Most of the people living in this town make their living during the tourist season. Ivan is not an exception. He dries fish and sells it to tourists during the summer. His produce is reasonably priced, therefore, many can afford to enjoy it. Ivan has been in this business for 5 years. Currently, his gross income amounts to 50,000 Grivnyas. 

Ivan is seeking a 20,000 Grivnya loan to purchase raw pigfish to souse and dry. Ivan is not only planning to sell his merchandise by retail this summer. He has found some wholesalers who have offered him a good price for his dried fish which is why he is hoping to increase his sales and income as a result. Ivan enjoys running his business and is hoping to continue seeing it flourish and bring him consistent income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase pigfish to souse and dry for sale

loans.name: Nikolai

texts.en:
Nikolai is married with 3 children. He lives in the small town of Privetnoye and grows early spring vegetables, i.e. peppers, cabbage, onions, beets and eggplant. He started this agricultural venture 10 years ago because he could barely make ends meet and was forced to find ways to feed his family. Presently, Nikolai has already invested about 80,000 Grivnyas in his farming enterprise.  

Nikolai is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase farming supplies for the new season. He is planning to invest 2,000 Grivnyas in purchase of fertilizers, 2,000 Grivnyas in polyethylene film, 2,000 Grivnyas in seeds, 3,000 Grivnyas in lubricants and 6,000 Grivnyas in purchase and installation of a drip irrigation unit. Nikolai is hoping to grow and harvest 50,000 peppers, 20,000 eggplants, 20,000 cabbage heads, 100,000 onions and about 5 tons of beets.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, plastic film, seeds, a drip irrigation unit and other agricultural supplies

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
This is 23 year-old Rina M.. She is married and has one child, aged 4. In 2000, she established her business making brass religious statues. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys raw materials for her business. In the future, Rina plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts. Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone. With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her statue making business

loans.name: Ramita

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Ramita M.. She is married and has one child, aged 9. In 1999, Ramita established her business making brass religious statues. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. In the future, Ramita plans to raise her family's economic condition. She thanks you for your support.

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts. Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone. With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Marat

texts.en:
Marat K. is 48, married and has three children. He has been a farmer since 1986 and cultivates corn, cabbage and safflower which give him a profit about 10,000 KGS a month. With the revenues, he was able to pay for the education of his elder children and buy a car for his family.

Marat plans to use this loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase fertilizers, seeds and combustive-lubricating materials in order to assist in seeding. It will allow him to get a good harvest and further broaden his farming activities.

About Bai-Tushum and Partners

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and combustive-lubricating materials

loans.name: Krishna Maya

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Krishna Maya M. is married and has three children aged twenty, eighteen and twelve. In 2000, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. In the future, Krishna Maya plans to lift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, a small grocery store called a pasal is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 square feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

BPW Partner Page: Join our lending team, BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods for her business

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina B. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Dina has a small hotel (restaurant), which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Dina has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more food to cook for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Dina hopes to generate greater profits and pay for her house rent and food for her family.  In the future, Dina hopes to build a house of her own. Dina is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more food to cook and sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 31 years old and is married with one child. Her child is 1 year and 11 months old. 

Gina is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice for six years. She earns about 6,000 PHP per month doing this farming.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, Gina hopes to put up another business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose M. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Rose has a tailoring business, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more materials to make clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Rose hopes to own a salon. Rose is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to make clothes for resale.

loans.name: Hasifah

texts.en:
Hasifah K. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga, in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is currently in school. Hasifah has a small retail shop, which she has had for 3 years.

To help expand her business, Hasifah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities like soap for resale. With the help of this loan from BRAC, Hasifah hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, Hasifah hopes to become a wholesaler in secondhand clothes. 

Hasifah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities like soap for resale.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
29-year-old Jenelyn is a married woman living in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has two children who are six and three years old. Jenelyn is engaged in farming. Her husband is a farmer and she helps him grow rice. Jenelyn said they have been in this business for six years. Jenelyn is planning to raise and sell pigs.

Jenelyn's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and piglets. She hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase plantains, eddoes, potatoes, yams and other vegetables.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is 20 years old and still single. He lives in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato with his family. Kevin helps his family grow rice at their farm. He also raises ducks.

Kevin always wanted to have his own bakery. He said that he wants to start slowly and hopefully be able to reach his dream. Kevin now makes banana cakes that he sells to the people in his community. He works hard helping his family and growing his business.

This loan will be used to purchase bananas, flour and sugar.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, flour and sugar

loans.name: Gyan Maya

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Gyan Maya M., who is married and has three children aged 20, 18 and 11, established her grocery store business in 2001. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she is able to support her family. Gyan Maya has already received and repaid four loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent one to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, she plans to continue to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: to buy groceries for her business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce M. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has one child, who is not currently in school. Joyce has a business selling clothes, which she has had for 2 years.

To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale. With the help of this loan from BRAC, Joyce hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Joyce hopes to buy a plot and build a house on it. 

Joyce is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by showing her how to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 30-year-old farmer from Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He is still single and hopes to have his own family someday.

Michael has been growing rice for six years. He sells his harvest to the market. Michael works hard to grow his business and have his own savings. He hopes for his business to be stable for his future family.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem lives in a single-room house in the city of Lahore with her husband and five children. Lahore is Pakistan’s second largest city and famous for its history and culture. She has been living there for the past 12 years. She is 42 years old. She spends most of her time at home and takes care of her family. To support her family financially, she also does sewing work for her neighborhood clients. 

Her husband's name is N. A. and he operates a dairy business. For this purpose, he has five buffalos at his home. He milks them daily and sells to his community clients and different milk shops for a profit.  Shameem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to expand her husband's dairy business. Through the loan, he will buy another buffalo, which will increase the milk productivity and his sales. He has been operating this business for the past 12 years and Shameem is hopeful that with the loan investment, his business will definitely improve further and increase his profit. 
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In her previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 48 years old, was not able to attend school and is married. Her husband works in construction and they have eight children between the ages of 35 and 19. All of them attended school and now live on their own. 

Sarah has been in business for 35 years, selling coal pots, fire spoons, pot cleaners, brooms and other products. She learned how to do business from her aunt. She likes having her own business, especially when things are going well and she has good sales, but it's a challenge when business is slow. 

Sarah has requested a loan to purchase coal pots, brooms, pot cleaners and other products to sell. In the future, she wants to save to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase coal pots, brooms, pot cleaners, and other products to sell

loans.name: Garmai

texts.en:
Garmai is a 44-year-old married mother of eight children between the ages of 20 and 35, some whom are are still in school, but all of whom live on their own. Garmai, who was not able to go to school, lives with her husband, a cook, in Paynesville.

Garmai has a business selling oil, rice, bread, candy, other food items, and coal, an activity she has been involved in for 35 years, having learned it from her sister. She says sometimes the business is really good and all of her products move very fast, while other times it is slow. Nonetheless, she is proud of having a business that has enabled her to provide for her family.

Garmai has requested a loan to purchase coal, oil, rice and other products for her business. In the future she wants to have a house of her own that she can share with her children.

loans.use: to purchase coal, oil, rice and other products for her business.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child.  None of her children is currently in school.  Annet has a small retail shop, which she has had for four years.         

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities like sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Annet hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food.  In the future, Annet hopes to study a course on hairdressing. Annet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 31 years old and lives in Banga, South Cotabato with his family. He is married and has one child. Anthony is engaged in farming. According to him, he has been growing rice and corn crops for three years. He usually earns 5,000 PHP doing this farming. Anthony also owns cows.

Anthony's loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. He hopes for his business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Nabila's Group

texts.en:
Nabila is a 29-year-old housewife and a teacher. She teaches in a nearby school and after her teaching job, she comes back home and fulfills her household responsibilities. She is a very responsible person and tries her best to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. Her husband's  name is M. K. and he has a bicycle repair shop. He offers his services to his customers and earns income for the family. He also puts bicycle spare parts in his shop to sell to his customers. Nabila is the mother of a son and a daughter. She knows the importance of education. That’s why she has enrolled both of her children in school. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. Through the loan, he will buy bicycle spare parts and repair tools to expand his business and to provide better quality services to his customers.  Nabila is hopeful that by using his 15 years of experience in this business, her husband will successfully be able to improve the financial condition of his business. 

She lives in Lahore, which is a historic city of Pakistan and a capital of Punjab province. She has spent all her life after marriage in the area of Yadgar.

loans.use: To buy bicycle spare parts and repair tools

loans.name: Rita
