L. is requesting a loan of $600 USD to purchase more goods for her husband to expand his construction business. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more goods to expand the construction business

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van I., 39, resides in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. I. and her husband are employed at the factory, earning an income of $5 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend $90 USD on food and $35 USD on other necessary expenses. I. is requesting a loan of $500 USD to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Lkhamsuren

texts.en: Mrs. Lkhamsuren is 35 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a house which they built a few years ago. Her husband Bayarkhuu is a car mechanic. Mrs. Lkhamsuren has run an auto repair and service business for four years together with her husband. She uses her garage as a workshop. She gets enough customers, especially during the transition time from winter to summer and vice versa. She has a good reputation in the area for the quality of her service and her reasonable pricing. She is planning to install a big car jack in her garage to improve accessibility to the bottom of the car and to make her job easier.

loans.use: to buy and install a big car jack in her garage to improve accessibility to the bottom of the car and to improve the quality of service

loans.name: Julianita

texts.en:
Julianita is 54 years old and married with five children.  With one child still in school, Julianita works very hard to provide for her family.

Julianita runs a dry goods business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like umbrellas, slippers, bags, etc., to sell in her store.

Julianita has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as umbrellas, bags, t-shirts, sandals, etc. In the future she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more umbrellas, slippers, bags, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 58 years old and married with five children.

Lilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like sardines, oils, groceries, etc.

Lilia has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for two years and also earns an income from a repair shop.

Lilia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more sardines, oils, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is from the village of Mobod, Oroquieta City. She is 37 years old, married and has two school-aged children. Ailyn runs a business selling fish in the local community. Ailyn has been engaged in her business for 7 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

Ailyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP with which she will purchase more fish to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Ailyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell in the local community.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 33 years old and married with 3 children, all of whom attend school. Concepcion works very hard to provide for them.

Concepcion runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell such as shampoo, curls, groceries, etc. in her store. Concepcion has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, cream, sugar and others. In the future, Concepcion would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Altantsetseg, 20 years old, lives with her husband and son Ariunerdene, 3, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Currently they live in Altantsetseg’s parents’ neighborhood in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Altantsetseg’s husband has been selling animal feed in the Khangai, one of Ulaanbaatar’s outdoor animal markets, since 2009. Altantsetseg used to work with her husband at the market, but she recently graduated a training course as a beautician. She is planning to run a beauty care business and she has done some projections and planning. She found a proper place to rent and she now needs to buy some beauty care equipment from China to open the salon. Therefore, she is asking for a loan to buy her equipment and to open her beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy beauty care equipment and to open her beauty salon.

loans.name: Los

texts.en: Los F., 53, resides in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. F. and her husband sell dry cow meat, earning an income of USD 8 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 73 on food and USD 10 on the other necessary expenses. Los is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a business as a motor-taxi driver. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to start a new business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman from Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She is engaged in farming and primarily grows rice. She said that the income from the farm helps her family a lot. Cristina works hard to keep her farm productive.

Cristina's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds. In the future, she hopes that her family's living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Xinh's Group

texts.en:
Xinh T. N. is  45 years old with 2 children who are attending university and college. To provide good conditions for her children's education, she has to work very hard.  She focused on growing rice, vegetables and raising chickens for meat, because these agricultural endeavors would meet her family's needs for food.  As a client of our credit program since 2007, she has used loans effectively in expanding her farming.  This has led to higher loan sizes year after year.  Now, she needs a loan of 7,630,000 VND to buy fertilizer for the next crop.

Anh T. D. is 35 years old. She manages a small grocery shop in the local market. She needs 7,630,000 VND to buy more kinds of flowers to meet customer demand.

Hang T. H. is 30 years old. She is raising 10 pigs for meat. She needs a loan of 7,630,000 VND to improve the pig pen.

Lan T. H. is 35 years old. She is raising 200 chickens for meat. She needs a loan of 7,630,000 VND to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the next crop

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.en:
Aida T. is from the village of Brgy. Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 55 years old and the group leader of an 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Aida is married and has 10 adult-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Aida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Aida is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Aida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 42 years old and married with five children. Her oldest child is 11 years old and the youngest is only 8 months.

Cristina is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice for five years. Cristina also makes native products like baskets and sells them to the market. Cristina works hard to provide for her family.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. In the future, she hopes to have a successful business and children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Romula

texts.en:
Romula is from the village of Punta Dulapo, Oroquieta City. She is 55 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. Romula runs a business selling fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it.

Romula joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP with which she will purchase more fish to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Romula from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Lien T. L. is 52 years old with 3 children. She is providing an education for two children. She started farming when her children were young and mostly focused on growing rice, vegetables and raising chickens for meat, because these agricultural endeavors would support her family's diet.  As a client of our credit program since 2006, she has used loans effectively to expand her farming. This has resulted in higher loan sizes year after year. Now, she needs a loan of 8,938,000 VND to buy fertilizer for the next crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the next crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle which will be used by her daughters to ride to work.

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en: Hiep T. N., 33 years old with two children, is living  in Xuan Trach commune. Being a farmer, her main activities are focused on growing rice in a paddy of 4800 square meters  and raising laying chickens. These agricultural products are partly used by her family for food and the rest sold for daily income.  Attending  our program since 2006, Hiep has used past loans to expand her rice and egg laying business and has more money to send to her saving account.  She is requesting for  a loan of   6,322,000 VND to buy fertilizer and feed for her chickens.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and feed for her laying chickens..

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Huong T. L. D., 22 years old with 1 child, is living in Ngoc loi commune. One year after getting married, she opened a wood workshop that makes home equipment. Her business is running  well and creates a considerabL. income for her family.  Huong has been attending our credit program since 2006, She used her first loan of 1,900,000 Vietnamese dong to invest in buying  material. Year after year, her loans are bigger. For this new loan cycL., Huong  is requesting a loan of 7,630,000 Vietnamese dong to buy a new  cutting machine.

D. T. Ve  is 45 years old with 2 children. She is  running a wood workshop. She needs to have a loan of 5,014,000 Vietnamese dong to buy clothes.

Mui T. N. is 47 years old with 2 children. Being a farmer, she focuses on doing farming. She now  wants to have a loan of 5,886,000 Vietnamese dong to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

L. T. N. is 40 years old with 2 children. She is raising 200 chickens for eggs . She needs to have a loan of 5,886,000 Vietnamese dong to buy food for them.

Lua T. N. is 38 years old with 2 children. She is managing a vegetabL. shop in a local market. She needs  to have a loan of 5,886,000 Vietnamese dong to improve  her shop.

Man T. L. is 45 years old with 2 children. She is selling wood. She needs to have a loan of 5,886,000 Vietnamese dong to buy more products.

010103070005-4991

loans.use: to buy a new  cutting machine

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
53-year-old Delia is a married woman with two children. They live in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Delia and her husband are both farmers. They till land located in their town. Rice is the basic crop that they grow. According to Delia, they have been engaged in farming for 20 years.

Delia does her best to grow their business and provide for her family. She requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

In the future, Delia hopes that her children will succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an extra cow to sell.

loans.name: Nazgul's Group

texts.en:
Nazgul A. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Kochkor, a nice village in the Isykul region. Nazgul is 32 and married to a taxi driver. They have a daughter and two sons; the first son is at school and the other children are of preschool age (under seven). In order to make money to cover family expenses, the family cultivates agricultural products. They also breed livestock and then sell them at a higher price after fattening. Nazgul hopes to obtain this loan because she needs money to purchase barley seeds. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase barley seeds.

loans.name: Efleda

texts.en:
Efleda, from the village of Layawan, Oroquieta City, is 56 years old, married, and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Efleda has been operating a tailoring services business in the local community for 20 years, earning approximately 3000 PHP a month. She joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

Efleda is now requesting her fourth loan of 5000 PHP with which to purchase cloth for her tailoring services and plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her service.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for her tailoring services.

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr.Bayarsaikhan, a 35-year-old taxi driver, lives with his wife and three daughters in a small house in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His eldest daughter attends primary school, while the second one attends a kindergarten and the youngest one stays at home in her mother's care.

Bayarsaikhan has been operating a taxi business for seven years, while his wife looks after the children. An experienced taxi driver, he likes his job and earns around 300 USD a month. During the past seven years he has managed to buy a family car and a small family house from his savings. Bayarsaikhan is now requesting a loan to renovate the house where they live. The loan will enable him to buy necessary building materials such as cement, sand, wood planks, paints, and plasters.

loans.use: to buy necessary building materials such as cement, sand, wood planks, paints, and plasters to renovate the family house.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Anh  T. N.  is  45  years old with 2 children  who are attending University and College. To provide  good education conditions, she has to work very hard.  Anh is mostly focused on growing  rice, vegetables and raising chickens for meat. This meets her family's  food needs.  Being a client of our credit program since 2007, she has used loans effectively in expanding farming. For this reason, her loan sizes are higher year after year. Now, Anh needs to have a loan of 7,630,000 VND to buy  fertilizer for her next crop.

loans.use: to buy  fertilizer for the next crop.

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Batjargal is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a 'ger',  aMongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Hovd province, Mongolia. His sons, age 10 and 12, attend local secondary school. He manages meat sales and used clothing trading businesses with the help of his wife.

 Batjargal himself is responsible for selling meat and meat products and his wife is responsible for selling used clothing. He started his meat trading business in 2003 and gained much experience. His business was quite successful which allowed him to start up the used clothing trading business in 2010. Even with one year of business operations, he has managed to stabilize his business and became well-known amongst his customers.

 Now he earns a daily profit of 10,000-15,000 MNT from his meat sales business and a monthly profit of 300,000 MNT from his used clothing business. He is a polite man who says, "I am planning to continue my businesses in the future." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more used clothes for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim N., 40, resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. N. is a farmer and sells fish and vegetables using her bicycle, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a traditional musician, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 74 on food and USD 35 on other necessary expenses. 

N. is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase a motorbike to transport fish to sell. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport fish to sell.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg is 52 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a 'ger', a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband is retired and her three older children live and work on their own. Her youngest daughter, age 8, goes to a local secondary school. 

Narantsetseg manages a dairy product sales business in her town. She started her business in 1990 in a rented stall at a local market. Since then she has managed to stabilize her business and built a strong customer base. Now she has a very good relationship both with her customers and her suppliers. She collects her dairy products from herders and sells them to town residents. 

Narantsetseg is a diligent woman who says, "I am saving my earnings in order to help my children succeed in life." She is requesting a 250,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a second motorbike.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Самехова Мухаё проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 38 лет. Она замужем, имеет троих детей. Её муж находится в России. Сама она имеет среднее образование. Занимается произведением искусства, вышивкой. Она берет однотонные ткани и вышивает разные рисунки. Этим видом деятельности занимается 8 лет. Кредит просит для приобретения ниток и тканей.
texts.en: Muhayo S. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 38 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is in Russia. She has a secondary education. She works in the art of embroidery.  She takes monochromatic fabrics and embroiders different pictures. She has been doing this work for eight years.  She is taking out a loan to buy threads and fabrics.

loans.use: to buy threads and fabrics.

loans.name: Sod-Erdene

texts.en:
Sod-Erdene is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a 'ger', a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia, His older son attends local secondary school while the younger one is in kindergarten.

Sod-Erdene manages an auto repair business in his town. He started his business in 2010 after working as a repairman for four years at a private company. Even with only one year of business operations, he has been able to employ one more worker and is planning to expand his business in the future.

Sod-Erdene is a hard-working man who attributes his success to his good accounting skill. He says, "I am trying to provide the best services to my customers in order to attract them and to continue to expand my business in the future." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts and to employ yet another worker.

loans.use: To purchase auto parts.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.en:
Muhayo is 40 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives with her children in Tursunzade, Tajikistan. She sells foodstuffs in her grocery store. Earlier, her husband was engaged in this business and since he left to work in Russia, she has continued this business. She has been in this business for two years. 

The loan she is requesting is to buy more products for her grocery store so she can get more income. She is a hard-working person who started her business from a small working capital of 500 USD. She would like to get a loan of 1000 USD to purchase new goods to increase her working capital. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Yang

texts.en:
Yang S., 31, resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. S. and her husband are farmers and sell palm sugar, earning an income of 5 USD each per day. Each month the family has to spend 50 USD on food and 35 USD on the other necessary expenses.

S. is requesting a loan of 600 USD to purchase traditional grinding tools to resell. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy traditional grinding tools to resell

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en: Jovelyn is from the village of Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City. She is 30 years old, married and has four adult children. To make a living, Jovelyn runs a business selling fish in the local community. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Jovelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP with which she will purchase more fish to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jovelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

location.town: Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Rasoolan's Group

texts.en:
Rasoolan lives in Mian Channu, which is a small city located in Punjab, a province of Pakistan known for its agricultural industry. She lives with her family in a two-room house. She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to improve her husband’s livestock business. He buys young animals, raises them, and sells to customers. With this loan, he will buy animals such as goats and sheep to sell at good profit. He started this business 20 years ago and it has worked well for him. Rasoolan is very hopeful about the future growth of her husband’s business and about a better financial future for her family. 

Rasoolan is a housewife. She stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is 51 years old and still very active at this age. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep to sell.

loans.name: Eng's Group

texts.en: This loan group has 16 members and is led by Mrs. Eng, who is married, has two children and was born in 1984. She and her husband, Mr. Touch, who was born in 1980, make a living by growing rice and mushrooms on a one-hectare farm that they own. They plan to use their portion of this loan to prepare to plant their next crop by buying  fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for a new rice crop.

loans.name: Big

texts.en:
Big S., 62, resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. S. and her husband sell snacks, corn, and yams, earning an income of 4 USD each per day. Each month, the family has to spend 74 USD on food and 10 USD on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike with a trailer attached to transport vegetables and fish for sellers at the market. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike with a trailer attached

loans.name: Mouk's Group

texts.en: The 16 people we see here are part of a loan group led by Mrs. Mouk, who is married, has three children and was born in 1983. Her husband, Mr. Pring, who was born in 1984, makes a living as a construction worker. One of their children is in school now while the other two are too young to attend. Mrs. Mouk makes a living as a farmer, growing rice on a small plot of land she owns. She has applied for this loan to prepare for her next crop by buying fertilizer and pesticides, and to pay the laborers she hires to help on the farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and to pay the laborers who work on her farm.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao S., 28, resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantation. Mao sells fish, earning an income of 10 USD per day. Her husband buys cows to resell, earning an income of 6 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 74 USD on food and 10 USD on the other necessary expenses.

S. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase cows for her husband to resell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy cows for her husband to resell

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of sixteen members. Mrs. Nan married woman was born in 1972 is a village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the others members. 

Her husband, Mr. Ngin, who was born in 1964, works as construction worker. He can earn a small salary to help support his family. They have a child who is 3 years old.

Mrs. Nan is a farmer who owns 1.20-hectare plot of land which she uses to grow rice and different vegetables. In order to improve her rice and vegetable field, she would like to ask for a loan to buy a water machine for supporting her farming crops.

loans.use: To buy a water machine for growing crops.

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.ru: Hamlet I. 45 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Hamlet yavlyayetsya IDP personom, on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy jenoy i detmi. Hamlet uje 11 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom , razvodit korov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya molochnix produktov dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Hamlet I. is 45 years old.  He is married and has two children.  Hamlet is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his wife and children. Hamlet has been a dairy farmer for eleven years.   Now he needs 2300 AZN to buy cows to increase his milk production.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Nimrod

texts.en:
Nimrod, a 53-year-old man, is married to Sumini, a 36-year-old lady. They are blessed with a son, Paskalis, who is 14 years old and in the second grade of junior high school. They are living in a modest house in Oeleta Penkase Village.

In order to meet his family's needs and Paskalis’ education needs, Nimrod is running a broiler (chicken) business. Besides running the broiler business, Nimrod is also selling gravel to generate more daily income. Nimrod never had a formal education but he has the spirit to move forward. 

Nimrod dreams to improve his business as currently he only has 2 boxes of chicks to breed. He wishes to generate more income from the business. He plans to add 7 boxes of chicks and 4 sacks of fodder (feed) for this business. In order to make his dream come true, then, Nimrod is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 IDR from TLM. He plans to spend the loan on chicks and fodder. This loan means a lot to Nimrod and he is hoping that TLM will approve his loan application.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and fodder

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is from the village of Mohon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Mercy runs a business venture in the Food sector selling fish in the local community. 

Mercy has been engaged in her business for nine years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. Mercy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000.

Mercy is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP with which she will purchase more fish to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Mercy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loA. consists of eighteen members. Mr. Sok, born in 1956, is a village bank president. He was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. 

He and his wife, Mrs. Eam, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to grow rice for supporting their family. They would like to grow rice in the dry seasO., but they do not have enough money to cultivate it. Thus, in order to improve this farming, Mr. Sok would like to ask for a loA. to buy a water machine and fertilizers for growing rice. Aside from farmers, Mr. Sok also earned for living by working as government worker. 

They have four children: three are seamstresses in the garment factories and the last one is laborer.

loans.use: To buy a water machine, fertilizers for growing rice.

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en: Nazia lives in Mian Channu, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agricultural industry. She has been living there with her family for the past 16 years. She is 29 years old, married to M. S. and has three children. Unfortunately, none of them are able to attend school due to financial constraints. Nazia's husband has a business selling Punjabi food. He has a small restaurant where he sells different types of food items such as Nan Chanay (made with chickpeas and served with bread) and Daal Chawal (made with lentils and served with rice and pickle). These dishes have a very good taste in his hands and his clients like his food very much. Nazia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband who wants to improve his business further. With this loan, he will buy required ingredients such as lentils, cooking oil, rice, spices and chickpeas, etc., that will enable him to prepare better quality food and increase his profits. Nazia is hopeful that this investment will be a productive one for her husband and make him more profits in future. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: to buy required ingredients for a restaurant business.

loans.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan belongs to Mian Channu which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family for the past 30 years. She is a 56-year-old lady and has 4 sons. Three of them are involved in a wheat & rice selling business while the 4th one is studying.  Her husband himself operates a business selling animals like goats and sheep. Most of his clients are butchers who purchase animals from him to sell their meat.  

Bashiraan herself is a housewife and does her household responsibilities, staying at home.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s animal-selling business. Using the loan, he will buy some goats and sheep to sell at a good profit.  He has been in this business for many years and hopes that an investment will help him earn more profits.  

Bashiraan is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy goats & sheep for animal-selling business.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe, age 54, raises and sells pigs to members of the local community. She has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. She and her husband have three grown children and live in the village of Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. 

Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities.

Fe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, with which she will purchase feed for her pigs. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Fe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Tom's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fifteen members. Mrs. Tom was born in 1951 is a village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the others members. 

Mrs. Tom is a farmer who owns a plot of land. She grows rice and vegetables for a living. In order to improve her farming, she would like to ask for a loan for supporting her farming crops. Aside from being a farmer, she also earns her living by selling vegetables in the local market. 

Mrs. Tom is a widow with two children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and one is farmer.

loans.use: For supporting her farming crops.

loans.name: Khayala

texts.ru:
Khayala zamujem i imeyet odnoqo rebonka kotoromu 3 qoda. Khayala K. rodilas v 1984 qodu. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas vmeste so svoyey semyoy projivayet v Fuzuli regione.
Ona uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya pticevodstvom, v osnovnom ona razvodit kuric i indeyek. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit kuric i indeyet dlya uvelicheniya i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en:
Khayala is married and has a three-year-old child.  Khayala K. was born in 1984.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her family.

She has been poultry farming for two years, primarily raising chickens and turkeys.  Now she needs 2300 AZN to buy chickens and to expand and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and turkeys

loans.name: Rous' Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fourteen members. Mrs. Rous was born in 1964 is a village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. 

She and her husband, Mr. Doeuk who was born in 1963, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to grow vegetables. This is how they support their family. In order to improve the farming, Mrs. Rous would like to ask for a loan for supporting her farming crop.

This couple has four children: one is a police officer, two are seamstresses in the garment factories, and the last one is student.

loans.use: For supporting her farming crop.

loans.name: Davlatbibi

texts.ru: Саидова Давлатбиби проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем, имеет 4 детей. Ее муж работает в России. Сама она занимается шитьем национальных платьев. У нее среднее образование. Она берет заказы на дому. Этим видом деятельности занимается три года. Кредит просит для покупки тканей, чтобы сшить платья для продажи.
texts.en: Davlatbibi S. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband works in Russia. She works sewing traditional dresses. She has a secondary education. She takes orders at home. She has been doing this work for three years. She is taking out a loan to buy fabrics to sew new dresses for sale.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to sew new dresses.

loans.name: Hun's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of ten members. Mrs. Hun, born in 1960, is a village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the others members. 

Mrs. Hun is a winter-melon seller in the market who is able to earn a small income to support her family. In order to improve her business, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more winter-melons for selling. Aside from her winter-melon business, She also earns by selling fish.

Mrs. Hun is widow with four children: one is a wedding beautician, one is a winter melon seller, and the other two are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more winter-melons for selling.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 58 years old and married with three children. Her oldest child is 36 years old.

Elsie is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice for 36 years. Elsie earns about 7,000 PHP per month doing this farming. Elsie works hard to support her family. She also wants to help send her grandchildren to school.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Phun's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nine members. Mrs. Phun is a village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. Each member of this village bank loan will use their money to support their different purpose. 

Mrs. Phun and her husband, Mr. Chea, are farmers who own a 1.50-hectare plot of land which they use to cultivate winter melon for supporting their family. In order to improve their farming, Mrs. Phun would like to ask for a loan to help support her farming crop. Aside from being a farmer, Mr. Chea also earns his living by fishing. 

This couple has two children who are seamstresses in the garment factory.

loans.use: For supporting her farming crop.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine, age 29, sells rice, sugar, and sweet potatoes from a shop that she operates along with her husband. She has been in this business for seven years. It has enabled her and her husband to meet the immediate requirements of their family. They have two small children, the elder of whom is four years old.

Alphonsine is requesting a loan to buy more rice, sugar, and sweet potatoes to offer for sale in her shop. The profits she will earn will be used to rehabilitate the family house. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and sweet potatoes to offer for sale in her shop

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nine members. Mrs. Kong, born in 1961, is a village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the others members. 

She and her husband, Mr. Sorm who was born in 1955, are farmers who own a 1.40-hectare plot of land which they use to grow rice and winter melon. In order to support this farming, Mrs. Kong would like to ask for a loan for supporting her farming crops. Aside from farmer, Mr. Sorm also earned for living buy fishing. 

They have five children: three are farmers who support their parents farming, and the other two are students.

loans.use: To support farm crops.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 51 years old and married with five children. Her oldest child is 31 years old and the youngest is 13 years old.

Erlinda is engaged in farming and has been growing rice for 15 years. She is happy to have the farm because it helps her family a lot. Erlinda is in need of fertilizers and rice seeds. The loan she requested will be used to purchase her farming needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds

loans.name: Háy's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of ten members. Mrs. Háy, born in 1950, is a village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the others members.

She and her husband, Mr. Sdeoung, are farmers who own a 1-hectare plot of land which they use to grow vegetables and corn for supporting their family.  In order to improve their farming, Mrs. Háy would like to ask for a loan to help support her farming crops. 

They have four children: one is a farmer, two are car taxi drivers, and the last one is attending a local school.

loans.use: to support her farming crops.

loans.name: Ahliddin

texts.en:
Ahliddin, age 29,  is a hard-working and talented man. He sells spare parts and car accumulators in his store. He learned this business with the help of his mother because she worked in this business as well. He started in this kind of business 15 years ago with working capital in the amount of 5,000 Somoni. Today he is the owner of his business. He and his wife have three children and live in Tursunzade, Tajikistan. 

Ahliddin would like to request a loan of 12,000 Somoni so he can purchase spare auto parts and to expand his business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the location of the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, is home to epic mountain passes, and represents a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium B.C. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To buy spare auto parts

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is 36 years old and married with five children. His oldest child is 12 years old and the youngest is 5.

Ernesto is a farmer. He tills his own land in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He has been growing rice for eight years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP from this farming. Ernesto works hard to provide for his family. He also makes sure to set aside a budget for his children's education.

This loan will be used to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Chhorn's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of ten members. Mrs. Chhorn, born in 1953, is a village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the others members. 

She and her husband, Mr. Sam who was born in 1952, are farmers. They own a 2-hectare plot of land on which they grow corn and winter melons for supporting their family. In order to improve their farming, Mrs. Chhorn would like to ask for a loan to help support her farming crops. With the rest of the loan, she will buy a supplies for fishing.

This couple has two children who are seamstresses in the garment factories.

loans.use: to support her farming crops.

loans.name: Marce

texts.en:
Marce, a 31-year-old entrepreneur, is living in Noelbaki with her husband, Elton, a 31-year-old man who works as an electronic repairman. They have two children. The children are Vicky, who is 11 years old and in the 4th grade of elementary school, and Aurel, who is 1 year old. 

Marce is known as a pastry, fried bread and donut maker in the village where she lives. She has been running the business for one year. The business was inherited from her mother before she passed away two years ago. Now Marce is responsible for continuing this business. Marce only sells pastries on particular events, such as Christmas Day and Idul Fitri (the three-day Muslim holiday that marks the end of Ramadan), or on order from the customer. She usually operates her business from 3 p.m. to 6 p.m. 

Marce is grateful as she has a skill to help her family in generating more money. Marce realizes that her family cannot rely on her husband's income source as an electronic repairman. Marce was thinking to add a kind of cookie called “kiri-kiri," which is made of flour, egg, sugar and salt. She was also thinking to buy electronic equipment for her husband. 

She heard about the TLM Individual Lending Program and through the field officer, she got an explanation about the program. Marce is interested in joining the program, and then she is requesting a loan of IDR 4,000,000 from TLM. She really hopes that TLM is willing to assist her in improving her business.

loans.use: to add a kind of cookie and to purchase electronic equipment.

loans.name: Gavharoy

texts.ru: Кахорова Гавхарой жительница Шахринавского района. Ей 43 года. Она замужем, имеет троих детей. Её муж работает в строительной компании. Сама Гавхарой имеет среднее образование. Она более 6 лет занимается торговлей. У нее магазин со смешанным ассортиментом. Она берет кредит для покупки муки, масла, мягких игрушек и сувениров.
texts.en: Gavharoy K. lives in Shahrinav. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband works for a construction company.  Gavharoy has a secondary education. She has been working in trade for more than six years. She has a shop where she stocks a wide variety of goods. She is taking out a loan to buy flour, oil, soft toys and knickknacks.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, soft toys and knickknacks.

loans.name: Madine

texts.en: Madine is 23 years .She is married and has 1 child who is 1 year old. She sells clothes. She started this business 4 years ago. Her husband sells food. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes. In the future she hopes to expand her business by making enough savings and reinvesting in the business.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is from the village of Binuangan, Oroquieta City. She is 60 years old, married and has three adult children. Teresita runs a business selling dried fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. She joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.
 
Teresita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP with which she will purchase more dried fish to sell. This loan will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Jenibeb

texts.en:
24-year-old Jenibeb is a married woman with two young children. Her oldest child is four years old.

Jenibeb is engaged in farming. She has been growing rice for five years. Jenibeb is working hard to help provide for her family. She is also saving for her children's future.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Trayanus

texts.en:
Trayanus is a 43-year-old man. He is married to Yohana and has been blessed with three children, namely:
1.\tMartin, 18 years old
2.\tRonaldo, 17 years old, studying in Junior high school 
3.\tYance, 15 years old, studying in Junior high school.
Trayanus has a motorcycle repair business located in Noelbaki area. He has been involved in this business for about one year. He is skilled in patching leaky tires, tuning chains, changing tires or simply adding air to tires. The income generated from this business is unstable and he struggles to finance the daily needs of his family. Therefore, he really wants to improve his business but he has no capital to do so.  
 
He heard about the TLM lending program from a TLM Loan Officer. He is requesting a loan from TLM of IDR 4,500,000. He wants to purchase motorcycle lubricant and new tires. He would then be able to not only repair tires but, also, change the lubricant and sell tires. He hopes that his loan application will be approved so that he can improve his repair shop business.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle lubricant and new tires

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.en:
Mehriniso is married with four children. She sells all kinds of bakery products in her commercial location. The market is located in a good area that brings many clients. Mehriniso has operated this business for 7 years. She always offers good, fresh products. Her clients know and value this.  Mehrinoso is honest, entrepreneurial and hard-working. She makes every effort to make her business a nice, attractive place for her customers.

Mehriniso is requesting a loan of 5,000 Somoni to expand her business and increasing her working capital. She hopes to use the additional income to improve her business conditions.   
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy bakery products

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 49 years old and married with two children aged 28 and 26. She owns a farming business in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Jessica grows rice and sells her harvest to her town's market. Jessica works hard to provide for the needs of her household. She also wants to help send her grandchildren to school.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, Jessica hopes to be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Odille

texts.en: Odille is a 26-year-old married lady with a 1-year-old child. Odille’s husband works in the same business as her. They sell motorcycle spare parts and services. The business was started seven years ago. This has enabled them to meet their needs. Her loan will be used to buy motorcycle spare parts. With the profits, together with her savings, she will buy their family house.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wheat, fried oil, butter, sugar, beverages and other ingredients

loans.name: Elshan

texts.ru:
Elshan jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Elshan yavlyayetsya IDP persnom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy semyoy. Elshan M. 39 let. 
On uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom, v osnovnom razvodit korov. Seychas Elshan nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya uvelicheniya molochnix produktov. On prodayet yogurt, Kefir i moloko v magazini.
texts.en: Elshan is married with two children.  Elshan is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his beloved family.  Elshan M. is 39 years old.  He has been a herdsman for seven years, primarily raising cattle.  Now, Elshan needs 2300 AZN to buy cows to increase his milk production.  He sells yogurt, kefir, and milk in stores.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Husnidin

texts.ru: Разаков Хуснидин проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 27 лет. Он холост. У него среднее образование. Живет вместе с родителями. Дома она занимается изготовлением мебели. В основном он изготавливает диваны и кровати. В этом ему помогает его друг. Изготовлением он занимается три года. Кредит берет для приобретения досок, ДСП, инструментов и обоев.
texts.en: Husnidin R. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 27 years old and single. He has a secondary education. He lives with his parents. He makes furniture at home.  He primarily makes sofas and beds. His friend helps him.  He has been doing this work for three years. He is taking out a loan to buy boards, particleboard, tools, and wallpaper.

loans.use: to buy boards, particleboard, tools, and wallpaper.

loans.name: Sarvinoz

texts.en:
Sarvinoz is a hardworking wife and loving mother of two children. She produces dried fruit at home. She buys the fruit from the market of B. Gafurom city. She started her business with a small amount of fruit. She has been in this business for 5 years and now has extensive experience. Sarvinoz would like a loan $1500 to purchase dried fruit and expand her business. She dreams of expanding her business and improving her lifestyle.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy dried fruit

loans.name: Bibizilaykho

texts.ru: Тухтамишева Бибизилайхо проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 28 лет. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Муж находится в России на заработках. Сама Бибизилайхо занимается торговлей. Она арендует торговую точку на рынке Дехкон, где продает вафли, рулеты, печенья и трюфели. В этой области она 5 лет. Кредит берет для покупки вафель и рулетов.
texts.en: Bibizilaykho T. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 28 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is working in Russia. Bibizilaykho works in trade. She rents a shop in Dehkon market where she sells filled wafer cookies, sweet rolls, cookies and truffles. She has been doing this for five years.  She is taking out a loan to buy filled wafer cookies and sweet rolls.

loans.use: to buy filled wafer cookies and sweet rolls.

loans.name: Arayik

texts.en:
Arayik P. is 40 years old; he lives in Zovaber village, Sevan area, with his mother, his wife and his two children. Arayik’s mother is retired, his wife is jobless and his children are in school.   
Arayik works at ''South Caucasian railway'' as a mechanic and, at the same time, he has been engaged in farming. On his farm he grows potatoes and raises cows, sheep and chickens. His wife helps him in this and, so, they solve their family's needs. 
Arayik is asking for a 650,000 AMD loan to buy potato seedlings and to sow them.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings to sow

loans.name: Mti Pesa Group

texts.en:
S. U. is in his early thirties and is married with one small kid. He has a general store where he also sells vouchers for telephones. He has had this business for 4 years and works from 6.00am to 10.00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be S.'s eighth loan from Tujijenge Teanzania. He used the previous loans to improve and expand his shop. He has paid back his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to increase the general store inventory. His dream is to one day have a very big general store and to build his own house.

S. will share this loan with his loan group, "Mti Pesa", which has a total of 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, S. is second from left, front row.

loans.use: To increase his general store inventory.

loans.name: Mlandizi Kati Group

texts.en:
Fatuma M. is in her early thirties and is single with one small child. She has been selling clothes door-to-door for two years. She works from 2.00am to 4.00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Fatuma's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more clothes for her business and has paid back her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to increase her stock of clothes. Her dream is to one day own a grocery.

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group Mlandizi Kati. The group has a total of 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Fartuma is 1st on the right.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Gulrukhsor

texts.en:
Gulrukhsor is a widow and the loving mother of three children. She sells bakery products in the market. She started her business by selling groceries. She has been in this business for 10 years and has a lot of experience. She would like to expand her business and so Gulrukhsor applied to IMON International for a loan of 5000 Somoni. Gulrukhsor and her family appreciate your support in helping her improve her business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy bakery products

loans.name: Kakakuona Group

texts.en:
Hadija R. is in her early thirties and is married with two children. She has been selling clothes door-to-door for one year. She works from 8.00am to 7.30pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be Hadija's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She hopes for a loan to buy more clothes and to also start selling cosmetics. Her dream is to, one day, build her own house.

Hadija will share her loan with her loan group "Kakakuona" which has a total of 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture Hadija is wearing a red head scarf.(The picture is not clear because it was raining. It is rainy season in Dar so some photos will not be very clear or very good).

loans.use: To buy more clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Tunaweza Group

texts.en:
Grace M. is in her early twenties and is single. She has had a door-to-door, fabric selling business for two years. She works from 10.00am to 06.00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Grace's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more fabrics and has paid back her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy more fabrics and to start selling sodas and juice. Her dream is to, one day, open a grocery shop and sell beer as well.

Grace will share this loan with her loan group, "Tunaweza", which has a total of 18 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Grace is behind in a black dress.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics and to start selling sodas and juice.

loans.name: Flor De Lima Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Flor de lima las integrantes le pusieron así porque el punto de reunión de los integrantes de este grupo hay un árbol de lima lleno de flores, este grupo esta integrado por 10 personas que se  dedican a diferentes actividades económicas. Este grupo esta ubicado en una de las colonias de Pinotepa Nacional un lugar donde su gente es muy amable y de buenas costumbres.
La persona que representa este grupo es la señora Eva Isabel S. O., es madre soltera tiene 2 niños que estudian. Ella se tiene una pequeña tienda de ropa, vende pantalones, camisas, blusas, playeras, su pequeña tienda esta ubicado en su casa, ella comenta que le va un poco bien en sus ventas, ella solicito el préstamo para poder comprar mas mercancía y así surtir mas su tienda y obtener un poco mas de beneficios para ella y sus hijos ya que ellos son su mas grande tesoro y trabaja día con día para que nada les falte.
Otra de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Yesenia López M. quien esta casada con el señor Eliseo tiene 2 hijos 1 de 8 años de edad y el otro de tan solo un año de edad, ella solicito el préstamo para poder comprar insumos para la elaboración de antojitos actividad que viene realizando desde hace varios años, ella tiene un pequeño local en el mercado en donde vende diferentes antojitos como son: sopes, tacos dorados, enchiladas, tostada y tacos de res, ella dice que inicio este negocio debido a la necesidad que tenia ya que el dinero que gana su esposo no le alcanzaba y como su hija entro a la primaria iba a necesitar más dinero es por ello que ella empezó este negocio, comenta que le va bien y ahora con el préstamo que solicito piensa comprar otros productos para vender otros tipos de antojitos ya que sus clientes le piden que haga otro tipo de guisado y como dice el dicho “al cliente lo que pida”.
Ella desea engrandecer su negocio y que sus hijos estudien y tengan un buen porvenir.
Las personas que integran este grupo son las siguientes: 
Juan José. Taller Mecánico
Luis Enrique. Venta de Calzado
Eva Isabel. Tienda de Ropa
Yesenia. Venta de Antojitos
Leonor Mónica. Elaboración de hamacas 
Obdulia. Venta de Antojitos
Ana Gloria. Venta de Plásticos
Juana. Venta de Cosméticos
Maricela. Venta de Cosméticos
Martha. Venta de Verduras
texts.en:
This group is called 'Flor de Lima' (Flower of the Lime Tree).  The members gave the group this name because where they meet there is a lime tree which is full of flowers.  This group has 10 members who all work in different businesses.  The group is located in one of the districts of Pinotepa Nacional, a place where the people are very kind and have good manners.

The group's representative is Eva Isabel S. O..  She is a single mother who has two children in school.  She has a small clothes store where she sells pants, shirts, blouses and t-shirts.  Her small store is located in her home.  She tells us that her sales are doing okay.  She requested this loan so that she could buy more merchandise and thereby better stock her store and make a little more profit for herself and her children since they are her great treasure and she works every day so that they don't want for anything.

Another of this group's members is Yesenia López M. who is married to Eliseo.  She has two children.  One is 8 years old and the other is only one year old.  She requested this loan so that she could buy supplies for making snacks.  She has been in this business for several years.  She has a small sales location in the market where she sells different snacks such as 'sopes' (fried tortillas topped with refried beans and spicy sauce), fried tacos, enchiladas, tostadas and beef tacos.  She says that she started this business from necessity as her husband's money didn't reach far enough.  When her daughter started elementary school she was going to need more money and, for this reason, she started her business.  She tells us that it is doing well and she plans to use the loan that she requested to buy other products so that she can sell other types of snacks since her customers are asking her to make another type of stew and, as the saying goes, 'al cliente lo que pida' ("give the customer what he wants").

Yesenia would like to expand her business and she would like her children to study and have a good future.

The members of this group are as follows: 
Juan José - vehicle repair shop
Luis Enrique - footwear sales
Eva Isabel - clothes store
Yesenia - snack sales
Leonor Mónica - making hammocks 
Obdulia - snack sales
Ana Gloria - plastic products sales
Juana - cosmetics sales
Maricela - cosmetics sales
Martha - vegetable sales

loans.use: to buy clothes such as pants, blouses, shirts and t-shirts to sell

loans.name: Eureka Group

texts.es:
La señora  Guadalupe N. Jiménez, es casada y vive en Tecpatan Estado  de Chiapas México, es un lugar muy bonito ya que tiene un rio  que es visitado por muchas personas en la semana santa,  con ella  vive una nieta de nombre Karla Guadalupe de cuatro años.

     Ella es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo en fundación ya que  fue invitada por una de las integrantes, e invertirá en la compra de mercancía para surtir su pequeña tienda de abarrotes, en donde lleva  cuatro años, en donde comenta que le va bien.

     Para iniciarlo lo animo su esposo para tener donde dedicar su tiempo  en algo que le diera ingresos para su hogar y así salir adelante.

     Lo que más desea es salir adelante con su negocio, para tener una vida estable, como también apoyar a su nieta a que estudie  y logre terminar una carrera.

     Las personas  que integran en su grupo son la señora Marcelina U. M. quien se dedica a la elaboración de tamales para luego venderlo en la misma localidad y la señora Marbella Rodríguez  U.  tiene una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Guadalupe N. Jiménez is married and lives in Tecpatan, in the State of Chiapas, Mexico.  This is a very beautiful place as it has a river which is visited by a lot of people during Semana Santa (Holy Week).  Guadalupe lives with a 4 year-old granddaughter called Karla Guadalupe.

This is the first time that Guadalupe has requested a loan from Fundación Realidad.  She was invited by one of our members.  She will invest her loan in buying merchandise to stock her small grocery store.  She has been running her store for four years and she tells us that it is doing well.

It was Guadalupe's husband who encouraged her to start her business so that she had something to occupy her time which would also provide her with income for the household and help get their family ahead in life.

What Guadalupe would most like is to make progress in her business so that she can enjoy a stable life.  She would also like to support her granddaughter in her studies so that she can go on to complete a university degree.

The other members of this group are Marcelina U. M., who makes tamales which she sells in her town, and Marbella Rodríguez U., who has a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her small grocery store

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is 42 years old; she has 5 children aged between 5 and 18. Her husband is a driver. Charlotte has been selling clothes for 10 years. This business has enabled her to pay her children’s school fees. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to add to her business and, hence, make more profit which will help her improve her living standard.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 37 years old. She has 3 children aged between 11 and 16 who are all in school. Her husband is a soldier. Esther is a tailor and she also sells onions. She has done this for 10 years. This business has enabled her to pay her children's school fees and to also feed her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more onions and some equipment for her tailoring business

loans.use: To buy onions and tailoring equipment

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 41 years old. She has 6 children aged between 4 and 20. Her husband is a soldier and she owns a store in which she sells food stuffs such as Irish potatoes, cassava and beans. Esperance is requesting a loan to buy more food stuffs and to reinvest in her business. In the future, she hopes to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs.

loans.name: Nelis Estela

texts.es:
Nelis, resiD. en Jucuaran departamento D. Usulután, trabaja la agricultura, vive con su familia  sus hijos y su esposo, quienes le ayudan a cultivar maíz, ella también atienD. un molino D. nixtamal.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas, ya que se dispone con su familia a sembrar maíz, para esto se necesita D. abonos y fertilizantes, esta compra le permitirá obtenerlos y realizar el proceso del cultivo.
Nelis, tiene por objetivo montar el negocio fuerte con el molino, ser una microempresaria D. éxito y vivir cómodamente con su familia.
texts.en:
Nelis lives in Jucuaran, in the department of Usulután. She works in agriculture. She lives with her family, her children and her husband, who help her to grow corn. She also operates a nixtamal [hominy] mill.

Currently, she needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies, since she is ready to plant corn with her family, and she needs compost and fertilizer. This purchase will allow her to obtain them and carry out the cultivation process. 

Nelis' goal is to strengthen her business with the mill, become a successful microentrepreneur, and live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Hellene

texts.en: Hellene was born in 1985; she has one child who is 2 years old. Her husband is a soldier while their child hasn’t started school yet. Hellene owns a hair cutting salon which she has operated for 8 months. She is requesting a loan to buy more salon equipment. In the future she plans to expand her salon and offer plaiting and hair treatments.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es: Gloria Del Carmen de 54 años vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida. Ella tiene su negocio que es la venta de leña, refrescos, bananos y bolsitas.  La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, en donde la mayoría de sus clientes, amigos, vecinos, familiares llegan a comprar los productos que ofrece.  Gloria se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues su entusiasmo en la venta y su carisma hacia las personas ha provocado la preferencia de los clientes. Ella realiza este crédito para la compra de leña, bananos, bolsitas, frutas, azúcar entre otros productos. Así podrá satisfacer la necesidad de todos sus clientes y al mismo tiempo incrementar su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Gloria Del Carmen, 54, lives in her own house with her life companion. She has a business selling firewood, sodas, bananas, and drinks in plastic bags. Her business is located in her home, where the majority of her customers, friends, neighbors and relatives, come to buy the products she offers. Gloria has attracted many customers through her enthusiasm and her charisma keeps them coming back. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase firewood, plantains, drinks in plastic bags, fruit, sugar, and other products. This will allow her to meet the needs of all her customers and at the same time increase her source of income.
