loans.use: to purchase firewood, bananas, drinks in plastic bags, fruit, sugar, and other products

loans.name: 13 Tân Sơn 2 - Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Hiệp T. Thị  (74) is a 36-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hóa. Hiệp is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 13 Tân Sơn 2 Nam Ngạn (08.1.13 Nam Ngạn).


Hiệp is married and has 2 school-aged children. Hiệp owns & operates a food production and sales business, selling a variety of food products. Hiệp has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month.


In 2011, Hiệp joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting 4.248.000 VND which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Hiệp plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Đỗ Thị Chẽ (75) is a 60-year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


2.  T. Thị Thúy (76) is a 20-year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hiệp T. Thị  (74) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hóa.  Hiệp là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 13 Tân Sơn 2 Nam Ngạn (08.1.13 Nam Ngạn).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại thực phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hiệp thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hiệp kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2011, Hiệp đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hiệp đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Đỗ Thị Chẽ (75) là 60 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


2.  T. Thị Thúy (76) là 20 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Vilma Doris

texts.es:
Vilma, reside en San Simón, departamento de Morazán, tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 5 años de edad, vive en compañía de sus padres y hermanos, Ella se dedica a atender un comedor desde hace 4 años, tiene un puesto en el mercado municipal de San Simón, lo atiende de 8:00am a 8:00pm, aprendió de su madre.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de pollo, carne, condimentos, vegetales, entre otros más que son necesarios en la cocina, el préstamo le ayudara a tener lo necesario para incrementar la producción en esta temporada de semana santa.
Su aspiración es crecer en el negocio y poder dar a su hija una mejor vida, trabajar día con día para realizar sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Vilma lives in San Simón, department of Morazán. She is 26 years old, is a single mother to a five-year-old girl, and lives in the company of her parents and brothers. She has been dedicated to attending a cafe for four years. She has stall in the San Simón municipal market. She manages it from 8AM to 8PM. She learned from her mother.

She is requesting a loan to purchase chicken, meat, condiments, vegetables, among other items that are necessary for cooking. The loan will help her to have what is necessary to increase the production in this season of Easter week.

Her aspiration is to grow the business and be able to give her daughter a better life and to work day after day to accomplish her projects.
 con día para realizar sus proyectos.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, condiments, and vegetables.

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en: Delphine was born in 1977. She has 3 children who are aged between 11 months and 7 years. Her two oldest children are in school while the youngest isn’t. Delphine owns a general store in which she sells different kinds of food stuffs such as Irish potatoes, rice and green bananas. She has been doing this business for 4 years and it has helped her to meet her family's needs. Delphine’s husband runs the business with her. She is requesting a loan to add more inventory to her shop.

loans.use: To increase her shop inventory.

loans.name: 5 Tân Sơn 1 - Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
"Liên N. Thị (19) is a 37-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hóa. Liên is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each m ember of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 5 Tân sơn 1  Nam Ngạn (10.1.5 Nam Ngạn).


Liên is married and has 2 school-aged children. She works in a family member's business which provides mechanical services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month.


In 2011, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting 5.787.900 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Liên plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Hồ Thị Phương (20) is a 33-year-old female who is requesting a 5.787.900 VND loan to support her tailoring business.


2.  Lê Thị Phượng (21) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 5.787.900 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector selling home products.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Liên N. Thị (19) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hóa.  Liên là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 5 Tân Sơn 1  Nam Ngạn (10.1.5  Nam Ngạn).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ cơ khí cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Liên thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Liên kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2011, Liên đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Liên đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.787.900 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Hồ Thị Phương (20) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


2.  Lê Thị Phượng (21) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán hàng gia dụng.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
Doña María, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la crianza de ganado, es madre soltera de un hijo de 11 años de edad, María tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse al negocio de ganado, lo tiene en terreno propio y vende la leche todos los días, aprendió de su padre.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado e insumos para el cultivo de maíz, como abono y fertilizantes, este préstamo ayudara a aumentar el número de ganado en sus terrenos, tendrá la oportunidad de cultivar maíz en esta temporada.
El sueño de María es apoyar a su hijo y convertirlo en un profesional, con oportunidades de superarse y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María lives in San Francisco Gotera, in the department of Morazán. Her work is raising cattle. She is the single mother of an 11-year-old child. María has worked in her livestock business for more than 20 years, and she maintains it on her own land. She sells the milk every day. She learned it from her father. 

She is requesting a loan to buy cattle and supplies to grow corn, such as compost and fertilizers. This loan will help her increase the number of cattle on her land, and she will have the opportunity to grow corn during this season. 

María's dream is to support her son and make him into a professional, with opportunities to get ahead and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle and supplies to grow corn, such as compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS RUMICHACA - ALTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Rumichaca,  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Aurelio; es conviviente, el socio tiene 30 años de edad; el socio es albañil, el socio trabaja en una constructora el por ahora requiere el préstamo para invertir en el revestimiento de su casa el socio requiere comprar materiales para revestir su casa, el comprara cemento, arena fina, yeso, el socio trabaja con la modalidad de bancos comunales desde hace 3 años y le va muy bien el poco a poco a logrado tener su casita y poder ampliarla y mejorarla. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para revestir su casa.

El socio está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Manos Juntas Rumichaca-Alta" community bank. This bank is located in the village of Rumichaca, a province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

The member is Aurelio. He lives with his partner and is 30 years old. He is a mason. He works for a construction company. Now, he needs the loan to invest in the remodel of his house. He needs to buy materials to remodel his house. He will buy cement, fine sand, plaster. He has worked with the community banks for three years and he is doing well. Gradually he has managed to have his little house and be able to expand and improve it. He is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of materials to remodel his house.

The member is very thankful for the loan and he promises to make his payments for said loan in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of materials to remodel his house.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS RUMICHACA - ALTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Rumichaca,  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Natividad; es casada, la socia tiene 38 años de edad; la socia tiene 8 hijos de los cuales solo cuatro de ellos están bajo su cuidado los hijos que viven con ella tienen los menores 10 y 9 meses de edad, la socia  se encarga del cuidado de sus hogar y la casa, la socia paralelamente a esto cría animales menores los alimenta y hace reproducir para la venta final, la socia vende pollos y ahora ella desea comprar 40 pollos para incrementar sus ganancias. La socia invertirá su dinero en la compra de pollos para la venta.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The member is part of the "Manos Juntas Rumichaca - Alta" communal bank. This bank is located in Rumichaca, in the Urubamba province, Cusco department.

The member is Mrs. Natividad; she is 38 years old and married, with 8 children, 4 of whom are still under her care. Her youngest children who live with her are 10 and 9 months old. The member takes care of her home, and she also raises animals. She feeds them and breeds them for sale. She sells chickens, and she would like to purchase 40 chickens to increase her earnings. She will invest her loan in purchasing chickens for sale.

The member is very grateful for this loan, and agrees to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: Member will invest her money in the purchase of chickens to sell

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine is 32 years old and she has four children who are between the ages of 7 and 14 years old. Her husband works in a communication company. Valentine owns a shop in which she sells several foodstuffs such as beans, Irish potatoes, peanuts and green bananas. She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs such as she has in her shop and hence make more profits.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuff for her shop.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORILAZO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elena; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos remojados como moraya, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de productos remojados. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos remojados al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Qorilazo communal bank, located in Cusco.

Her name is Elena. She is 38 years old and married, with 4 kids. She alternates her everyday activities with the sale of products such as flour and quinoa. She works from 9am to 6pm. With this job she is able to help her children get ahead. She would like to increase her business. She is requesting funds to purchase products wholesale. 

The member is very happy to receive this loan, and agrees to comply with the repayment terms.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale products.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS RUMICHACA - ALTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Rumichaca,  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maribel; es conviviente, la socia tiene 33 años de edad; la socia tiene 4 hijos de (15, 14, 10 y 7) años de edad, la socia  se dedica al comercio minorista, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de carne al por mayor y menor, la socia no tiene un local en el cual exhibir la mercadería pero en el poblado todos la conocen uy van a su vivienda a comprar la carne ella tiene sus animales vacunos y también un proveedor el cual le permite a ella tener siempre carne fresca para vender, la socia vende como principal carne la de cordero, teniendo la carne de cordero macho como la preferida en el público. La socia solicita el préstamo para abastecer su negocio de venta de carne de cordero.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Mano Juntas Rumichaca - Alta communal bank, located in Rumichaca, Urubamba province, Cusco.

The member's name is Maribel. She lives with her partner, and is 33 years old, with 4 children (ages 15, 14,10 and 7). She works in sales. She alternates her daily activities at home with the retail sale and wholesale of meat. She does not have a location where she can display her merchandise, but in her neighborhood, everyone knows her and comes to her home to purchase meats. She has cattle and also has a supplier, so she always has fresh meat to sell. She primarily sells lamb, the meat of male lambs is preferred by her customers. She is requesting a loan to stock her business. 

She is very thankful for this loan, and agrees to make payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to stock her business, selling beef and lamb

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORILAZO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marcelina; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como pollos y patos, ella también trabaja en un restaurant como cocinera desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los animales. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Qorilazo.” The bank is located in the district of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Marcelina; she is 32-years-old and has a partner and they have three children.  The member alternates her daily activities with a business raising animals like chickens and ducks.  She also works in a restaurant as a cook from 9am to 4pm.  Through this business she helps her children get ahead.  The member would like to improve the animal selling business.  She is requesting the loan to buy food for the animals.  

The member is happy about the loan and promises to comply with the payments on her loan.

loans.use: to buy food for animals.

loans.name: Calipso Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento "CALIPSO  " se encuentra en su primer ciclo dentro de la Institución, compuesto por 11 personas en la cual 8 son mujeres y 3 varones,  sus actividades están entre venta de comida,  promotora  de cosméticos, venta de yuca, carbón y repostería  todas viven en la zona del Plan 3000. El grupo se fundo por la iniciativa de tres socias: La Sra. Juana es la presidenta del banco de emprendimiento Calipso se dedica a la elaboración de tortas, galletas queques y variedad de panes, distribuyendo a los diferentes mercados del plan 3000, con el dinero del credito comprara insumos para la elaboracion de tortas, como harina azucar leche, etc tiene 4 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar,  vive en  casa propia, los ingresos que generan sustentan su hogar ya que es única fuente de ingresos, es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable, su deseo es el de ver a sus hijos profesionales y personas de bien. Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The communal bank "Calipso" is in its first loan cycle with this institution. It is made up of 11 people of which 8 are women and 3 are men. Their businesses range from sale of food, sale of cosmetics, sale of yucca, charcoal and a bakery. All the members live in the area Plan 3000. The group was founded through the initiative of three members. Juana is the president of the communal bank Calipso and she makes cakes, cookies and a variety of breads. She sells them to the different markets in Plan 3000. With this loan she will buy supplies to make cakes such as flour, sugar and milk, etc. Juana has four children who are of school-age. She lives in her own home and the income she generates supports her home since she is the source of income. She is a very hardworking and responsible woman. Her desire is that her children become professionals and good people. All of the members are responsible and hardworking people that are thankful to this institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as flour and sugar used to make cakes.

loans.name: Rosa Alba

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con tres hijos D. 12, 16 y 22 años D. edad, residen en San Rafael Oriente departamento D. San Miguel, ella se ha dedicado junto a su familia al cultivo D. maíz y frijol, también a la crianza D. ganado y cerdos, trabajan todos los días y sus hijos le ayudan mucho.
Actualmente necesitan comprar los insumos agrícolas, pues se disponen a sembrar maíz y frijol, para lo que necesitan abono, fertilizantes y tratamiento para plagas, Rosa solicita un préstamo para la inversión.
Ella espera que este año su cosecha sea abundante y sana, ya que D. ahí depenD. su familia, aspira ver a sus hijos con sus estudios finalizados.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with three children of 12, 16, and 22 years of age.  They live in the San Rafael Oriente department of San Miguel.  She has dedicated herself along with her family to growing corn and beans and also to raising cattle and pigs.  They work every day and her children help her a lot.
Currently they need to buy the agricultural inputs as they grow corn and beans which need soil additives, fertilizers, and treatment for pests.  Rosa is requesting a loan for this investment. 
She hopes that her harvest this year will be abundant and healthy as her family depends on it.  She aspires to see her children complete their studies.

loans.use: to buy soil additives, fertilizer, and treatments for pests.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Orfelia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS RUMICHACA - ALTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Rumichaca,  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Orfelia; es  casada, la socia tiene 43 años de edad; la socia tiene 4 hijos de (17, 15, 13 y 7) años de edad, la socia  se dedica al comercio minorista, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la administración y atención de sus tienda de abarrotes, la socia es muy querida en el pueblo y abastece su tienda de abarrotes para poder tener todo al alcance de la mano de sus vecinos, la socia es una persona muy trabajadora y siempre está implementando su tienda con todos los artículos que se requiera, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de mercadería para poder incrementar sus ventas y dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus menores hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Manos Juntas Rumichaca-Alta” (Hands Together Rumichaca-Alta).  This bank is located in the town of Rumichaca in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.  

The member is Ofelia; she is married and is 43-years-old.  The member has four children or 17, 15, 13, and seven years of age.  The member works selling retail.  She alternates her home activities with the administration and attention to her grocery store.  The member is very well-liked in the town and stocks her grocery store to have everything available to her neighbors.  The member is a very hard-working person and is always filling her store with all of the items required.  On this occasion, the member would like to invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise to be able to increase her sales and give a better quality of life to her younger children.  The member is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise.  

The member is very grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the payments of the said loan in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María Díaz Díaz, vive en ajilho municipio de bochil Estado de Chiapas.  Vive en unión libre con el señor Maximiliano Gómez  Hernández, con quien procreo  a una hija de nombre Marisa  María Belén de tan sólo tres años de edad.
   
   El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de pollos  de granja para venderlo aliñado  (destazado) y asado en la misma localidad, en donde comenzó a practicarlo hace unos meses  y está contenta porque se vende bien  ya que los tiene a buen precio que a la gente le interesa comprar.

    Por su propia creatividad decidió trabajar, para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de su hogar, a si solventar deudas que se han generado para salir adelante.

     Su deseo es trabajar con el préstamo para agrandar su venta de pollos y así estar pendiente de su pequeña familia que es los mas importante para ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Díaz Díaz lives in Ajilho in the town of Bochil, in the state of Chiapas.  She lives with her partner, Mr. Maximiliano Gómez Hernández, and their daughter, Marisa María Belén, who is three years old.

She plans to use the loan to buy farm-raised chicken to grill and sell in her village.  She began the business a few months ago and is happy because it is going so well because her prices are low and many people are interested in what she sells.

The decision to start the business was her own idea since she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses so they could pay off debt and get ahead.

She hopes to be able to expand business with the loan so she can continue to take care of her small family, which is what is most important to her.

loans.use: To buy chicken for retail sale

loans.name: Consepción

texts.es:
Concepción Díaz Díaz, vive en la localidad de ajilho municipio  de bochil Estado de Chiapas México, ella es soltera  y vive con sus padres tiene la edad de diecinueve años.

    Ella solcito el préstamo para invertir en  la compra de mercancía para comenzar a surtir su tienda de abarrotes, que es la primera vez que se anima a trabajar en esta actividad ya que se dedicaba a bordar mantas, en  la que nos comenta que le fue bien  ya que con eso ha estado trabajando desde pequeña.

      Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo y es para ayudarse  con sus ingresos  que se generan en su hogar, así con su tienda de abarrotes que emprenderá se apoyara en cubrir algunos gastos pequeños de que se han generado en su familia.

     Lo que desea es aumentar su actividad, para seguir  trabajando con el préstamo que le han otorgado
texts.en:
Concepción Díaz Díaz lives in Ajilho, in the town of Bochil, in the state of Chiapas, México.  She is single, age 19, and lives with her parents.

She is requesting a loan to purchase goods to begin stocking her grocery store.  This is the first time she has worked in this type of business since before she embroidered blankets, when she was younger, and was successful at it.

This is her first request for a loan which is to help get her grocery business going so she can generate more household income and help cover family expenses.

She wants to grow her business and be able to work with the loan she receives.

loans.use: To buy goods to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
La señora Micaela  Díaz López, es originaria de "Ajilho", Estado de Chiapas México, ella es viuda y tiene a su responsabilidad un hijo de nombre Roberto de dieciocho años de edad quien estudia en la  preparatoria.

    La actividad en la que invertirá el préstamo es para compra mantas e hilos para bordar prendas como son: blusas, pantalones, batas y camisas, en esta actividad lleva de experiencia  treinta y cinco años y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello a sacado adelante a su familia.

    Se siente muy orgullosa con  su trabajo ya que gracias a  su madre que le enseño desde pequeña ha estado trabajando  y saliendo adelante con su actividad que tanto le gusta elaborar.

    Se deseo es que  al termina sus pagos la sigan apoyando para continuar trabajando y así apoyar a su hijo que está estudiando y su más grande sueño es lograr que termine una carrera.
texts.en:
Mrs. Micaela Díaz López is from "Ajilho", in the state of Chiapas, México.  She is a widow and cares for her son, Roberto, who is 18 years old and in high school.

She plans to use the loan to buy fabric and thread so she can make blouses, trousers, robes and shirts.  She has 35 years' experience in this business and says it allows her to support her family well.

She is very proud of the work she does and is thankful that her mother taught her the craft when she was a young girl.  And she has been working at it ever since, enjoying this means of earning a living.

Her goal is to continue working after she pays off her loan so she can support her son and help him finish his education.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread for her embroidery

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lamay Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTA ROSA DE LAMAY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Lamay, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sabina; ella es casada y tiene 51 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite y fideos entre otros productos, la socia atiende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite y fideos al por mayor.


Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de maíz, tienda de abarrotes, restaurant, negocio de papelería, servicio de taxi y venta de artesanía.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “Santa Rosa de Lamay.”  This bank is located in the district of Lamay which is part of the Calca province and the department of Cusco.

The member is Sabina.  She is married and is 51-years-old and has three children.  The member works in her grocery store business and sells much needed products like rice, sugar, milk, oil, and noodles among other products.  She opens from 9am until 9pm.  She would like to expand her grocery store business.  The member is requesting the loan to buy products like rice, sugar, oil, and noodles at wholesale prices.

The other members work selling corn, in a grocery store, in a restaurant, in a stationary shop, providing taxi services, and selling artisan crafts.

The member would like to thank those who are a part of this dream through this medium and promises to comply with making her payments in the established time period.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, sugar, oil, and noodles at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Sandra Arelis

texts.es: Sandra Arelis es madre y esposa, lo cual para toda mujer es un reto sobre todo mezclarlo con el trabajo, ya que es muy difícil estar al tanto de la familia ella se dedica a la venta de pan y confitería. Por lo que Sandra trabaja en su propia casa en donde la mayoría de  sus clientes conocen  los diferentes productos que ofrece. Desde hace 8 años tiene su negocio, a pesar de luchar cada día con diferentes dificultades como es el problema con el tiempo y con el alto precio de los productos. Sandra en este momento desea comprar harina, huevo, confites, bolsas entre otras.
texts.en:
Sandra Arelis is a wife and mother, a challenge for many women who must work for a living and also take care of family.  She sells bread and sweets and works out of her own home.  Most of her customers are familiar with the different products she offers.

She has been in business for eight years, despite the daily struggle of finding enough time or dealing with the high cost of certain products.

Sandra wants to buy flour, eggs, sweets and bags, among other things.

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs, sweets and bags

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es: El señor Rosendo es cliente antiguo, el trabaja en el servicio de amplificación por la zona de apaña y otras zonas aledañas, el equipo que tiene, por el traslado de un lugar a otro se fue deteriorando por lo que solicita este crédito para comprar otra mezcladora de música, el ameniza todo tipo de acontecimientos, el joven en los días particulares trabaja manejando un radiotaxi, el cual esta en miras a comprarlo, el vive en domicilio en anticrético por la zona de villa apaña, tiene una hija pequeña y otros por venir, por lo que la esposa solo se dedica a labores del hogar, es una persona responsable y trabajadora, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Rosendo is a long-standing client.  He provides sound system services in Apaña and neighboring areas.  The system that he currently owns has been wearing out due to the fact that it gets moved around from one place to another.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy another mixing panel.  Rosendo livens up all types of events.

During the week, Rosendo drives a radio taxi which he is looking to buy.  He lives 'en anticrético' in Villa Apaña (note: 'anticrético' is a type of rental agreement where both landlord and tenant agree that the tenant will live in a house for a specified period of time, after which the landlord will return the money received at the start of the contract).  Rosendo has a young daughter and hopes to have other children in the future.  His wife is a housewife.

Rosendo is a responsible and hard-working person.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have given him.

loans.use: to buy an audio mixing panel

loans.name: Reyna Anita

texts.es:
La señora  Reyna Anita Jiménez R., es casada con el señor Manuel Díaz Díaz y con quien procreo cuatro hijas quienes  aun están a su responsabilidad y son: Gabriela Guadalupe de doce años, Sandra Isabel de nueve años, rebeca de Jesús  de cinco y las más pequeña es Ana Paola de dos meses.

     Su préstamo otorgado por fundación realidad lo invertirá en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes que es la primera vez que se dedica a esta actividad ya que desde muy joven practica lo que es el bordado de mantas que es con lo que ha estado trabajando hasta el momento.

     Comenta  que por su propia creatividad decidió  emprender el préstamo en la venta de abarrotes, para poder apoyar  a su esposo con los ingresos de su hogar ya  no quiere que  a sus hijas le haga falta lo más necesario para su educación.

      Lo que más desea s mejorar su calidad de vida y con el préstamo trabajar para salir adelante con su pequeña familia.
texts.en:
Reyna Anita Jiménez R. is married to Manuel Díaz Díaz.  They have four daughters who are still in their care: 12 year-old Gabriela Guadalupe, 9 year-old Sandra Isabel, 5 year-old Rebeca de Jesús and, their youngest, 2 month-old Ana Paola.

Reyna will invest her loan from Fundación Realidad in buying merchandise to stock her grocery store.  This is the first time that she has worked in this business as she has been embroidering blankets since she was very young.  Embroidering is the activity she has been engaged in up until now.

Reyna comments that she decided to use her loan to embark on selling groceries so that she could support her husband with their household expenses as she doesn't want her daughters to be missing what they most need for their education.

What Reyna would most like is to improve her quality of life and to use her loan to work so that she can get ahead in life together with her small family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
Anastasia Díaz Pérez, es casa con el señor Fabián Díaz Díaz, con quien procreo cuatro hijos  varones quienes están a su responsabilidad y son: Marcelino de doce  años, Enrique de diez años, José Martin  y Luis Alfredo de dos  años quienes hablan la lengua sotzil.

    El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de frutas y verduras, en donde comenzó apenas  hace cuatro meses y comenta que le está yendo bien  ya que ha estado vendiendo su mercancía  muy bien con sus vecinos que le compran por kilos.

      Para iniciarlo lo platico con su esposo así juntos trabajar y darle lo más necesario a sus hijos que están creciendo y estudiando, como también así solventar algunos gastos que se han generado  en la compra de mantas e hilos en los bordados  que elabora.

      Su más grande deseo es que su tienda de verduras aumente día con día para,  así tener más ahorros para seguir trabajando con sus bordados de manta.
texts.en:
Anastasia Díaz Pérez is married to Fabián Díaz Díaz.  They have four sons in their care: 12 year-old Marcelino, 10 year-old Enrique, and 2 year-old José Martin and Luis Alfredo.  They speak Tzotzil.

Anastasia will invest the loan she has requested in buying fruit and vegetables.  She started her business just four months ago and she tells us that it is doing well since she has been selling her merchandise very successfully to her neighbors who buy from her by the kilo.

She spoke to her husband about starting this business so that they could work together in order to provide their children with what they most need as they are growing and studying.  They also wanted to be able to cover some expenses that had been created in buying blankets and threads for the embroidered products that Anastasia makes.

Anastasia's biggest wish is for her vegetable store business to increase every day so that she can save up more money in order to be able to continue making her embroidered blankets.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to better stock her business

loans.name: Adeluz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Adeluz; ella tiene 23 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de servicio de realizar llamadas telefónicas, ella trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere ahorrar para comprar un carro y hacer el negocio de servicio de taxi. La socia solicita el préstamo para ahorrar y comprar carro.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the San Rafael communal bank located in Cusco district which is in Cusco province and department.

She is Adeluz, 23 and single.  Her business is making phone calls and she does this along with her other daily activities. She works from 5 am to 6  pm and she wants the business to help her buy a car so that she can start a taxi service.  Adeluz is requesting the loan to save and buy the car.

She is happy with the financing and promises to make all the payments on time.

loans.use: to save and buy a car for a taxi service

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.es:
María, resiD. en El Transito departamento D. San Miguel, posee una tienda, vive con su esposo y dos hijos D. 18 y 21 años D. edad. Ella administra un tienda D. productos D. primera necesidad, también venD. verduras, cría cerdos y ganado, tiene una gran experiencia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. ganado y el cultivo D. maíz, con este préstamo piensa a parte D. comprar ganado, también adquirir abono y fertilizantes para iniciar la siembra.
Su objetivo es tener éxito en sus ocupaciones, comercializar a un buen precio el ganado y los cerdos, para obtener ganancias D. las cuales dispone para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
María lives in El Transito department of San Miguel. She owns a store and lives with her husband and two children ages 18 and 21. She manages a store that sells staple products in addition to vegetables, breeding pigs and cattle. She has a lot of experience with this.
She is requesting a loan to buy cattle and cultivate corn. With this loan she plans on using part of it to buy cattle. She will also purchase manure and fertilizers to start the planting.
Her goal is to be successful with her businesses, to sell the cattle and pigs for a good price and to obtain income that will cover her household necessities.

loans.use: to buy cattle, manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nanda Kumari

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Nanda Kumari M..  She is married and has two children, aged 13 and 7.  In 2005, she established her business of making brass religious statues.  Working six days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her work.  In the future, Nanda Kumari plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts.  Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity.  Terracotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills.  Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing.  In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone.  With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume.  This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz, tiene 43 años de edad es originaria del departamento de Estelí, esta casada tiene 4 hijos de 23,22, 18 y 12 años de edad respectivamente, ella se dedica a vende ropa y zapatos usados. Empezó  vendiendo fritangas ambulantes  por las calles de Estelí pero en la actualidad se ha dedicado a vender ropa y zapatos usados este negocio lo inicio en el año 1992 atraves de una financiera que le presto dinero. Vende sus productos en su barrio también sale a vender al pueblo llamada San Pedro Susucayan localizado en el departamento de Madriz donde ella toma un bus que le transporta hasta ese lugar el cual tarda 2 horas para llegar. Su esposo coopera en el hogar el trabaja como chofer de una unidad de transporte.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar más inventario de ropa y zapatos usados. Con esto espera lograr aumentar sus ventas, clientela mejorar sus ingresos. Dentro de sus planes esta poder tener una tienda propia en centro de comercio en Estelí. Su próxima meta esta comprar una camioneta que la usara para transportar y vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Luz, age 43, is from the department of Estelí; she is married and has four children, aged 23, 22, 18, and 12. Luz earns her living selling second-hand shoes and clothing. She started out selling fritangas (a deep-fried dish) on the streets of Estelí, but in 1992 started the second-hand clothing business thanks to a loan from a financial institution. 

Luz sells her products in her neighborhood and also goes out on sales trips to the town called San Pedro Susucayan located in the department of Madriz; she needs to take a two-hour bus ride to get there. Luz's husband helps at home and works as a public transportation chauffeur.

Luz is asking for a loan to purchase more inventory of used shoes and clothing. With this loan, she hopes to expand her client base and increase her sales which would allow her to improve her income. In the future, she would like to have her own store in the commercial center of Estelí. Her next goal is to purchase a pick-up truck to transport her inventory and sell her products.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of second-hand shoes and clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cell phones.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS RUMICHACA - ALTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado D. Rumichaca,  provincia D. Urubamba y  departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Emiliana; es  casada, la socia tiene 8 hijos todos sus hijos ya son mayores e independientes, cada uno tiene sus hijos y viven aparte, la socia se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. chicha D. jora, la socia hace la mejor chicha del pueblo ella toma los mejores granos y los macera para elaborar sus chicha. La socia en sus casa a ampliado hace ya algunos años atrás un espacio para poder recibir a sus clientes y ofrecerles la chicha D. jora acompañando con un aperitivo llamado zarza esta comprenD. unos trozos D. carne cocida con cebollines y hierbas aromáticas en sal y limón, con trozos D. rocoto para darle el sabor final. La socia es una mujer muy optimista y llena D. vida. La socia solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra D. maíz para elaborar su chicha.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. dicho préstamo D. forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Emiliana belongs to the Manos Juntas Rumichaca – Alta Communal Bank.  It is located in the town of Rumichaca, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Emiliana is married and has eight children.  All of them are adults and independent.  Each one of them has children and lives separately.  

Emiliana makes and sells “chicha D. jora” (a drink maD. from fermented corn).  She sells this with an appetizer called “zarza”.  This is maD. with pieces of cooked meat, chives, and aromatic herbs in salt and lemon.  Pieces of peppers are added to give it the final flavor.

She is a very optimistic woman who is full of life.  She is requesting the loan to be able to buy corn to make her chicha.

She is very grateful for the loan, and she pledges to make her payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy corn to make her chicha.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina, es originaria del departamento de Masaya ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad capital Managua , pero vive en Estelí, esta casada , tiene 3 hijos , ella se dedica al comercio es dueña de  una pulpería . Inicio con capital propio  fue poco a poco llenando su pequeña venta comprando pocos productos, además de tener la venta ella se dedica a elaborar tortilla que es de donde ella obtiene su segundo ingreso, su esposo trabaja para una fabrica de tabaco, cuando el regresa de trabajar el la ayuda a vender tortillas a las personas que viven cerca de su vecindario.
Solicito el préstamo para la compra de azúcar, arroz, aceite, jabón, productos alimenticios para vender en su pulpería. Esto le será de  gran ayuda ya que podrá tener abastecido su inventario de productos nuevos para ofrecerle a sus clientes, aumentara su ventas, sus ingresos, podrá invertir mas para ampliar mas su negocio.  Le gustaría tener un taller de elaboración de tortillas donde pueda brindar empleos a otras personas, desea que su venta sea una suplidora grande de alimentos en su vecindario. Su metas es poder trabajar más para poder pagarle estudios universitario  sus hijos ya que es por ellos que trabaja duro cada día y apoyarlos a ellos a que se superen cada día.
texts.en:
Karina is originally from Maysaya department which is located 45 minutes from the capital city of Managua.  However, she lives in Estelí.  Karina is married and has three children.  She owns a grocery store.  She started out with her own capital and gradually filled her small store buying a few products at a time.  In addition to her grocery store business, she also makes tortillas which earns her a second income.  Her husband works in a tobacco factory.  When he gets home from work he helps her to sell her tortillas to people who live near their neighborhood.

Karina requested this loan to buy sugar, rice, oil, soap and food products to sell in her grocery store.  This will be a great help as it means that she will be able to stock her business with new products that she can sell to her customers.  In this way, she will increase her sales and her income, and she will be able to invest more in order to expand her business.  Karina would like to have a workshop where she can make tortillas and offer jobs to other people.  She would like her store to become a big supplier of food to her neighborhood.

Karina's goals are to work more so that she can pay for her children's university studies since they are the reason she works hard every day.  She works so that she can support them and help them to improve themselves every day.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, oil, soap and food products to sell in her grocery store

loans.name: Ross Mere

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ross Mere; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de preventista, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos entre otros productos, la socia lleva a diferentes tiendas de abarrotes, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de productos de tiendas de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para ahorrar para pagar los estudios de su hija.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ross Mere is a member of the San Rafael Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Ross Mere is 29 years old, single, and has one child.  She alternates her daily activities with the work of being a “preventista,” which means she ensures that stores have the products they need to sell.  She sells basic needs items like rice, sugar, oil, and noodles, among other products.

She takes the groceries to different stores.  It is through this business that she gets her children ahead.  She wants to expand her business of selling groceries to stores.

She is requesting the loan to save in order to pay for her daughter’s education.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to save in order to pay for her daughter's education.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena, de 47 años, es una mujer que vive en unión familiar con su esposo Donato y sus 4 hijos. A los que cuida, alimenta y educa en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Villa Visca. Desde niña comenzó a amar la tierra, aprendiendo a trabajarla, desde entonces le enseñaron lo necesario para mantener en buen estado sus cultivos y cuando tuvo su primer hijo decidió sembrar independientemente. Desde entonces sus principales sembríos constan de papa, maíz y arveja, los cuales cuida con mucha dedicación ya que es consiente que las ganancias dependen de la buena calidad de sus frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder cortar la maleza que crece entre sus cultivos. Además cuenta que para mantener en perfectas condiciones sus sembríos necesita de mucha inversión, entre fertilizantes naturales y abonos de corral (orgánicos), que tienen mayor costo. También menciona que hace poco abrió una tienda de comestibles, vendiendo productos de primera necesidad a los pobladores de su localidad.  Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Visca”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que le brindan al incorporarla a una asociación responsable. Elena, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en: Elena, who is 47, is a woman who lives in a family that includes her husband Donato and their four children, whom she cares for, feeds, and raises in their own house located in the little village of Villa Visca. As a little girl, she learned to love the land, learning to work it; since then, she was taught what was necessary to keep her crops in good condition, and when she had her first child, she decided to plant independently. Since then, her principal plantings have been potatoes, corn, and peas, which she cares for with much dedication, since it is clear that her earnings depend on the good quality of her products. What she likes most about her work is being able to cut the weeds that grow among her crops. In addition, she tells us that to keep her plantings in perfect condition, she needs to make considerable investments, including natural fertilizer and barnyard manure (organic), which are more expensive. She also mentions that a little while ago she opened a grocery story, selling basic products to the residents of her area. She belongs to the communal bank "Villa Visca," and this is her first loan with MFP, where she is grateful for the support that they offer her in making her a member of a responsible group. Elena will invest the loan she is applying for in the purchase of basic products for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy basic products to set up her store.

loans.name: G.s. Fraternidad Group

texts.es: Sebastiana Del Carmen es casada, su esposo es comerciante, viven 5 personas en su hogar. Ella se dedica al comercio de venta de frutas y verduras como papaya, melones, sandias, mandos, naranjas, repollo, aguacate, bananos y nisperos en el mercado aduce que le ha ido bien en su negocio y ha podido incrementar sus ventas producto, uno de sus hijos le ayuda en este negocio, por lo cual también aporta al ingreso familiar. José Antonio es soltero, tiene 3 hijos que estudian en primaria, se dedica al comercio de venta de frutas y verduras. Su vida ha mejorado ya que he logrado con mis ganancias mejorar mi casa y construir un nuevo cuarto. Maribel Del Socorro es madre divorciada, tiene un hijo y vive con ella. Se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras. El problema principal ha sido la falta de capital ya que le salieron otras cosechas y no las pudo comprar. Pretende continuar invirtiéndole a su negocio.
texts.en:
Sebastiana del Carmen is married. Her husband is a merchant. Five people live in their house. She sells fruits and vegetables such as papayas, melons, watermelons, mangos, oranges, cabbages, avocados, bananas, and medlars in the market. She says that her business has gone well, and she has been able to increase the sales of her products. One of her sons helps her in this business, and so he also contributes to the family income. 

José Antonio is single. He has three children who are in primary school. He also sells fruits and vegetables. His life has improved since he managed to use his earnings to improve his house and construct a new room.

Maribel del Socorro is a divorced mother. She has one son who lives with her. She sells fruits and vegetables. Her principal problem has been the lack of capital, since there have been times when other crops were available and she was not able to buy them. She wants to continue to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy papayas, melons, watermelons, oranges, cabbages, avocados, bananas, and medlars to sell in the market.

loans.name: Maiya

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Maiya M..  She is married and has two children aged 17 and 13.  In 2000, she established  her grocery  business.  Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her shop.  In the future, Maiya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yenny; ella tiene 25 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de venta de medicamentos, ella trabaja en una botica desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia quiere ahorrar para construir su casa y de esta manera poder salir adelante y tener su casa propia. La socia solicita el préstamo para construir su casa y poder comprar materiales de construccion como cemento,yeso,arena y clavos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the San Rafael communal bank, located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.

The borrower is Sra. Yenny. She is 25 years old, single and alternates her daily activities working in a drug store.  She works from 7:00am to 10:00pm.  She is saving to build a house to be able to get ahead and have her own home.  She is applying for this loan to be able to build her house and to purchase construction materials such as cement, plaster, sand, and nails.

Sra. Yenny is grateful for the loan and promises to repay it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, plaster, sand, and nails

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Gabriel; el tiene 32 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, el vende en forma independiente y también el socio trabaja en el ministerio de cultura, por medio de este trabajo y negocio el socio quiere ahorrar para su familia.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía para vender.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sr. Gabriel, 32, belongs to the SAN RAFAEL community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Sr. Gabriel is single.  He operates a business selling traditional crafts.  The business is separate from and in addition to his job at the Ministry of Culture.  The job and business are his means for saving for his family.  He is applying for this loan to buy craft products that he will resell.

Sr. Gabriel is grateful for the loan and promises to repay it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for crafts business.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS RUMICHACA - ALTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Rumichaca,  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Emiliana; es  conviviente, la socia tiene 43 años de edad; la socia tiene 4 hijos de (18, 7, 4 y 1 mes de nacido) años de edad, la socia  alterna sus actividades del hogar con la crianza de cuyes, la socia tiene a sus cuyes en casa en un espacio designado para ellos y va comprando de grupos de 10 a 20 cuyes y los va haciendo reproducir poco a poco, la socia está un poco ocupada en la atención de su aún bebe y manifiesta que de todas maneras debe seguir cuidando a sus cuyes para que estos tenga su alimento diario y su atención adecuada para seguir con sus negocio y luego venderlo al por mayor a los diferentes restaurantes turísticos de la zona, la socia desea invertir el préstamo solicitado en esta oportunidad en la compra de cuyes tiernos para continuar con su labor. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cuyes i de este modo incrementar sus ganancias.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Manos Juntas Rumichaca - Alta Communal Bank located in the town of Rumichaca, province of Urubamba, and department of Cusco.

The member’s name is Emiliana.   She is 43 years old, lives with her partner, and has 4 children (ages 18, 7, 4, and one month).  She alternates her activities in the home with raising guinea pigs.  She has a designated space in her house for them and is going to buy groups of 10 to 20 guinea pigs and make them reproduce gradually.  Emiliana is a bit busy caring for her baby. However, she states that in order to continue her business, she must still continue caring for her guinea pigs so that they have their daily food and adequate attention. Then she will sell them wholesale to various tourist restaurants in the area. Emiliana is requesting the loan at this time to buy fresh guinea pigs in order to continue with her work and thereby increase her profits.

Emiliana is very grateful for the loan and agrees to meet the payments in a disciplined manner.
.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of guinea pigs and therby increase her profits.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Doña Martina es originaria del Municipio de Ocampo, Michoacán., zona donde se ubica el Santuario de la Mariposa Monarca, donde la gente se conoce muy bien y se respira una gran tranquilidad y se disfruta de un maravilloso paisaje. Ella es una persona muy alegre, responsable y forma parte del comité del grupo en donde desempeña su función muy bien. Desde hace 18 años decidió emprender un negocio para poder apoyar en los ingresos familiares y sacar adelante a su hija que continúa sus estudios. Doña Martina es una mujer trabajadora y muy emprendedora, ella cuenta con un pequeño negocio de abarrotes, también vende  tamales, corundas, pozole por las noches afuera de su casa su gran dedicación por salir adelante la impulso a ser comerciante y ser independiente. El crédito de Fundación Realidad la ha beneficiado mucho ya que tiene mejores ingresos gracias a la oportunidad del crédito, ella  invita a las mujeres de sus comunidad a salir adelante a través de un negocio propio, ya que ella le ha puesto mucho empeño a su trabajo y es un ejemplo a seguir para las mujeres de su comunidad a las cuales les ha demostrado que con esfuerzo y dedicación pueden mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Martina is originally from the municipality of Ocampo, Michoacán, where the Monarch Butterfly Sanctuary is located and where the people know each other well and are tranquil and enjoy the beautiful countryside. She is a very happy and responsible person, and is part of the group's committee where she serves well in her role. 

18 years ago she decided to start a business to support her family's income and to help her daughter continue with her studies. Martina is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She has a small grocery store and she also sells tamales, corundas [a similar dish to tamales] and pozole [hominy soup] outside of her house at night. Her dedication to getting ahead pushed her to be a merchant and to be independent. 

The loan from Fundacion Realidad has been of great benefit to her since she now has more income thanks to the opportunity the loan gave her. She invites women from her community to get ahead by starting their own business, since she has put a lot of effort into her work and is an example for women in her community to follow. She has demonstrated to them that with effort and dedication they can improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in grocery items

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Valentina; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de realizar llamadas telefónicas, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m y la socia también realiza negocios independientes ahora que se acerca las fiestas patrias que se celebra por el día del Peru,la socia va a vender banderas del Perú y luego los vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de banderas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como tela e hilos para hacer las banderas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the San Rafael Communal Bank located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco, department of Cusco.  

The member’s name is Valentina.  She is 38 years old and married with three children.  She works from 7:00 AM until 6:00 PM, alternating her daily activities between her telephone call center job and operating an independent business.  Now that the Peruvian National Holidays are approaching, Valentina is going to work as a street vendor selling Peruvian flags.  She wishes to expand her business of selling flags and is requesting this loan to buy materials such as fabric and thread to make the flags.

Valentina is happy to receive the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: buy materials such as fabric and thread to make flags.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es: La señora Azucena es originaria de la localidad de Ocampo donde se encuentran los santuarios de la mariposa monarca, ella cuenta con 72 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Gerardo y tuvieron 11 hijos ya todos casados pero que le ayudan con los gastos de su casa, ella es una persona muy trabajadora porque pese a su edad ella sigue constante en su trabajo ella dice “mi trabajo me anima a seguir adelante abecés ya no veo muy bien pero yo le hecho ganas para hacer mas bordados artesanales para venderlos y la gente se sienta orgullosa de mi y yo misma sentirme bien y no estar atenida al dinero que mis hijos me dan”, comenta que con el préstamo ella comprara hilos, marquice, ganchos, agujas etc. Ella hace carpetas, servilletas, almohadones, manteles y más. Ofrece sus costuras en su población y cuando es temporada de turistas en los meses de noviembre a febrero sube al santuario a vender sus costuras artesanales. La meta que tiene doña Azucena es poner una tienda de abarrotes en su casa para ya no salir ya que por su edad se le dificulta trasladarse rápidamente de un lugar a otro. Ella esta agradecida por este préstamo que le están otorgando ya que así ella tiene una fuente de empleo con la cual puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Azucena is originally from Ocampo, where the Monarch Butterfly Sanctuaries are found. She is 72 years old, married to Gerardo, and they have 11 children who are all married but who help them with the costs of their home. She is a very hardworking woman who in spite of her age continues to work. She says "my work motivates me to move ahead. Sometimes I don't see well, but I'm determined to make more artisan embroidery to sell and people are proud of me and I feel good about myself when I'm not dependent on the money my kids give me". She comments that with the loan she will by thread, frames, hooks, needles, etc. She makes cloths, napkins, pillow covers, tablecloths and more. She offers her products to the local people and when it is tourist season, from November to February, she goes up to the sanctuary to sell her artisan embroidery. Azucena's goal is to put a grocery store in her home so that she doesn't have to leave, since because of her age she has trouble getting from one place to another quickly. She is thankful for the loan that has been given to her since she will have a source of employment which will enable her to help her husband with the costs of the home.

loans.use: to make artisan embroidery

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dolores; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de servicio de hacer llamadas, ella trabaja en forma ambulatoria en las diferentes calles del Cusco desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m y por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de servicio de hacer las llamadas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar celulares y pagar las líneas de los celulares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the San Rafael Communal Bank located in the district of Cusco, province and department of Cusco.

Her name is Dolores.  She is 47 years old, lives with her partner, and has 4 children.  She works from 7:00 AM until 8:00 PM, alternating her activities between her telephone call service and working as a street vendor on various streets of Cusco.  Through this work, she helps her children get ahead.  She wishes to expand her telephone call service.  She is requesting this loan to purchase cellular phones and pay for cellular phone lines.

She is happy to be receiving the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: buy cellular phones and pay for cellular phone lines.

loans.name: Anselmo

texts.es:
Don Anselmo, reside en Anamoros departamento de la Unión, se dedica a la crianza de ganado y el cultivo de granos básicos, vive con su esposa, no tiene hijos a cargo porque estos ya viven fuera. Él inicio hace 10 años la crianza de ganado, trabaja con ayuda de su esposa y en ocasiones contrata mozos.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de una vaca con cría que cuesta alrededor de $475.00, este préstamo le ayudara a incrementar el número de ganado y sobre todo las vacas con crías le ayudan a aumentar la producción de leche.
Las aspiraciones de don Anselmo es sacar un buen provecho del terreno que dispone para que el ganado tenga espacio suficiente y alimentación.
texts.en:
Don Anselmo lives in Anamoros, department of La Unión.  He raises livestock and cultivates basic grains.  He lives with his wife but has no dependent children as they already live on their own.  Ten years ago, he began raising livestock.  He works with the help of his wife and sometimes hires workers.  Currently, he is requesting this loan to buy a cow with calf that costs around $475.00.  This loan will help him to increase the number of livestock and, most importantly, the cows with calves will help him to increase the production of milk.  

Don Anselmo plans to take advantage of land available for the livestock so that they have enough space and food.

loans.use: buy a cow with calf.

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
Doña Martha, de 54 años de edad , es originaria de Pueblo Nuevo  municipio de Estelí ,ella es madre de dos hijos , esta casada, se dedica a vender productos alimenticios en una pequeña pulpería que ella misma administra, esta pulpería la tiene en su hogar , lleva 7 años en esta actividad. Ella empezó su negocio con poco capital sin la ayuda de nada con el tiempo ha venido mejorando y creciendo su negocio, ella tiene expectativas de gran crecimiento de su negocio, sus hijos la apoyan, el mayor de sus hijos trabaja en Costa Rica el le envía remesas para que se ayude con los gastos del hogar. 
Solicito el préstamo para comprar más productos para vender en su pulpería, incrementar su inventario. Con esto espera mejorar sus ventas, mantener surtida de todo tipo de productos que la gente demande, incrementar su clientela, mejorar sus ingresos.  
Desea convertir su pulpería en un mini súper mercado, componer su casa es una de sus próximas metas  e incorporarle a su negocio venta de ropa. Pues ella se considera una mujer con un gran espíritu de superación.
texts.en: Ms. Martha, 54, is originally from Pueblo Nuevo in the municipality of Estelí. She is married, the mother of two children, and sells food products in a small pulpería [grocery store] that she runs herself. She has this pulpería in her house and has been running it for seven years. She started her business with very little capital and without any help. Over time, she has been improving and growing her business. She expects great growth for her business. Both of her children support her. Her oldest son works in Costa Rica and sends remittances to help her with the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more products to sell in her pulpería and to increase her inventory. She hopes that this will allow her to improve her sales, keep the store stocked with all types of products that people demand, increase her clientele, and improve her earnings. She would like to convert her pulpería to a mini supermarket. One of her next goals is to repair her house, as well as to incorporate clothing sales into her business. She considers herself to be a woman with a great desire to improve.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in her small grocery store and to increase her inventory

loans.name: Babita

texts.en: Mrs. Babita C. lives with her husband and one son in Tangal Lalitpur. Her son is studying in grade 12. She and her husband, Mr. Dinesh C., are engaged in their own kitchen supplies shop. They opened their shop more than five years ago. They sell kitchen equipment such as irons, rice-cookers, and lots of other kitchen utensils in their shop. Nowadays, the demand for these items is increasing among working women. So, to meet the demands of the customers, Mrs. Shrestha is requesting 30,000 NPR to invest in their shop.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils to sell in her shop

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes es una persona muy trabajadora y una persona que tiene mucha creatividad e imaginación, ella se dedica hacer figuras en madera, dice que le enseñaron unas personas por parte del gobierno del estado y les dieron unos cursos con los cuales ella esta saliendo adelante y esta sacando a su hijo Noel adelante ya que es madre soltera, dice que cuando es temporada de la mariposa monarca sube a los santuarios a ofrecerlos y ya tiene varios clientes que le compran la artesanía para ellos revenderlos. Ella esta agradecida con la Fundación por que gracias a los prestamos ella esta saliendo adelante y puede comprar lo necesario para su negocio, ella comprara pegamento, lijas, madera y también quiere invertir en un poco en el negocio de venta de colchas por catalogo. Doña Lourdes tiene con su negocio aproximadamente 1 año y ella esta muy contenta con lo que hace ella dice “soy muy feliz haciendo mis artesanías ya que la gente se sorprende al verlas y me las compra que es lo mejor de todo y así puedo mantener a mi pequeño hijo”.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a very hard-working person who has a lot of creativity and imagination.  She makes handicrafts from wood.  She says that some people working on behalf of the state government taught her this trade.  They provided some courses and, as a result, she is managing to get ahead in life together with her son Noel.  She is a single mother.  Lourdes tells us that during the Monarch butterfly season, she goes to the butterfly sanctuaries and offers her products for sale.  She has several customers who buy her handicrafts to re-sell.

Lourdes is grateful to Fundación Realidad because, thanks to their loans, she is getting ahead in life and is able to buy what she needs for her business.  She will use this loan to buy adhesive, sandpaper and wood.  She would also like to invest a little in her business selling bedspreads through a catalog.  Lourdes has been in her business for approximately one year and she is very happy with what she does.  She says "I am very happy making my handicrafts because people are amazed when they see them and they buy them from me which is the very best thing.  In this way, I am able to support my young son".

loans.use: to make handicrafts from wood
