loans.name: Eduwiges

texts.es: La señora Eduwiges se dedica a la venta de productos de plástico por catalogo  para la cocina como jarras vasos, ensaladeras y un poco de productos de belleza como maquillajes y pinturas para dama ella lleva  con este negocio hace 20 años para ayudar en los gastos de su casa, dice que ella ofrece sus productos en las rancherías aledañas a su comunidad y surte sus productos en la población de Hidalgo en un distribuidor autorizado para que le den un buen precio y ella venderlo una poco mas barato que sus competidoras. Ella esta agradecida con el préstamo por que gracias a este podrá tener en existencia productos y así las clientas se los compren más rápido. Comenta que uno de sus obstáculos para hacer crecer su negocio es que le ayuda a su hija a cuidar a sus hijos ya que es madre soltera y tiene que salir a trabajar y eso le quita un poco de tiempo para ver a más clientas. Ella esta casada con el señor Juan José el cuál es jornalero ellos tuvieron 3 hijos pero nada mas uno depende de ella llamado Omar el cual estudia la preparatoria.
texts.en: Eduwiges sells plastic kitchen supplies such as jugs, cups and bowls by catalog. She also sells some beauty products such as makeup. She has been in this business for 20 years to help with her family's expenses. She offers her products to the surrounding villages to her community. She stocks her products in the town of Hidalgo at an authorized distributor so that she can get a good price and be able to sell at a lower price than her competitors. She is thankful for this loan because, thanks to this loan, she will be able to stock products and thus her clients will buy more quickly. One of the obstacles to the growth of her business is that she has to help her daughter take care of her children since her daughter is a single mother and has to go out to work. This takes away some of Eduwiges' time to see more clients. She is married to Juan Jose who is a laborer. They had three children but only one of them, Omar who is in high school, depends on them.

loans.use: in the sale of kitchen supplies and beauty supplies.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mariela; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es casada; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos naturales para la salud, ella vende en forma independiente y también la socia trabaja como psicóloga, por medio de este negocio independiente y su trabajo la socia saca adelante a su familia, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de productos naturales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos naturales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member belongs to the San Rafael Community Bank located in the district of Cusco, province and department of Cusco. Her name is Mariela.  She is 35 years old and married.  Mariela alternates her activities between selling natural health products independently and working as a psychologist. Through her independent business and her work, Mariela helps her family get ahead. She wishes to improve sales in her natural product business and is requesting the loan to buy natural products.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and promises to make her payment son time.

loans.use: buy natural products.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La señora Rosa  es originaria de la población de Melchor Ocampo un lugar hermosos lleno de vegetación y con un clima agradable. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, perfumería por catalogo desde hace 4 años, ella ofrece sus productos a sus vecinas y a diferentes personas que tienen empleos seguros para que no le queden mal con los pagos. Doña Rosa esta pidiendo un crédito para tener mas surtido y pueda ofrecer mas cosas a sus clientelas ella dice “a mis clientas les gusta oler los perfumes y si les gusta se los dejan por eso quiero el crédito para tener en existencia para cuando me pidan algún perfume vendérselos para que no se me arrepientan de comprarme los perfumes o los cosméticos”. Ella surte sus productos en distribuidores autorizados en la población de Zitacuaro, comenta que una de sus problemáticas para poder tener mas clientas es la falta de tiempo ya que tiene que hacer la comida para sus hijos y llevarlos a la escuela. Pero eso no la detiene ella quiere salir adelante por que es una persona constante en su negocio. Doña Rosa esta casada con el señor José Luís el cual es empleado, ellos tienen 3 hijos José Luís el cual estudia la primaria, Alison de 3 años y Ángel de un año de edad.
texts.en:
Rosa is from the village of Melchor Ocampo, a beautiful spot filled with vegetation and an agreeable climate. She has sold cosmetics and perfume by catalog for some 4 years. She offers her products to her neighbors and to different people who have secure employment, to avoid problems in payment.

Rosa is requesting a loan to obtain more selection and to be able to offer more things to her customers. She says “My customers like to smell perfumes and if they like them they buy them; that's why I need the loan, to have things on hand so that when they request a certain perfume, I can sell it to them and won't have to delay in order to buy those perfumes or cosmetics.”

Rosa buys her products from authorized distributors in the city of Zitacuaro. She notes that one problem she encounters in trying to gain more customers is the lack of time, because she has to prepare meals for her children plus take them to and from school.

But this doesn't hold her back. She wants to get ahead and she is dedicated to her business. Rosa is married to Jose, an employee, and they have 3 children; Jose Luis, who studies in primary, Alison who is 3 years old, and Angel who is 1 year old.

loans.use: to buy perfume and cosmetics to sell by catalog.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana cuanta con 37 años de edad comenta que ella nada mas termino la primaria y ya no siguió estudiando debido a que sus papas no tenían tiempo de llevarla ya que tenían que salir fuera de la población a vender su fruta y a doña Juana también le gustaba mas el comercio que ir a la escuela entonces se dedico por completo a la venta de fruta desde muy pequeña. Ella es originaria de una localidad llamada Melchor Ocampo donde su atractivo son los santuarios de la mariposa monarca que en ese lugar se encuentran. Doña Juana se dedica a vender frutas y verduras en el mercado de esa población, ella esta pidiendo un préstamo a la financiera para comprar verduras frescas como  jitomates, tomate, chayotes, calabazas, zanahorias etc. Ella tiene con este negocio 21 años de edad sus papas le ayudaron a emprender este negocio para que ella se hiciera responsable de sus gastos desde muy pequeña. Juana esta agradeciendo este préstamo ya que ahorita no tiene tanta mercancía y con este préstamo podrá surtir mejor su puesto de verduras, comenta que ella surte cada 8 días en la central de abastos en la población de Zitacuaro. Doña Juana esta casada con el señor Jesús el cual es empleado y tienen 4 hijos. La meta que tiene Juana es meter un poco de chiles secos y semillas en su negocio para vender otro tipo de productos.
texts.en:
Juana, age 37, says that she only has an elementary school education.  She did not continue her education because her parents did not have time to take her to school.   They had to go outside their village to sell their fruit.  Juana also liked selling more than going to school.  She has devoted herself completely to selling fruit ever since she was very young.

She is from a place called Melchor Ocampo.  The monarch butterfly sanctuaries found there are the appeal of the place.

Juana sells fruit and vegetables in the village market.

She is requesting a loan to buy fresh vegetables like chilies, tomatoes, chayotes (in the squash family), and carrots, etc.  She has had this business for 21 years.  Her parents helped her start this business when she was very young so that she would be responsible with her expenses.

Juana is very grateful for this loan.  Right now she does not have much merchandise, and she will be able to better stock her vegetable stand with the loan.  She says that she stocks up every eight days in the village supply center in Zitacuaro.

Juana is married to Jesús, who is employed.  They have four children.  

The goal that Juana has is to introduce a little bit of dried chilies and seeds to her business.  She will do that in order to sell other types of products.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ma Angelina

texts.es: Angelina es una persona muy trabajadora y creativa ella se dedica a elaborar y a la venta de artesanías de ocoshal, esta se elabora con la hoja seca  que se desprende del árbol de ocote y que es recolectada del piso por las personas que se dedican a elaborar este tipo de reciclado hecho  específicamente con la hoja muerta como principal materia prima. Doña Angelina esta pidiendo un préstamo para la compra de material para realizarlas como hilo, agujas bolsa para empacarlas etc. Ella tiene con este negocio 14 años y hace fruteros, floreros, canastas, recuerdos para bodas, servilleteros, aretes y muchas cosas mas, ellas sale a venderlas a la cuidad de Morelia y en los santuarios de la mariposa monarca, y dice que abecés tiene pedido para bodas, quince años, bautizos etc. Ella esta muy contenta con lo que hace. Dice que a ella le enseñaron hacer sus artesanías unas personas del Estado de México que les ofrecieron darles un curso de cómo realizar ese tipo de artesanías para aprovechar la materia prima que cae de los árboles. Doña Angelina esta agradecida con este crédito ya que asi podra comprar lo que le hace falta para seguir haciendo las artesanías en ocoshal.
texts.en:
Angelina is a very hard-working and creative person.  She makes and sells  handicrafts made from “ocochal” (small pine leaves).  She makes the crafts with the dry leaves that come off of the “ocote” (type of pine) tree.  The leaves are gathered from the ground by people who make this type of recyclable item, specifically with the dead leaf as the primary material.

Angelina is asking for a loan to buy material for making her handicrafts.  She will buy things like thread, needles, and bags for packing the handicrafts, etc.  

She has had this business for 14 years.  She makes things like fruit baskets, flower vases, baskets, wedding souvenirs, napkin rings, earrings, and many other things.  She goes to the city of Moerlia and the Monarch butterfly sanctuaries to sell them.

Sometimes she has orders for weddings, celebrations of 15th birthdays, and baptisms, etc.  She is very happy with what she does.  She says that people from the state of Mexico taught her how do make her handicrafts.  They offered to teach a course on how to make this type of handicraft by taking advantage of the raw material that falls from the trees.

Angelina is grateful for this loan.  This way she will be able to buy what she needs in order to keep making her handicrafts from ocochal.

loans.use: to make handicrafts from "ocoshal" (small pine leaves).

loans.name: Manju

texts.en: Mrs. Manju R. lives in Tangal. Tangal is located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in business activities. Mrs. Manju R. lives with her husband and one daughter. Her husband, Mr. Binod R., works in a printing press. Her daughter is in primary school. Mrs. R. opened her shoe shop in Lagankhel in the footpath market. She sells different types of shoes and sandals. The rent for shops in that area is very high, so she can't afford to pay rent. She needs to purchase different varieties of shoes and sandals for her shop. So she requests a 30,000 NPR loan to purchase different types of shoes and sandals, particularly children's and ladies' shoes. She wants to provide good education to her daughter.

loans.use: to buys different kinds of shoes for her shop.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: La señora Alicia se dedica a vender cosméticos, perfumes, trastes para cocina etc., por catalogo, ella tiene con este negocio 3 años y esta muy contenta de vender este tipo de producto dice ella “gracias a que vendo mis productos he conocido mas gente de mi población y de las localidades vecinas y he hecho mas amistades y así poco a poco me acliento mas y vendo rápido mis productos”. Doña Alicia surte sus productos por vía Internet y le llegan a su casa, ella esta muy agradecida por el préstamo por que así podrá tener en existencia productos. Ella esta casada con la señor Ramón el cual es chofer y tienen tres hijos uno estudiante de preparatoria, el segundo estudiante de secundaria y el tercero estudiante de primaria. La meta que tiene doña Alicia con su negocio es ser un distribuidor autorizado ya que en su localidad no lo hay.
texts.en:
Alicia sells cosmetics, perfume, kitchenware etc. through a catalog.  She has been in this business for three years and is very happy to be selling this type of product.  She says "thanks to selling my products, I have met more people in my town and in neighboring towns and I have made more friends.  I am gradually gaining more customers and I sell my products quickly".

Alicia stocks up with products through the Internet and they are delivered to her home.  She is very grateful for this loan because it will enable her to have products in stock.  Alicia is married to Ramón, who is a driver, and they have three children.  Their eldest child is in high school, their second child is in middle school and the youngest is in elementary school.  Alicia's goal for her business is to become an authorized distributor since there isn't one in her town.

loans.use: to sell cosmetics through a catalog

loans.name: Aligda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Aligda, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la compra y crianza de cerdos, es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 8 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres; Ella realiza esta actividad desde hace 5 años, comenzó por iniciativa propia, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 5:00pm, hasta la fecha se ha mantenido en el trabajo.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de tres cerdos, estos son para criarlos y luego ponerlos a la venta, esta inversión le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio y generar más ganancia.
Su objetivo es mantenerse en el negocio, contar con esta fuente de ingreso ya que tiene que estar pendiente de los gastos de su hijo y apoyar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Aligda lives in El Transito in the Salvadoran "departamento" of San Miguel.  She operates a business raising and selling pigs.  She's a single mother with an 8-year old daughter.  She lives with her parents.  She has operated the business for 5 years.  She started it on her own initiative, working every day from 6:00am to 5:00pm, for all of that time.  
Aligda is applying for a loan so that she can buy three pigs.  She will raise them for sale.  The investment will help her to strengthen her business and increase her income.
Aligda's goal is to hold on to the business because the income it generates is her means for supporting her child and helping her parents.

loans.use: to buy three pigs.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Zurite, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Elena; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de leche, la socia cría los ganados y luego saca la leche para luego venderlas en forma independiente, ella lL. a la ciudad del Cusco y lo reparte a diferentes personas, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de leche. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos como pasto para los ganados.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is a member of the "San Martin de Zurite" communiy bank which is located in Zurite district, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

Maria Elena is 37 years old, lives with her partner, and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business buying and selling milk.  She raises cows which she milks and then she sells the milk independently. She takes the milk to the city of Cusco and delivers it to different people.  She would like to expand her milk business.  She is requesting this loan to buy feed such as fodder for her cattle.

Maria Elena is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy feed such as fodder for her animals

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol es originaria de la localidad de Ocampo, ella se dedica a la venta de semillas y dulces en un local que tiene en su casa, también tiene maquinitas (juegos de video), tiene con este negocio aproximadamente 6 años y lo emprendió para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, pese a que ha tenido fuertes problemas como la muerte de sus bebe ella es muy constante en su trabajo. Dice que sus padres fueron quienes le inculcaron ser trabajadora ya que ellos son comerciantes y desde ahí ella le hecho ganas para salir adelante, Marisol esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos de abarrotes ya que quiere emprender ese negocio ella quiere comprar jabón, sopas, papel higiénico, semillas para dorar y vender, dulces, refrescos etc. dice que antes tenia su tienda de abarrotes pero que desde que falleció su bebe se deprimió y ya no pudo seguir adelante con su negocio. Ella esta muy agradecida por que le están otorgando este préstamo por que así otra vez va a poder surtir su tienda como antes y podrá tener una nueva entrada de dinero para su casa y así ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella esta casada con el señor José el cual es empleado y ahorita esta muy contenta por que tiene una bebe de 3 meses. Uno de sus sueños es salir adelante y darle lo mejor a su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Marisol is from the town of Ocampo.  Her business is selling seeds and sweet treats from premises located in her home.  She also has game machines.  She has been in this business for approximately six years and started her business in order to help her husband cover their household expenses.  Although she has suffered serious problems, such as the death of her baby, she is very persevering in her work.  She says that it was her parents who taught her to work hard since they are salespeople and it is from them that she got her desire to get ahead in life. 

Marisol is requesting a loan to buy groceries since she would like to start a grocery business.  She would like to buy soap, soups, toilet paper, seeds to toast and sell, sweet treats, soft drinks, etc.  She says that she used to own a grocery store but after her baby died she became depressed and couldn't continue in her business.  She is very grateful that she is being given this loan because it means she will be able to stock her store again and make a new source of income so that she can help her husband with their household expenses.

Marisol is married to José who is a private employee and right now she is very happy because she has a 3 month-old baby.  One of her dreams is to get ahead in life and provide her young daughter with the best.

loans.use: to buy groceries and seeds to sell

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura es originaria de la localidad de Ocampo ella tiene 35 años de edad, ellas se dedica a realizar prendas artesanales como servilletas, carpetas, almohadones, etc. doña Laura esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de hilos, marquice, estambres, agujas, aros y mas cosas para hacer sus costuras. Dice que su mama fue que le enseño hacer sus costuras y desde hace 10 años vende sus artesanías en los santuarios de la mariposa monarca y hay gente que le hacen pedidos para bodas y quince años. Doña Laura esta casada con el señor Martín el cual es jornalero ellos tienen 4 hijos Fabiola, Karina, Gabriela estudiantes de primaria y Alejandro de un año de edad. Doña laura esta agradecida por este prestamo porque asi podra comprar lo necesario para realizar sus prendas artesanales.
texts.en: Laura is 35 years old and comes from Ocampo. She makes her living by producing homemade embroidered gifts, such as napkins, table cloths and pillows. Laura has requested the loan to buy thread, frames, yarns, needles, rings and other sewing materials. She says it was her mother that taught her embroidery and she has been selling her homemade gifts at the [nearby] king butterfly sanctuaries for ten years. She also has customer requests for weddings and quinceañera parties (celebrations held when a girl turns 15 years old). Laura is married to Martín, who is a day labourer, and has four children: Fabiola, Karina, and Gabriela are at primary school, while Alejandro is one year old. Laura is very grateful for the loan, which will make it possible to buy all the necessary materials to make her embroidered gifts.

loans.use: To produce homemade gifts

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda tiene 25 años,  es una joven trabajadora, hace 3 años que convive con Marlon con quien tiene una hija llamada “Mariana”, a la que cuidan con mucho amor y cariño en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Huasahuasi. Desde muy joven comenzó a dedicarse a la agricultura, de eso hace 5 años atrás. Su principal sembrío es de papa, los cuales siembra en terrenos alquilados, pues tiene poco espacio de cultivo. Además comercializa sus cosechas con la ayuda de su esposo en la costa del país donde obtiene mejores ganancias, ya que es un mercado amplio donde existen pocos agricultores. Asimismo cuenta que paralelo a su trabajo se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa de vestir para niños, niñas y adolescentes. “Vendo a los pobladores del caserío, ellos ya me conocen y me piden diferentes prendas de vestir que luego compro en grandes cantidades”, afirma. Para su futuro desea abrir una tienda donde pueda vender ropa de toda variedad y calidad, para ello está ahorrando una suma considerable de dinero para poder comenzar con su gran sueño. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Visca”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera lograr sus objetivos con el apoyo de los integrantes de su asociación. Con el crédito espera invertirlo en la compra de diferentes prendas de vestir para comenzar con la venta de prendas.
texts.en:
Nilda is 25 years old.  She is a hard-working young woman who has been living with Marlon for three years.  They have a daughter called Mariana who they care for, with a lot of love and affection, in their own home which is located in Huasahuasi.  Nilda started farming when she was very young.  She has been farming for the past five years.

Nilda's main crop is potatoes which she grows on rented land.  She has little space for growing her crops.  She sells her harvested crops, with her husband's help, on the coast where she makes better profits since it is a broad market with few farmers.  In parallel with her farming work, she also buys and sells clothes for children and teenagers.  "I sell to people who live in the small villages.  They already know me and they ask me for different clothes that I then buy in large quantities" she says.

In the future, Nilda would like to open a store where she can sell clothes of all kinds and quality.  She is saving up a considerable sum of money so that she can realize her great dream.  Nilda is a member of the "Villa Visca" community bank and this is her first loan from MFP.  She hopes to achieve her goals with the support of the members of her association.  She hopes to invest her loan money in buying different items of clothing to start selling.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Maria Martha

texts.es:
María, tiene 60 años de edad, es originaria de la comunidad Rincones ubicada en Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, esta casada, es madre de 7 hijos pero ella tenia 9 pero dos de sus hijos murieron así que en la actualidad tiene 7 hijos, ella es dueña de una pulpería, proveniente de un hogar pobre sus padres no la pusieron a estudiar, ella no aprendió a leer ni a escribir a como se debe, aun así ha sabido salir adelante, es dueña de una pequeña pulpería. Ella comenzó este negocio a los 30 años de edad, tenia muy poco inventario, su marido  apoyo, consiguió un préstamo para invertirlo en compras de productos para vender y así fue incrementando su venta de productos, gracias a ese negocio ha venido subsistiendo ella y su familia.  
Solicita el préstamo para comprar nuevos productos y reponer los ya que no tiene surtir mejor su pulpería. Con esta inversión espera mejorar su ventas, incrementar su clientela, ampliar su negocio donde ofrezca mas y mejores productos en su comunidad .Tiene planeado en un futuro hacer mas grande su negocio , hacerle mejoras de infraestructura su casa y poder dar empleo a otras personas.
texts.en:
María, age 60, is from the Rincones community in Pueblo Nuevo in the Estelí municipality.  She is married and has seven children.  She had nine, but two of her children died.  That is why she now has seven children.

She is the owner of a grocery store.  Coming from a poor household, her parents did not send her to school.  She did not learn to read or write as she should have.  Even so, she has known how to get ahead.  She has her own small grocery store.

She started this business when she was 30 years old.  She had a very small amount of inventory.  He husband helped her.  She got a loan to buy products to sell.  That is how she was increasing the sales of her products.  Thanks to this business she and her family have been surviving.

She is requesting the loan to buy new products and to restock products that are not well-stocked in her grocery store.  With this investment she hopes to improve her sales, have more customers, and expand her business.  She hopes to offer more and better products to her community.

In the future she plans to make her business bigger, make improvements to the infrastructure of her house, and to be able to give employment to other people.

loans.use: to buy new products and to restock products that are not well-stocked in her grocery store.

loans.name: Denis Alexander

texts.es:
Denis, reside en San Jorge departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 6 años de edad, se  dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, desde hace 15 años, aprendió de su padre, trabaja todos los días, de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes, pues se dispone a sembrar maíz y frijol, este préstamo le ayudara a obtener todo lo necesario para realizar la siembra y algunos de los riesgos es por el ambiente, todo depende de cómo este el invierno.
Él aspira tener este trabajo por un largo tiempo, que sea rentable para poder ayudar a su familia y más que todo a su hijo, para que crezca y sea un profesional.
texts.en:
Denis lives in San Jorge, in San Miguel department, together with his wife and 6 year-old son.  He grows corn and beans and has been doing this for 15 years.  He learned from his father and works every day from 6.00am to 3.00pm.

Denis needs this loan to buy manure and fertilizers as he is preparing to sow corn and beans.  This loan will help him to obtain everything he needs to sow his crops.  Some of the risks he faces are weather related.  Everything depends on how severe the winter is.

Denis aspires to remain in this line of work for a long time and for it to be profitable so that he can help his family, especially his son who he would like to see grow and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Ema

texts.es: La señora Ema tiene la edad de 66 años y pese a su edad es una persona muy trabajadora ya que tiene una tienda de abarrotes llamada “Monarca” y los días domingo por la noche vende pozole, corundas, tacos etc. ella tiene con su negocio de los abarrotes hace 5 años y dice que sus hijos les ayudaron a ponerlo para que de ahí se mantuvieran y no tuvieran preocupaciones de dinero. Doña Ema cada 8 días sale a surtirse de sus abarrotes a la población de Zitacuaro ya que dice que le dan buenos precios y así ella le puede ganar un poco más. La señora ema comprara con su crédito refresco, jabón, arroz, azúcar, papel higiénico, fríjol, pan, sopas, leche etc. ella esta agradecida con el préstamo porque dice que gracias a este podrá tener muy bien surtido su local.
texts.en: Ema is 66 years old, and in spite of her age, she is a very hard-working person. She has a small grocery store called “Monarca” ["Monarch"], and Sunday nights she also sells pozole [a traditional soup], corundas [a type of tamales], tacos, etc. She has had her grocery business for 5 years, and she says that her children helped her set it up, so that they could support themselves and not have money worries. Every 8 days, Ema goes out to stock up on groceries in the town of Zitacuaro, since she says they give her good prices there, and in this way she can earn a little more. With her loan, Ema will buy soft drinks, soap, rice, sugar, bathroom tissue, beans, bread, soups, milk, etc. She is grateful for the loan because she says that thanks to it, she will be able to have her store very well stocked.

loans.use: stock her small grocery store.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Asha M..  She is married and has one child, aged 10.  In 2006, she established  her furniture making business.  Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy wood for her work.  In the future, Asha plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.   

In Nepal, furniture is still made the old-fashioned way.  Using little more than basic hand tools, skilled artisans form raw lumber into beautifully finished pieces of furniture.  With precision and an eye for detail, furniture makers produce shelves, bed frames, and cabinet sets.  With the help of a Kiva loan, a furniture maker is able to increase the volume of their lumber purchases or hire additional labor.  This additional leverage allows an entrepreneur to increase productivity and profitability. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

loans.use: to buy wood for her business.

loans.name: Ana Ysabel

texts.es: La Sra. Ana, tiene como actividad la venta de diversos productos en su tienda de barrio donde vive. El destino del crédito en esta oportunidad es para la compra de mercadería "compra de abarrotes" como fideo, azúcar, arroz, aceite, etc. La familia de la cliente esta compuesta por su esposo y su pequeña hija, el esposo el   Sr. Néstor trabaja como operador de maquinaria pesada en el interior de país , es una familia relativamente joven muy responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana sells various products in her store in the neighborhood where she lives. She will use this loan to purchase merchandise such as noodles sugar, rice, oil, etc. 

Ana is married and has a young daughter. Her husband, Néstor, works as a heavy machinery operator in the center of the country. Hers is a relatively young family that is very responsible with a strong desire to get ahead and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as noodles, sugar, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Hugo Eduardo

texts.es: El joven Hugo tiene 22 años de edad el esta estudiando en la universidad y tienen un cibercafe, renta un local cerca del centro donde tiene 16 computadoras. El esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para comprar insumos como papel, tintas, cartuchos, discos y para pagar la mano de obra del mantenimiento de las computadoras, el tiene con ese negocio 3 años y dice que lo puso por que le agrada y sabe un poco de composturas de las computadoras, el esta muy entusiasmado por el préstamo por que poco a poco lo hará mas grande. La meta que tiene Hugo es poner otro cibercafe en otra población y uno de sus retos es ahorrar para hacer un local propio ya que las rentas son muy caras.
texts.en: Young Hugo is 22 years old, is studying at university and has an internet café. He rents a local that is close to the center and where he has 16 computers. He is seeking a loan to buy supplies like paper, ink, cartridges and disks and to pay for the labour to maintain the computers. He has been in this business for 3 years and says he does it because he likes it and he knows a bit about computer repairs. He is very enthusiastic about the loan, because little by little he will make it bigger. Hugo’s goal is to start-up another internet café in another town, and one of his challenges is to save up enough for his own premises, since rents are very expensive.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his internet café.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de comida y pupusas, reside en San Miguel, es madre soltera de tres hijos de 28, 15 y 12 años de edad, ella tiene el negocio desde hace 11 años y trabaja todos los días de 7:00am a 6:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar productos para la venta tanto de comida como pupusas, los materiales que comprara son Aceite, carnes, condimentos, quesillo, entre otros que son necesarios; Esta inversión le ayudara a contar con disponibilidad de ingredientes y poder dar abasto a la demanda.
El objetivo de ella es crecer en el negocio, apoyar a sus hijos y que estos salgan adelante con sus estudios y puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Ana sells food and pupusas.  She lives in San Miguel and is a single mother.  She has three children aged 28, 15 and 12.  She has owned her business for 11 years and works every day, from 7.00am to 6.00pm.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy products to sell, both food and pupusas.  She will buy oil, meat, condiments, quesillo (soft cheese) and other products she needs.  This investment will help her as it means she will continue to have ingredients available and she will be able to meet her demand.

Ana's goal is to grow in her business, to support her children and for her children to get ahead in their studies and be able to improve themselves.

loans.use: to buy oil, meat, condiments and 'quesillo' (soft cheese)

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Aunque en nuestra cultura las labores del campo son más propias del género masculino, Sandra Patricia V. es una emprendedora campesina que se ha dedicado a esta labor con el fin de hacerse cargo de su madre y vivir dignamente como ella misma lo afirma, para ello, en su pedacito de tierra ha sembrado café el cual se ha convertido en su única fuente de ingresos. 

Para seguir adelante con su cultivo, Sandra Patricia necesita de un crédito para renovar una parte del café y comprar insumos que le permitan una producción de mejor calidad con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Although in our culture farming work is more typically a male domain, Sandra Patricia V. is an entrepreneurial farmer who has been working in this business in order to take care of her mother and live a decent life as she herself says.  She has sown coffee on her small plot of land and this has become her only source of income.

In order to continue with her farming, Sandra Patricia needs a loan to renew some of her coffee plants and to buy supplies which will allow her to achieve better quality crops and thereby increase her income.

loans.use: to renew her coffee crops and buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es: Nazario, de 32 años, es un hombre soltero y trabajador. Vive en compañía de su mamá Yolanda a la que cuida con mucha dedicación pues ya es anciana. Ambos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Villa Visca. La actividad a la que se dedica es la agricultura, desde hace 15 años comenzó a sembrar producto oriundos como: papa y arveja, en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, pero según cuenta; en campaña agrícola alquila terrenos en el caserío de “Huacas”, donde siembra en mayores cantidades. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder comercializar siempre sus sembríos, pues a pesar de lo inestable que es el mercado, él siempre encuentra ganancias, ya que hace secar la papa por un periodo determinado para luego venderlo como semilla cuando está tiene menor precio de compra en el mercado. Asimismo trabaja como peón en diferentes cultivos, donde le pagan S/. 25 soles por día, de esa manera gana un dinero extra. Su principal preocupación es la falta de más terrenos agrícolas, ya que alquilando gasta más dinero, por ello está ahorrando lo necesario para poder comprar una. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Visca”, y este es el décimo crédito con MFP, donde trabaja con ahínco para el desarrollo de su asociación, pues es parte de la junta directiva. Nazario, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja, asimismo en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico; que esparcirá en sus sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
Nazario, age 32, is a hard-working single man.  He lives with his mother, Yolanda.  He takes care of her with great devotion because she is elderly.  They both live in their own house in the rural area of Villa Visca.

He is a farmer.  He started growing native crops like potatoes and peas fifteen years ago on his own land.  He says that during the farming season he rents fields in the rural community of Huacas, where he plants in greater quantities.  What he likes most about his work is always being able to sell his crops.  In spite of the instability of the market, he always gets income.  

He dries the potatoes for a specific amount of time, and then he sells them as seeds when he can get a better price for them  at the market.  He also works as a field worker on different fields where they pay him 25 soles per day.  This way he earns some extra money.

His biggest concern is the lack of more farming land.  Renting costs him more money.  That is why he is saving what he needs to be able to buy land.

He belongs to the Villa Visca Communal Bank.  This is his tenth loan with MFP.  He works earnestly for the development of his association.  He is part of the governing board.

Nazario will use the requested loan to buy two bags of pea seeds.  He will also buy various sacks or organic fertilizer, which he will spread over his potato crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer for his potato crops.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: El señor Rubén nacido el 11 de Marzo de 1986 en Santa Cruz en provincia de la Guardia, el trabaja con su padre quien es agricultor, y el sr. Rubén también es agricultor, trabajan  en la parcela de su padre el Sr. Rubén es casado con la Sra. Sandra con un hijo pequeño. El se dedica a la agricultura y a rallar madera para los carpinteros, también tiene su vagoneta, con la misma vagoneta trabaja los sábados y domingos que son sus días libres, el dinero del  crédito lo utilizara en la reparación y mantenimiento de esa vagoneta, ya que también le ayuda a transportar sus productos al mercado de la localidad, es un joven muy trabajador y su deseo es poder comprar sus propias tierras para sembrar, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Rubén was born on 11 March, 1986 in Santa Cruz in the province of La Guardia. He and his father are both farmers and work together on his father's plot of land. Rubén is married to Sandra and they have a young son. 

In addition to his farming work, Rubén also cuts wood for carpenters. He also has a passenger car and provides transportation services on Saturdays and Sundays, which are his days off. 

Rubén will use this loan to pay for repairs and maintenance on his car, which he also uses to transport his products to the local market. He is a very hard-working young many and his goal is to be able to buy his own land to farm. He is thankful to the institution for the support he has received.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle repair and maintenance.

loans.name: Antonia Digna

texts.es:
Antonia tiene su propio negocio, que inicio con el objetivo de poder traer ingresos para una mejor economía familiar. 
Vende en un tramo, los productos que ofreces son: gorras en variedad, fajas de dama y caballeros, bolsos, conectores para Dvd, entre otros.
Negocio que inicio con financiamiento que Afodenic otorgo mediante el préstamo, siendo de gran beneficio para el sustento de su familia, ya que su esposo trabaja en vigilancia, el cual no se ajustaba para todos los gastos.
Este es su cuarto ciclo, en donde invertirá en la compra de gorras, fajas, chinelas y zapatos deportivos, para aumentar las ventas.
texts.en:
Antonia owns her own business that she set up with the goal of making income to improve her family's finances.

Antonia sells her products from a stand.  She sells a variety of caps, women's and men's belts, bags, DVD connectors, etc.  She started her business with a loan from Afodenic.  It has been very useful in supporting her family since her husband works in the security business and his wages weren't enough to cover all their expenses.

This is Antonia's fourth loan cycle and she will invest her money in buying caps, belts, sandals and sports shoes so that she can increase her sales.

loans.use: to invest in buying caps, bags, sandals and sports shoes so that she can improve her sales

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Zurite, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jesusa; ella tiene 54 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos secos, ella vende tirgo, cebada y maíz, ella vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de productos secos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos secos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jesusa, age 54, is married and has four children. She is a member of the communal bank  “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE” located in the Zurite district of the Anta province, which is part of the department of Cusco.

Jesusa divides her time between her daily activities with her business of selling dry products -- she sells wheat, barley, and corn. She sells them in the street, working from 8am until 6pm. Jesusa would like to expand her business of selling dry products. She is seeking a loan in order to purchase dry products from a wholesaler. She is happy about the loan and is committed to repaying it in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase dry products wholesale

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN D. ZURITE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Zurite, perteneciente a la provincia D. Anta y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cirila; ella tiene 78 años D. edad y es viuda y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. chicha (bebida a base D. maíz) y también venD. jora que es un ingrediente que se prepara parea hacer la chicha, ella venD. en el distrito D. Zurite, por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio D. venta D. chicha y jora.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Cirila, age 78, is a widow and has four children. She is a member of the communal bank “SAN MARTIN D. ZURITE”; the bank is located in the Zurite district of the Anta province which is part of the department of Cusco.

Cirila divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling chicha (a corn-based drink); she also sells jora which is an ingredient necessary for the preparation of chicha. She sells her her products in the Zurite district, and this business gave Cirila the income necessary to raise her children. 

Cirila would like to improve her business of selling chicha and jora. She is seeking a loan in order to purchase corn from a wholesaler. She is happy about the loan and is committed to repaying it in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase corn wholesale

loans.name: Alicia Fotunata

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Oropesa,  provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alicia; es  casada, la socia tiene 45 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos de (27, 22) años de edad, la socia  alterna sus actividades del hogar con la administración y atención de su restaurante; la socia  tiene un restaurante en el bello y típico pueblo del pan Oropesa, ella tiene dos personas que le apoyan con la atención del mismo, la socia desea el préstamo para poder comprar arroz, aceite, gaseosas y todos los insumos necesarios para poder atender en el restaurante, al socia desea comprar al por mayor para que los costos sean menores y las ganancias mayores. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para el restaurante.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Alicia, age 45, is married and has two children aged 27 and 22. She is a member of the communal bank “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”'; the bank is located in the Oropesa village of the Quispicanchis province, which is part of the department of Cusco.

Alicia divides her time between her household work and her business of running a restaurant. Her restaurant is located in the beautiful and traditional bread-producing village of Oropesa; she works with two other people who help her with providing service to clients. 

Alicia is seeking a loan in order to purchase rice, cooking oil, soft drinks, and all the supplies necessary to run a restaurant; she would like to purchase from a wholesaler because that allows her to have lower costs and increase the earnings. She is very grateful for the loan and is committed to repaying it in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for a restaurant

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, de 40 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy responsable, esta casada con Fernando, de 42 años, ambos tienen 4 hijos, a los que cuida y educa en su casa propia ubicada, en la localidad de Santa Clara. La actividad, económica que desempeña, Margarita, es la agricultura, hace 10 años que se dedica al cuidado de sus terrenos de cultivo, donde siembre papa y arveja, en gran cantidad, que después de cada cosecha lo comercializa en el mercado central de la ciudad de “Tarma”, pero en campañas agrícolas, viaja constantemente a la capital para comercializar su producción, ahí obtiene mayores ganancias. Ella menciona que le gusta, trabajar en la agricultura, y aunque existan perdidas, ella afirma que,  “todo depende de la atención que le brinda a los terrenos”. Además tiene 7 vacas que cuida con mucha dedicación ya que le proporcionan leche, con lo que realiza queso; que vende en grandes cantidades a los comerciantes minoristas que llevan el queso en las ferias que se realizan los días jueves y domingos en la ciudad de Tarma. Por ello más adelante quiere comprar más terrenos agrícolas donde puede obtener mejores ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Trabajemos unidos”, y este es el noveno crédito con MFP donde se siente contenta de formar parte de uno de los bancos comunales, más sólidos de su localidad. Margarita, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico, que esparcirá en sus sembríos de arveja; asimismo sembrará papa de la variedad “única”, para lo que necesita comprar semilla.
texts.en:
Margarita, age 40, is a hard-working, responsible woman who is married to Fernando, age 42.  They have four children whom they care for and educate in their own home located in Santa Clara.  Margarita has been in agriculture for 10 years and takes care of her cropland where she grows potatoes and peas in large quantities.  After harvest she sells her produce in the central market in the city of "Tarma", but during the farming season she travels constantly to the capital to sell her products since she makes a better profit.

She claims she enjoys farming and, although sometimes crops suffer loss, she claims "it all depends on how much you care for the land".  She also has 7 cows that produce milk which she uses to make cheese.  She sells large quanitites to retail merchants that take the cheese to the Thursday and Sunday markets in Tarma.

In the future she would like to buy more farmland to increase her earnings.  She belongs to the communal bank "Trabajemos unidos" and this is her ninth loan through MFP.  She enjoys being a member of one of the most reputable banks in her town.  Margarita plans to use the loan to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer that she will use on her pea seedlings.  She also will plant "única" variety potatoes for which she must buy seed.

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic fertilizer and pea seedlings

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Zurite, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Paulina; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de animales como cuyes, chanchos y gallinas, ella vende en forma ambulatoria en la feria de inquilpata desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere amp0liar el negocio de venta de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los animales. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the "San Martin de Zurite" community bank which is located in Zurite district, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

Paulina is 52 years old, married, and has five children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling animals such as guinea pigs, pigs and hens.  She makes her sales in Inquilpata street market from 8.00am to 4.00pm and, through this business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Paulina would like to expand her animal sales business.  She is requesting this loan to buy feed for her animals.

Paulina is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Zurite, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Encarnacion; ella tiene 51 años de edad y es casada y tiene 9 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras, ella vende tomates, cebollas, zanahorias, pepinos, lechugas entre otras verduras, la socia vende las verduras en el mercado de Zurite desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Encarnación is a member of the "San Martin de Zurite" community bank which is located in Zurite district, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

Encarnación is 51 years old, married and has nine children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling vegetables.  She sells tomatoes, onions, carrots, cucumbers, lettuce and other vegetables.  She sells her products in Zurite market, from 7.00am to 1.00pm.  Through her business, she gets her children ahead in life.

Encarnación would like to expand her vegetable business.  She is requesting this loan to buy vegetables wholesale.  She is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Zurite, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sabina; ella tiene 48 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes y también vende productos secos como trigo, cebada y maíz y también vende verduras, ella vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia quiere ampliar sus negocios de venta de verduras, tienda de abarrotes y venta de productos secos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes y también para comprar verduras y productos secos al por mayor.
 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sabina, age 48, is married and has five children. She is a member of the communal bank  “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; the bank is located in the Zurite district of the Anta province which is part of the department of Cusco.

Sabina divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business where she also sells dry products such as wheat, barley, and corn; she also sells vegetables on the street. Sabina would like to expand her business and is seeking a loan to purchase inventory for the grocery store as well as to purchase vegetables and dry products from a wholesaler. She is happy about the loan and is committed to repaying it in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for a grocery store and to buy vegetables and other products wholesale

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 35 años, es una dichosa mujer que convive desde hace 15 años con Edwin, con quien tiene 3 hijos menores, a los que quiere mucho y educa en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Villa Visca. El trabajo al que se dedica desde muy joven es la agricultura. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, habas y arveja, los cuales siembra con ayuda de su esposo, quien además se dirige todas las mañanas al caserío de Tiambra; donde tiene pequeños sembríos. “Necesito sembrar en diferentes tierras para obtener sembríos de buena calidad”, afirma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las temporadas de lluvia, pues no necesita regar sus cultivos. Más le disgusta las plagas que llegan con esa época del año. Su principal inconveniente es la falta de capital de trabajo, ya que necesita fertilizar constantemente sus cultivos. Pero está segura que con la ayuda de su banco comunal que le motiva a ahorrar, muy pronto obtendrá el dinero necesario para comprar varias cabezas de carneros, con los que está pensando incursionar en la venta de carne. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Visca”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada. Ana, invertirá el dinero del crédito en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico, que esparcirá en sus sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
Ana, age 35, is a cheerful woman who have lived with her partner, Edwin, for 15 years.  They have three minor children whom they love and educate in their own home located in the rural area called Villa Visca.  She has worked in agricultural since she was very young.  Her main crops are potatoes, lima beans and peas, which she plants with the help of her husband, who also takes care of the Tiambra rural area every morning, where they have a small patch of cropland.

"I have to plant crops in different areas of land in order to get good quality.", she claims.  What she enjoys most about her work is the rainy season since she does not have to water her fields then.  What she dislikes are the plagues that arrive every year in that season.  Her main difficulty is the lack of working capital which she needs to constantly fertilize her crops.  But she is confident that with the help of the communal bank, which motivates her to save, soon she will have enough money to buy several head of sheep and can begin thinking about going into meat sales.

She belongs to the "Villa Visca" communal bank and this is her first loan through MFP.  She is grateful for the support and opportunity she is receiving.  Ana plans to use the loan to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer which she will use on her potato crop.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Tania Gladys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Oropesa,  provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Tania; es  casada, la socia tiene 53 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos de (24, 21) años de edad, la socia  alterna sus actividades del hogar con la administración y elaboración de panes, la socia casi al igual que todas sus compañeras miembros del banco comunal se dedican a la elaboración de panes, la socia compra insumos para la panadería y desea el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Tania, age 53, is married and has two children (ages 24 and 21). She is a member of the communal bank “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; the bank is located in the Oropesa settlement of the Quispicanchis province which is part of the department of Cusco.

Tania divides her time between her household work and baking bread; almost all of her fellow communal bank members are in the bread baking business. Tania is seeking a loan to purchase supplies for a bakery. She is very grateful for the loan and is committed to repaying it a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for a bakery

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Zurite, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alejandrina; ella tiene 45 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de palos, ella vende en forma ambulatoria, ella vende a personas que viven en el distrito de Zurite, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de palos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar palos al por mayor. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Alejandrina, 45, is a member of the “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE” communal bank located in Zurite District which belongs to Anta Province, Cusco Department.

She is married and has three children.  She alternates her daily chores with the sale of boards.  She sells in an ambulatory manner to people who live in Zurite District.  She wants to expand her board selling business and is asking for a loan to buy boards at wholesale.  She is happy about the loan and commits to pay her installments.

loans.use: to buy boards at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy land
